Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay when in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: Brenda T
Reviews.Content: We initially stayed at the Colonnade for my birthday weekend in February; enjoyed it so much we came back for an overnight with friends in March. The rooms are clean and spacious. The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful. Would come back every weekend if we could !!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Friendly Staff but needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: jointfixer
Reviews.Content: What this hotel lacks in luxury it makes up for with the extremely friendly and attentive staff. I love the location and the staff made us feel very welcome. Breakfast and in and out parking was included with our room, great deal. What I was not impressed with was the room cleanliness or size, the room was very dusty and the bathroom was in a word Dirty. I had to wipe the brown stains from the toilet seat, the room made me want to clean it. Not what you want to do on vacation. The rest of hotel common areas were the same. Dusty surfaces and smudge windows they need a serious spring cleaning. The gym was leaking water onto one of the exercise machine and down the wall. The beds not the most comfortable and the heating/AC very noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful night at a beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SoxGirl982
Reviews.Content: After having our reservation cancelled at the Hotel Buckminster due to the "Boston Blackout", we managed to book a room at the Colonnade. After hearing our tale, the staff could not have been any nicer, even suggesting a bar to get a drink at after the concert that we were headed too. Once in the beautiful room, I realized that I had forgotten my jeans. A quick call to the Concierge desk, and they were able to tell me that the Marshalls on Boylston Street was indeed open and gave me perfect directions to the store. Room was wonderful. Bathroom was nice and clean (loved the rubber duck!) Bed was perfect (our only complaint was that the pillows were a little too soft), so nice to come back to after standing all night at the concert. Loved that they provided a Keurig coffee maker in the room, such a nice modern touch! All and all a wonderful stay after a very hectic day. Can not wait to come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: NapaWineLover
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Colonnade while my husband was in town on business. We'd been here before and looked forward to coming back. Our room this time was not quite as nice as what we had before but still a very nice room. The bathroom for this stay was pretty small but we'd had a nice big bath the last visit so I don't know if this was just luck of the draw or what. You'll get a cute little rubber duckie to take home to remember your stay! The only thing I disliked was that the iHome clock was very, very bright. It was not until the day we left that I realized it had a dimmer button (same button as the snooze) that would have made sleeping much easier. We got room service for breakfast two days and it was very prompt and courteous. I had a bit of a disappointing lunch at Brasserie Jo with really slow service but this may have just been a bad waiter as we'd had good luck there on our prior visit. Great location across from the Prudential Center and an easy walk to Newbury Street.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly updated hotel, average service, and good location”
Reviews.Author: jetsetter_chi
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Colonnade on a recent trip to Boston for business. The best part of the hotel is the location, and that's not really a huge advantage considering that there are number of great hotels that are within 1-2 blocks of this hotel. The room itself was nice, looks like it has been recently renovated. But there are lots of strange little things in the room that keep this a good/average hotel. For example the bathroom is small and the doors open from the middle and don't close completely -- they have a 1/2 inch slit in the middle of them that is just awkward. The blinds were strangely difficult to close in our room which was annoying. We had a minibar in our room, but were not given the key to it (had to ask for that separately). And my wake-up call was about 15 minutes late the first day; again not a huge deal, but an example of average, not great, service. One thing I did like about the room is that there's a button on the inside that you can push and a "do not disturb" light will show outside the room. That's a cool feature I have not seen before, and very convenient. Overall this is an average hotel, and I would probably stay somewhere else on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Power cut - and we were still charged!”
Reviews.Author: soph_dixon
Reviews.Content: Normally I would write a really good review of this hotel (stayed here twice in the last month) but I got a rude awakening when I received a bill for a night we stayed despite no lights, no electricity, no hot water, people smoking pot on our corridor (which we could smell in our room), lifting our bags 7 flights, no food, no coffee etc etc. How can you charge full price when all we got is a bed to sleep on. I am shocked and it would stop me staying here again given there are plenty of other hotels in the neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Extreamly nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: MagnÃºs S
Reviews.Content: Great location, luxurious and overall very nice hotel with extreamly helpful and friendly staff. Room was big and beds very comfortable. Internet access possible through the flat screen TV in the room. To mention somtething that could be improved, it would be the sound/noise isolation of the door to the hallway.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bed!”
Reviews.Author: Biondana
Reviews.Content: Spacious, sunny rooms. Very comfortable King size bed, soft pillows and duvet. Service courteous. Not tried the breakfast or wireless connection. Excellent location and close to good restaurants. What should become a problem are the thin walls .. who is in the hallway can listen to what goes on inside the rooms and vice versa.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay!”
Reviews.Author: BillA44535
Reviews.Content: I can't even begin to describe how positive my experience with The Colonnade Hotel was. I am delighted to write this positive recommendation to anyone interested in an incredible experience at one of, in my opinion, Boston's best hotels. Our request for early check-in was graciously accomodated, our room was beautiful and had an incredible view of the city. We were always greeted with warm greetings and every effort was made to ensure that our stay was more than we hoped for. You can NOT beat the service or quality for the value. I highly recommend The Colonnade Hotel to anyone interested in a perfectly located, clean, friendly, and luxurious modern Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Experience”
Reviews.Author: Bridgett C
Reviews.Content: I just can't say how great my latest visit to the Colonnade was. From Nuala's greeting at the entrance to Norman's help with my luggage and securing my cabs my experience was first class. This hotel has been totally remodeled and everything about it exudes service and class. Mike was one of the best room service waiters I have ever experienced and I travel for a living. Sheb offers outstanding concierge service. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “I'd call it excellent”
Reviews.Author: mrd0bs0n
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with the exceptional level customer service from the staff at the Colonnade. The hotel room was spacious and laid out very well. The food at Brasserie Jo was delectable and worth every penny. I would recommend this boutique hotel to my friends, family and colleagues; I plan on making this place THE hotel I stay at when visiting Boston. My only complaint is that there wasn't any 'sugar in the raw' available in the hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic find -- a little slice of Paris in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Mikey013
Reviews.Content: Not the first place that comes to mind when I think of the Back Bay of Boston, but what a great find. The service is outstanding. Rooms are good size, clean, modern. Location is great -- not far from pretty much everything in the Back Bay; the city is small so everything is a quick T ride or cab away if you don't feel like walking. Parking is a pain but that's the case everywhere in Boston. Tip: Grab a glass of wine at the bar and you'll think you're in Paris. The rooftop pool was closed for the season when I was there but it looks like it would be a blast.

Reviews.Title: “Soo comfortable and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: misspuff
Reviews.Content: The bed was soo comfortable and the room clean and relaxing. Wireless internet was easy to use. The best part was the very helpful and friendly staff at the front desk who patiently answered all my questions and gave me perfect directions to all my destinations. I would definitely recommend this hotel. I just wish there was an indoor pool!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: CACoastGal
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay here! The location was great! Close to shopping, cultural attractions and great restaurants. The guest service was excellent. Jimmy, the bellman exemplified excellent service and was very engaging. I would stay here again and hope to be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “I've stayed at many great boston hotels, The Collonade is my first choice!”
Reviews.Author: pamstone
Reviews.Content: Great service....Great room...great location! !!...?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with personalized service”
Reviews.Author: PlatoPutas
Reviews.Content: While planning my first trip to Boston, I have to admit I was taken aback by how high the hotels were priced. For some reason I didn't expect that the prices would rival staying in Manhattan and at the same time, the number of hotels seemed limited. Thanks to a tripadvisor and a decent amount of research time, I had a terrific stay at The Colonnade Hotel in October, regardless of the freak snowstorm that blew through the city during our 4-day/3-night stay. We were celebrating my travel partner's birthday and the hotel kindly accommodated my request for a high floor and quiet room, and even left a lovely note with cheese and fruit platter for us on the first night. It was a thoughtful gesture and I really appreciate that the general manager took the time to acknowledge the special occasion. The King Luxe Room is a good size, very cleanly decorated with modern furnishings (think boutique hotel) and the bed is incredibly comfortable. The thin sliding door to the bathroom isn't ideal but the bathroom itself is very clean and the Thymes amenities are of good quality. There's even a yellow rubber ducky waiting for you on the bathtub ledge. The location is very convenient with a T (subway) station directly out front, which we used everyday as it was very easy to explore the city by subway and bus. The Fenway Park tour and visit to Harvard were highlights, along with great meals at Toro (tapas), Union Bar & Grill (brunch), Neptune Oyster and Oleana (Eastern Mediterranean). I wouldn't hesitate to recommend The Colonnade Hotel and would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Judith and Nadia...Very Good Base to see Boston.”
Reviews.Author: judithlowe
Reviews.Content: We had a great week in Boston staying at the Colonnade. It was very clean and comfortable and the bathroom was excellent. The hotel staff were very helpful and polite, especially Norman. If I visited Boston again, I would definately stay at the Colonnade Hotel and would recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasent Stay at the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Karan B
Reviews.Content: First time to Boston and at Colonnade, it was a comfortable experience staying for 3 nights at the hotel. The staff was helpful and courteous. Room were nicely made, washer room was clean. In room entertainment i.e. TV and Radio was good and lots to choose from. Nice table and chairs to sit comfortably - either work on the laptop or watch your favorite program. Proximity to Prudential mall 1 min walk and Back Bay station 5 min walk and about 20 minutes ride to the Logan airport. It was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Good but...”
Reviews.Author: lambi93
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was very nice, the rooms were quite spacious though the bathrooms can be a little small. Also there is a slit in the bathroom door a little awkward if you're sharing with friends. Also, great location which is probably it's biggest selling point! However, and this is the only reason I'm giving it 3 stars there was a problem with my debit card. I asked when we checked in to ensure that nothing would be charged to my debit card given that I would be paying with a different card at the end of the trip (I didn't have it on me at said time). The receptionist was very polite and said it was only for their record. Though the card itself wasn't charged they put a hold on all of the money on my account which was substantially more than the room was worth. When i realized this and called the hotel they apologized and said it was standard procedure. I would have been okay with them not telling me this if i hadn't asked but I had very clearly given that I needed the debit card for something else. They tried to redirect me to accounting where I got a busy tone for a few days. The receptionist said it should be fixed 1-2 days but it took 4. I understood that this may be procedure but they absolutely need to be more clear. Otherwise a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: JessLH
Reviews.Content: The staff is super helpful and friendly. The room was spotlessly clean. But the best part of the room was the bed! It was magnificent! It was really comfortable not to mention huge. The large amount of high quality pillows only added to this. I would recommend this hotel who is coming to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem in crown jewel city of Boston”
Reviews.Author: GDRS
Reviews.Content: I really cannot overstate how happy my party of three was with the Colonnade Hotel! The staff bent over backwards to make us comfortable and assist us with dinner reservations and a city tour. The housekeeping staff was a seasoned group to attended to our every need, as well. I look forward to staying here, again, and again. The bar has been raised for affordability and overall rating of excellent!!

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Party”
Reviews.Author: steve z
Reviews.Content: The staff was very attentive especialy Nuala Creedon and Elizabeth who works the front desk.The weather was warm for febuary and the air conditioning was not on.A call to the concierge enabled us to have a fan brought to our room .After opening the window the room was cool..The room was nice and clean, but dated,but the bathroom had been remodeled.. .Bell Hops were always ready to flag a cab, give directions, or reccommend a place to visit.. Great location but for four days a bit pricey..

Reviews.Title: “Colonnade Hotel Boston”
Reviews.Author: DAVID P
Reviews.Content: Great service, nice rooms, and fair price. I have been staying at the hotel every year two or three times a year and the quality was consistent. Pricing is very reasonable. But what I really like there is the way bellmen, receptionists and waiters deal with you, nicely and in a personnalized way. Rooms are clean, no show-off.

Reviews.Title: “Great one-night business stay - personal touches make a difference”
Reviews.Author: mcamus
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my one-night stay at the Colonnade - our corporate rate gave us a discount on a meal at Brasserie Jo plus a voucher for a taxi ride to our office and frequent flyer miles at a choice of airlines -- really nice. Hallways a bit dark but room was lovely with little touches of luxury. The shower fixture knob was stuck so I called down and they sent someone up right away to fix it -- great service!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: karen m
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice to visit colleges and conservatories. The location is perfect with everything within walking distance. The hotel is excellent. Rooms have everything you could need including wine glasses and opener and the beds are very comfortable. Street noise is minimal. We stayed on a lower floor the first time which was fine except for hearing people's doors close. Received a top floor room the second time and unfortunately it looked like someone had a brawl in the room. The dressers were scratched, walls marked up, curtain torn. It did not ruin my stay, but I would hesitate to take a top floor room again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful brasserie”
Reviews.Author: gillianholt
Reviews.Content: We went to JoÂ´s brasserie at the Colonnade Hotel on a very cold night in February after a late flight from Europe.The food all smelt amazing, we had a platter of charcuterie to match anything in France and a really good steak.A fine meal and no problems to take the wonderful leftovers with us.Would recommend this reataurant.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant one night stay at the Colonnade.”
Reviews.Author: Regina T
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Colonnade for the first time this past weekend for just a one night stay on Saturday. We had never considered staying here before however my husband won a gift certificate to the hotel so we decided to give it a try. The room which had a rate of $ 209 per night was really great. The decor was more modern than I would prefer but it was tasteful, clean, and very comfortable. Can't say enough about location! Perfect for walking, shopping,dinning and sight seeing. In the future , I know i would recommend this hotel to any out of town guests looking for an affordable hotel in a great location. Lastly, the staff all seemed to care about making people happy. After coming in from a run we were offered a bottle of water and a small towel by a staff member in the lobby. Nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, Great Concierge Service, Wonderful Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Nicole B
Reviews.Content: I planned a surprise overnight trip to Boston on the 19th and 20th, for my boyfriends birthday. I wanted it to be a memorable birthday. I planned a surprise trip to Blue Man Group (which was within walking distance, which was nice). Although, this hotel was walking distance to many great spots in Boston (The Prudential Center, Copley Square & Newbury Street, just to name a few). Seeing as this was a birthday gift I wanted there to be some surprise at the hotel, for when we arrived back to the room after our show. I called about a week in advance and spoke with Jerry the manager of Concierge about what my thoughts were. I wanted to have a big bouquet of balloons, a cake and some champagne to celebrate. Jerry made a couple calls about balloons and called me right back with the best deal he found, then he told me the name of one of his staff members, Eric, that would be working on the day we would arrive. Eric was very accommodating and set everything up perfectly, and kept it a surprise. My boyfriend had no clue, it was amazing. Our room was just beautiful, very very clean, beds were extremely comfortable, the city view was amazing, the mini bar was well stocked, everything was just perfect. The hotel was pricier than I typically would pay, but for the occasion, I knew it would be worth it. However, now that I have stayed here and know all that the Colonnade has to offer I would stay here every time I come to Boston. I honestly cannot say enough about this hotel, words really don't do it justice. Just know if you choose to stay here you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Third time back but not the last! GREAT people, GREAT hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kiki7
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Colonnade on two previous occasions and have no idea why I would stay anywhere else! This hotel was recently remodelled, though there are some minor reminders of its previous life (such as the old elevators and somewhat dark halls) the remodel was worth every penny! The rooms are well planned and modern, the beds are beyond comfortable, the room and lobby are well kept, clean and new, the location could not be any better! The most impressive thing about this hotel to me (besides the fab rooms for a good price) are the people! They are beyond friendly and helpful! The bellman/woman are beyond helpful, front desk will go out of their way to help you with anything, room service, well I cannot say enough about them. For example I ordered room service on two occasions, the person taking my order apologized but said they did not have diet coke in the hotel, which I was fine with. When my meal was delivered by the same lovely woman my tray had a diet coke....and explained that she knew I preferred it and remembered they had one left from an event earlier! This is customer service ( I believe her name was Catherine but I am not certain!) The same with the front desk, where Sunnie greets you with a smile and never says no...simply that he will do his best...which seems to go well beyond what other hotels will do! I had spilled something on my one and only coat during my flight, Sunnie took my dry cleaning that night and said he would try and get it back to me asap (as you cannot survive in Boston in the winter without a coat). It was in my room in a speedy manner and the cleaning was not only well done but very reasonable. I cannot say enough about my experience here and I cannot wait to go back! And to add the cherry on top heir prices are reasonable! I would stay at the Colonnade any day over my experience at the W, where I previously stayed! Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: midsusan
Reviews.Content: For the 4th or 5th time, I stayed at the Colonnade Hotel in Boston for a weekend getaway. Although we couldn't use their Frosty Friday promotion (we stayed Saturday and Sunday nights), it was priced right for what was offered. We had tickets for concerts and the location was perfect for us to get to Symphony Hall and the Berklee Performance Center. It was great to be able to go to Brasserie Jo after the concerts and have drinks. The room was great, the hotel is not noise despite being on Huntington Ave. Would stay their again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: MaestroJ123
Reviews.Content: On a recent extended visit to Boston (2+ weeks), we were lucky enough to stay at the Colonnade Hotel. This hotel is head and shoulders above other area hotels! The rooms are decorated with a quiet sophistication that is very comfortable (feather pillows and comforter, wool throw blanket), and every person we encountered on the staff - from housekeeping to the front desk - was helpful, courteous, and kind. The attached restaurant, Brasserie Jo, not only has very delicious food and a charming atmosphere, but also some of the best service we have encountered anywhere. As a whole, the service in the hotel was exceptional, and we want to thank in particular the front desk staff, concierge Jerry Good, and doorman Norman Maines. This hotel is superb in every respect, we could not recommend it more highly - we would never think of staying anywhere else in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable/Low Key/Great Location”
Reviews.Author: 45992Mary
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights at the Colonnade Hotel in Boston with teenager looking at colleges. Great service, clean and quiet. The location is perfect. We had a bit of noise from our neighbors the first evening and the front desk was happy to move us to a new room on top floor. Rooms are a bit small, but have all the updated amenities. Bathroom small but charming. Enjoyed the french bistro next door. Not your typical big chain hotel... Will stay again, would love to come in summer when pool is open.

Reviews.Title: “A romantic and cultural weekend in Boston”
Reviews.Author: pwennik
Reviews.Content: With two terrific cultural events in Boston that we had to see, we chose The Colonnade hotel to stay at for several reasons. Location: The Degas exhibit at The Museum Of Fine Arts(just stunning!) was right up the street-so convenient. Symphony Hall(with David Zinman conducting Beethoven, Strauss, etc-wonderful) was a pleasant very close walk. The concierge was most helpful in guiding us and the staff was most polite and thoughtful. Our room was immaculate and quiet--where to get those great pillows?-so soft. We love the elegant hotel dining room menu but just had urge for burgers, fries and a scallop appetizer. I'm a burger junkie--have them all over country, but--one of the very best I've ever had!--asked, and-yes, they grind their own premium beef. Everything was yummy. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Sigurbjorg
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband just came home after 5 days trip to Boston MA. We enjoyed our stay very much at The Colonnade Hotel and we will definitely stay there again the next time we are in Boston. The hotel is perfectly located and the accommodation is both comfortable and elegant. The staff is professional, courteous, helpful and friendly. We would like to thank them all very much for making our trip more pleasant. Special thanks to Nuala Creedon for all her assistant and for making the stay there more memorable. SigurbjÃ¶rg and Kristmundur

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in the heart of Back Bay/Copley Square”
Reviews.Author: CandaceCarlisle
Reviews.Content: Loved it! Has its own unique style that sets it apart from other hotels. Amazing job on the renovation. It's a gorgeous place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Gugi9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Colonnade because we had tickets to the Huntington Theater and it was close by, and I got a good rate from a discount hotel website. The hotel has very attractive public spaces and the rooms are nicely decorated and comfortable. The only negative we had was the noise between the rooms. We could hear doors slamming in the hall and some conversation from other rooms. We would stay here again, however.

Reviews.Title: “Great Costumer Service”
Reviews.Author: Matthew H
Reviews.Content: When I stayed at the Colonnade while I took an audition at the nearby New England Conservatory, I forgot to pack a collar shirt to wear to my audition. When I asked one of the hotel's staff workers where was the nearest retail store that was open on a Sunday morning, he went out of his way to ask the doorman, Aiden, if I could barrow one of his extra shirts. This was a life saver.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but a no sound proofing”
Reviews.Author: Bkasrel
Reviews.Content: Great hotel overall. Very good location, nice lobby and public areas. Staff was pretty friendly. As others have pointed out, hallways are dark but that is no big deal. Nice renovation in the rooms and the bed is very comfy. The ONE bad point is there is no sound proofing between the rooms and you can hear ever conversation and nearby door slam. Net is this a great place, just bring ear plugs for the sleeping part.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boston Hotel”
Reviews.Author: abcd1120
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Colonnade last month, and were extremely pleased with this hotel. The room was spacious and nicely appointed, and was clean and comfortable. We asked for and received a room on an upper floor that was in the back and therefore sheltered from the sounds of the street. I appreciated that they did not have one of those awful computerized minibars - that enabled us to store some OJ for the morning. We liked the location of the hotel, which was right across the street from the Prudential Center, providing easy access for shopping and dining. A subway stop was just outside the entrance of the hotel - most convenient. The staff is friendly and professional and works hard to please. On future trips to the Boston area we hope to once again stay at the Colonnade.

Reviews.Title: “Home Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Edward T
Reviews.Content: Thank you for being Home Friendly by taking us in after experiencing poor service down the street. Your Desk Personal were rewardingly professional, helpful, knowledgeable and all round family friendly. Could not have asked for a cleaner or more comfortable accomodation. Y'all helped make our stay in Boston a rewarding experience.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Glen Head, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Staff went above and beyond....”
Reviews.Author: SandraNightingale
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in several hotels in Boston and Cambridge and the staff here was by far the friendliest and most accomodating. Our first night we were in room 1107 top floor, lovely room, but got no sleep due to loud obnoxious people screaming and partying until 3 am in the connecting room. We asked the front desk if those same people would be staying a second night to which they responded yes, so we immediately requested a room change. Karen at reception expeditiously got us into a corner room with no connecting room (room 705) and called our room later on in the day to make sure everything was ok. Our second night's stay was quiet and peaceful and the beds were heavenly! I also want to mention Jimmy Good - the concierge - who was especially friendly and helpful in recommending restaurants and making reservations. The location can't be beat - real close to shopping at prudential center and copley. The food at Brasserie Jo was also execellent, as were the bartenders there! Will definitely stay there again when the weather is warm to use the rooftop pool and bar!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Bali4eva
Reviews.Content: After countless hours scouring the net we finally settled on The Colonnade. Even though a lovely hotel with very spacious modern rooms, I found that service was lacking, especially after the wonderful service we experienced in New York City Yes, it is a modern hotel with good amenities, and is very well located, but unfortunately for us, the service ruined our 3 night stay. I must commend Eric the concierge., and the lovely bellman we encountered on arrival(his name escapes me) , but everyone else was just so so. I am an I Prefer member and meant to receive extras such as complimentary internet, free upgrade, and welcome amenity; none of these were offered, and even after saying I was a member at check in, we were still charged for internet, and told that we would have to pay for an upgrade! It's little things like that which made our stay less than enjoyable. Another annoying thing was that the room attendants strart cleaning very early and are very noisy, this woke us on two mornings. All in all, an ok stay, but I would personally try a different hotel if ever in Boston again.

Reviews.Title: “Beantown Bliss”
Reviews.Author: Greg M
Reviews.Content: Just a short note to tip my cap to the staff at the Colonnade Hotel in Boston for a wonderful stay for an important business trip in a snow storm...... I have been a TV sportscaster and often come to Boston to work games. I went to school locally at Northeastern University and had never set foot inside this facility before but after the way we were treated I will return and request the Colonnade on all my trips to the Hub. Special tip to the staff.....who assisted every request including Brian Comeau and the front desk team lead by Sonny ....everyone was very professional and courteous at all times. -GM, Middlebury, CT

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience - highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: RuthPC
Reviews.Content: Whether personal or business-related travel, I'd highly recommend this hotel. It's located within walking distance of a lot of shopping/restaurants and the staff was wonderful. The room was very clean and modern with super-luxurious bed linens (Frette brand). You really could not ask for more in a hotel especially at their price-point. Nothing at all to stop me from staying there again. :)

Reviews.Title: “Average...”
Reviews.Author: Voyageur_Monde
Reviews.Content: In general, the hotel is in good shape. Fast check-in and check-out and nice room and bed. I've stayed there a few times and I've always felt like a stranger... The employees will not greet you and I would say they are all indifferent. One time I had asked for a front facing room and the front desk promised they would move me to a new room the next day. Well, they never bothered to do anything. Another day I forgot to bring my slippers so I asked for a pair from the hotel; they do not carry any. The Internet will cost you extra and the speed is excruciating slow. The gym is OK, it has just the basics. The pool does not work for most of the year. The restaurant is mediocre and the breakfast is extra. The location is great. In overall, you can find a better hotel in the area for the same money.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay and will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: redcarnations208
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Boston Marriott at Copley Place previously but found the hotel too crazy with no interaction with the staff except at check in. Read the good reviews from Tripadvisor and decided to stay at the Colonnade Hotel later that week. Enjoyed the relaxed peaceful atmosphere. The staff was friendly and courteous and our room was comfortable. Enjoyed breakfast at the hotel restaurant and delighted on a delicious waffle with seasonal berries. Nice European feel to the hotel. Convenient to the T since the station is steps away in front of the hotel and across the street from the Copley Place shopping mall.

Reviews.Title: “Confused?”
Reviews.Author: Lando978
Reviews.Content: So I booked the Luxury Double Double Suite for $859.00 but when I came to my room I'm pretty sure they gave me the Parlor Double Double Suite instead. The Parlor Double Double Suite is $629.00 a night but when I told them they gave me the wrong room they tried telling me it was the same room as I booked. Clearly I'm paying a couple hundred more for the wrong room. SMH. Btw its a nice hotel still.

Reviews.Title: “Modern elegance”
Reviews.Author: musiclady17
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Colonnade for my December birthday. Our room was lovely and modern with a gorgeous city view. It was especially nice during the holiday season. Very clean and spacious. Comfortable bed. Nice bathroom. We also enjoyed the American breakfast in the morning as part of our package. Great location for visiting the MFA and there are good restaurants nearby. We ate at Lucca, one block away and loved it. I highly recommend this hotel, especially in the winter when the rates are down.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room and very convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: Screenname617
Reviews.Content: Very much enjoyed a winter holiday weekend stay. Super convenient location in Back Bay. The Prudential T-stop is just outside the lobby on the same block, with entrance to the Prudential mall right across the street, and close proximity to restaurants. The room was very clean, with modern minimalist styling, big window, flat screen tv, clock radio with iPod dock, Keurig coffee maker, and complimentary rubber duck, among other amenities. Prompt and courteous service. Late check-out, no problem. No issues. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Zizza55
Reviews.Content: We staid in the Colonnade Hotel in April 11 for 3 nights and we loved every second of it. From the moment in which we entered the hall, everybody was very kind and polite. The staff was very helpfull and the checking was very fast. Our room was facing the back, therefore it was very quiet. The room itself was impressive: huge, modern furnishings, DVD player, Internet etc. the bed was one of the best in which I have ever been. The bathroom though, was quite small, especially if we compare to the rest of facilities. Breakfast wasn't included, but we didn't have problems finding good food since on the other site of the street, there is Cheesecake Factory :) This hotel in not located in the center, so who's looking for the a very central spot wouldn't be pleased. Otherwise, I'd definitely recommend the Colonnade Hotel to everybody!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect New Year's Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Betty M
Reviews.Content: My family and I enjoyed an incredible stay over New Year's Eve weekend at the Colonnade Hotel in Boston. We were very impressed with their customer service. The concierge team was very helpful with our questions about the events in the Boston area. Their knowledge of what the city had to offer was very impressive. The rooms were designed beautifully and provided awesome views of the city. I cannot remember the last time I had a hotel stay that was this perfect. I will book my next stay in Boston at the Colonnade without hesitation!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: CBG1918
Reviews.Content: Our stay was a combination of business and pleasure. The hotel gets high marks in all respects. The staff went out of it's way to make our stay enjoyable. Lovely, quiet room, great housekeeping, awesome shower, and a really great location. Special thanks to Sonny, who checked us in and very patiently allowed us to find just the right room. We would recommend the hotel very highly. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Margaret H
Reviews.Content: Took a friend here for her 50th birthday, I've stayed a few times before on business with the firm picking up the tab and always happy. This time stayed 3 nights at my expense and very well worth it, from the speedy, friendly check in, one of the concierges took us and out bags to the room and gave us lots of info. The room was on the top floor, great views, spotlessly clean, fabulously comfortable beds, huge flat screen tv, good bathroom with a floor to ceiling mirrored wall, good powerful shower and a proper hairdryer. Cannot fault the staff here, from reception, Bell hops, Conceirge, bar staff to the Housekeeping staff, unfailingly polite and helpful. On my friends birthday, we returned to out room in the afternoon to find a bottle of Champagne on ice, with 2 flutes and a lovely letter from the hotel manager, a super touch. The location is ideal, right across the street from The Prudential Mall, connected by a walkway to the Copley Place Mall, and it's also a shortcut to the shops, bars and restaurants of Boylston St...very useful to get there under cover when the temperature is -8C! The Old Town Trolley Tour picks up from the hotel door and runs every 15-20 mins all day, a multi day ticket was about $48 and good for 7 consecutive days. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this great, individual hotel ( on prev visits in summer I've enjoyed the rooftop pool and bar as well). Thanks to all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Colonnade Stay jan. 2012”
Reviews.Author: Wendy T
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this hotel. The rooms are immaculately clean, spacious and very comfortable.The hotel staff is accessible at all times and very helpful and eager to help in any way they can. This hotel is conveniently located, within walking distance to shopping, restaurants and fenway park. The hotel restaurant is wonderful with a great menu. Overall, a great place to stay in Boston!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: David C
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Colonnade for four nights for a recent conference. It is immediately adjacent to numerous things: a T connection, two fair-sized shopping plazas, several restaurants, and the Hynes Convention Center. Further, the staff was super friendly and super helpful. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: JenMalen
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Colonnade Hotel was perfect in every way. The location was convenient to all of Bostons sights and sounds. The rooms were clean, neat and a fresh smell permeated the air. Dinner the first night was conveniently located directly across the street at the Cheesecake Factory (highly recommend). We walked off dinner with a stroll down Boylston St and then over to Newbury St. Next morning we walked to the Public Gardens, the State House and around the common with at stop at the Paramount on Charles St (was a recommendation and glad we stopped). The Colonnade's convenience and location was everything we were looking for in a Boston hotel. The staff was always available and extremely helpful with recommendations and directions. Our only regret was that we didn't visit while the roof top pool was open, however we do plan on coming back in the summer months to take advantage of that.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and cozy”
Reviews.Author: dzul
Reviews.Content: Check-in was smooth. The king size bed was really comfortable. My room, which was in the highest floor (11th floor) comes with 40" HDTV, a DVD player, a fridge and a bathroom with a combined shower/tub. The $229 rate included the overnight parking and breakfast. It's very convenient as the hotel is located opposite the Prudential Center where you can find variety of shops and restaurants. American Breakfast was simple but superb in the hotel's restaurant, Brasserie Jo. The rooftop pool is great. I would highly recommend this hotel; good for business and leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Good postion”
Reviews.Author: g230
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night good postion close to Cheesecake factory . Walking distance to Market and waterfront. Room very pleasent beds so comfortable floor to celing windows with great view form 11th floor. Bathroon modern plenty of towels . Flat screen TV coffee machine. Bar very expensive as you would expect for city hotel Dont attempt to carry an 18 pack of beer from suppermarket through the lobby to the room to bring home to UK as you are not allowed to carry beer without it being covered with carrier bags!!!!!!! Had to take it back outside and wrap it up - How mad !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Lynda21
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the colonnade for 3 nights with 2 friends. Room wasn't huge but was big enough for 3 of ius and our cases etc. Lovely tv, coffee machine, modern bathroom. Service at concierge desk a little grumpy but reception were always more than happy to help. Free wifi in the lobby and a gorgeous restaurant in hotel. Hotel is directly opposite the prudential mall, cheesecake factory and of changs also starbucks across street. Will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Boston 12/11”
Reviews.Author: SonofDon
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Colonnade and it was worth the wait. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location is excellent with much of Boston within walking distance and very easy to get to.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Molly M
Reviews.Content: I have been to this hotel approx 6 times over the past few years and have never been disappointed. First of all, it is beautiful & clean. The staff are friendly and helpful. Any requests you make are usually no problem at all. I always request a room on a high floor overlooking Huntington Ave, as the view is beautiful, esp at night, through the all-glass exterior wall. I also request late check-out, which is usually available, allowing you to stay until 2 pm. The beds are very comfortable, which is huge for me, having herniated discs in my back. The doormen will assist you with hailing a cab and there is a T-stop directly across the street. It's also across the street from the Prudential Center mall, The Cheesecake Factory, & a P.F. Changs. There is also a wonderful little breakfast place a block away on Huntington Ave called Thornton's that I highly recommend. I have stayed at other hotels in the area for around the same price & was disappointed after having stayed here. Now, I just don't go anywhere else. Everyone I've brought there has loved it too. It's my favorite by far!

Reviews.Title: “Good business-class hotel”
Reviews.Author: HowardMinnesota
Reviews.Content: Not a bad place if you need a hotel in a central Boston location. Not much terribly memorable either, except for the obsessively elaborate bedding -- tons of pillows and spreads. My only problem was that the equipment in the workout room ("more than 10 machines") was dated by at least a decade and the workout room itself was excessively hot on the sunny morning that I used it because there were no window shades to keep out the morning sun. All told, however, I think it is a pleasant hotel that you can count on.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite Boston hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkerJournalist
Reviews.Content: Sometimes I'll pass on writing another glowing review for a hotel that already has a long list of positive reviews, but in this case, I wanted to again praise a fantastic hotel. Especially because we were travelling with three toddlers, and when a hotel can cater to us and impress, it definitely makes mom and dad's job easier! We stayed here for 5 days in October, and had two adjoining rooms. My husband had a conference just up the street at the huge Marriott.That place is a zoo, and it takes 10 minutes just to wait for an elevator. I'm so glad we chose the Colonnade! Service was excellent. Service with a smile. Front desk staff was courteous and helpful. I'm blanking on the bellhop, but I think his name was Danny, the older gentleman who's been there for several years. Very knowledgeable & friendly, and he and the other bellhops were always happy to greet my children and carry our bags. In the room, the kids cribs were standard cribs, but decent, not pack n plays, which is often the case. And they brought us several rubber ducks for the kids. Everyone also enjoyed the floor to ceiling glass windows that lined the room. Wow!! Kids loved watching the people, buses, firetrucks, etc...and because of that, I would recommend getting a higher-floor room which will be quieter. There are black-out shades, so no worries about sunlight and all those windows. Rooms were clean, modern, nicely-sized (not huge, but not cramped either), beds were incredibly comfortable, nice sheets, etc. The bathroom was a little small, but it was clean and new, so that wasn't a problem for us. (but if you need a large bathroom, you may want to look elsewhere) Housekeeping was very efficient, and they were friendly, always happy to greet my family, ask if they could help, etc. The only negative that I found was that the hallways are dark. If I had vision problems, or perhaps if I was an elderly guest, I might have trouble finding my room or finding my way to the elevator! I think they should raise the lighting in the halls, but other than that, I can't find fault w/the hotel. Fitness facility was good, variety of cardio and weights. Clean, well ventilated. (according to the husband, I did not use this time) We had breakfast one morning at the brasserie, and it was very good, tasty, but service was a little slow. Lots of fresh choices on the menu, and that place usually looked busy, breakfast, lunch and dinner. I wouldn't hesitate to eat there again, and just hope for more efficient service next time. Location is excellent, but again it just depends on your travel plans. We were in town for a conference.There are probably equally nice hotels in more touristy areas, or perhaps if we were there for Head of the Charles, for example, I might stay somewhere else. Tip for families w/small children--there's a great playground just down the street, around the corner and down a few blocks, by a church. Also, you're across from the Prudential Center (shopping), Shaw's supermarket, Cheesecake Factory, and plenty of other stores & restaurants. Also, you're a short walk to Boylston, Newbury, The Back Bay, etc. (also across the street for Duck Tours, for those inclined to do that!!) We really enjoyed our stay, and we will certainly stay here again without hesitation. Feel free to email me w/any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: LKWendel
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised at the excellent service I received at this hotel. The rooms were very comfortable, although slightly crammed. The view of the city was pleasant and the beds were very comfortable. The location was excellent as we could walk to most attractions in the city and there was a subway stop across the street (Copley Square). My only complaints were 1. the parking. It was expensive whether at the hotel or elsewhere. This could be a function of the city. We were staying slightly more than 24 hours, but for that extra hour, we had to pay for a full day ($36!). 2. I was also frustrated by the wifi at the hotel. They charged for it (disappointing) but if you tried to use 3G, there was no service in the hotel. However, if you went down to the lobby or just outside the doors, you had free wifi service. Breakfast and lunch was excellent--superb food! Overall a very nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Professionalism Par Excellence”
Reviews.Author: SaltRiverFarm
Reviews.Content: I originally chose The Colonnade due to the convenience of its location to a top-flight Boston restaurant where my wife and I were attending a celebratory dinner. As I came to realize, the hotel's location is remarkably convenient to an impressive number of upscale dining options and to some of the best shopping Boston has to offer. We parked conveniently right in the hotel building which is not always the case in Boston. We were checked in courteously and efficiently by a desk clerk who treated us as though we were weekly guests. As we opened our guestroom door, we were met by a friendly woman who had just turned down our bed. She did her best to refuse the tip I eventually had to force on her. Our room was spotless. I know this hotel has been around for many years, but the decor was current, trendy and fun. The sound machine playing seagulls was our first hint that all necessary technology was in place. Sound dock, oversized flatscreen with plenty of channel options and DVD player. There was an in-room safe to protect my laptop. Lighting was high tech and totally functional from places to read to places to shave. The bathroom fixtures, mirror, make-up mirrors and soap products smacked of first-class boutique. The shower provided welcome serious force. It was impossible to find fault with any of the facilities, but even more impressive was the hotel staff. Our check-in was warm and flawless. There was an extraordinary presence of managers and employees in the lobby everytime we passed. Concierges were a centerpiece. Doormen and bellmen were visibly active and soliciting opportunities to help. My wife even struck up a lengthy conversation with a plain clothes security guard. We appreciate the security they provide. This guy added unexpected touches of personality and hospitality. We enjoyed very professional service at Brasserie Jo, the hotel restaurant, for breakfast. I'm not just talking the server, but the busboy whose duties apparently included serving water and coffee. The menu was French and fun. Everyone with whom we interacted at The Colonnade was professional in appearance, anxious to help and most knowledgeable. This is a hotel experience we will go out of our way to seek to repeat.

Reviews.Title: “Boston Hotel”
Reviews.Author: patricia m
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Colonnade while in Boston for a wedding. All the staff is friendly and most helpful. The room was clean and comfy. Someone came up immediately when I called to report a bulb burned out in the bathroom. We had breakfast in the Brasserie Jo and the omelet was excellent! Very convenient location. We got to see the Speedo run while we were there!

Reviews.Title: “The Colonnade Hotel is First Class all the way!!”
Reviews.Author: TSerTheBSer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here as part of a Boston Red Sox Opening Day package and were very pleased with the hotel. It was within walking distance (a rather long walk) of Fenway Park and it was directly across the street from the Prudential Center shopping mall with a food court and several first class restaurants very close by. The hotel restaurant is French and was VERY good. The concierge was extremely helpful and the doormen were like old friends after just a couple trips out of the hotel. One day it was raining and he offered us umbrellas! The room was very modern with a 42" LCD TV, working table and ergonomic chairs. The beds were amazing! A wall safe made it easy to store our laptops when we stepped out. It was just a great place to stay. No complaints about anything!

Reviews.Title: “What an incredible bed!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TEXKEYSTONE
Reviews.Content: Check in was painless and the room was top notch with a contemporary flair and a fantastic view of downtown Boston. The restaurant was great too. I would highly recommend Colonnade for person or business travel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & staff”
Reviews.Author: Sarah C
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I ran away from home for a night and had a wonderful time at the Colonnade Boston. We arrived later than we had hoped so went to the bar/lounge for drinks and ended up staying and eating. Food was delicious, drinks were perfect, and the bartenders and waitstaff couldn't have been any better. Overall a perfect place to run away to for a night...or a month! Thank you for a great escape!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service and beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ilka B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Colonnade Boston for five nights late November 2011 and it was wonderful. The staff is very courteous and friendly, and the rooms were very nice and clean. After I came in from a run, the doorman, Nelson, asked me to wait since he had something for me. He back with a small bottle of water and a towel, asked my last name and told me how much he appreciated my being a guest at the hotel. Each time he made a point in mentioning my name and it was just the nicest gesture to greet me with the water and towel. The next day, his colleague darted into the hotel when he saw me come back from a run, and by the time I entered, he had the water for me. What a wonderful staff the hotel has. The location was wonderful. Everything was walkable, the Museum of Fine ARt, Northeastern Univ., downtown, and North End. Wonderful all around. I won't look for hotels in Boston any more, I'll book the Colonnade.

Reviews.Title: “Updated rooms with a great view.”
Reviews.Author: Chris R
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very nice, updated and very spacious. My wife and I have stayed here a couple of times since the renovation and we love it everytime. The location is ideal and the parking is the best for Boston.

Reviews.Title: “So comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Roberta S
Reviews.Content: I was at the Colonnade on a very short business trip. Check in and Check out were fast and the room was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay over Thanksgiving!!”
Reviews.Author: Briandiver
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Colonnade over the Thanksgiving weekend visiting my parents who live in the pru complex (Prudential Buildings) across the street. All the staff went above and beyond to make our stay very comfortable. The french restaurant had a limited menu so we went to Boylston street. Lots of choices. Notable staff; Ben, Sonny and Norman. Price was right and would stay again. Parking was convenient but a little pricey $38 dollars. I would have thought a guest would either be free or at least discounted. My brother's family also attended so it was a great reunion. Good job Colonnade.

Reviews.Title: “Most MEMORABLE Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: eastie2011
Reviews.Content: The Hotel far exceeded our expectations. We were kindly greeted at the lobby and at check in we were bumped up to a Suite which was very clean. The shower head was very soothing and relaxing and we were very satisfied with the comfortable King sized bed and cleanliness of the living area. The decor was modern day art and included many books of Boston. We had a magnificant City view of Copley Square/Prudential Building. Not to mention, that this hotel will forever remain a fabulous memory and hold a special place in my heart b/c its where I was proposed to!!! I was flipping through one of the books at the hotel featuring all the historic and popular spots in Boston when it happend.

Reviews.Title: “...it's great to be back in Boston”
Reviews.Author: JP C
Reviews.Content: " â€¦our stay was awesome; thank you so very much You run a first class operation and the people around you â€¦are the best I really appreciate all you did to make our stay, wonderful â€¦wish we could have stayed longer But it was squeezing a week into a few days..."

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Les H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 5 days and had a great time. Very friendly staff, excellent food and a great room. Jimmy at the front door was always helpful and more than willing to tell us about the city and what we should see. Mark (one of the waiters in the Hotel's restaurant) was phenomenal. His service was great, the New York Steak was incredible and John (the Bartender) makes the absolute best Long Island Ice Teas youâ€™ll ever have. The hotel is the perfect size for staff to remember you when you when youâ€™re coming in or going out. Itâ€™s been several weeks since our trip but I imagine if I were to walk in today, Jimmy, Mark and John would remember us. I would definitely go back and I highly recommend this hotel to anybody that values a classic hotel with a personal touch.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: Cortney L
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter (7) for her first trip to the big city and stayed here. The service was extra friendly and sweet to her, the staff very accommodating. They seemed excited for her to be there! The suite we had was comfortable and clean. The parking situation is a little sketchy - try to get a package that includes it, otherwise it is very expensive or a big hassle. That being said, other small things that needed correcting (coffee maker didn't work, had asked for a roll away cot) got corrected quickly and efficiently. The hotel is very centrally located, being near a T and I would consider staying here again for my next trip to Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Boston Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: The4Hobbs
Reviews.Content: For the last few years we have stayed at the Colonnade Hotel whenever we are visiting Boston. The location is excellent for attending many cultural venues, shopping, using various forms of public transportation, etc. The smaller size of the hotel is quite welcoming, the staff members are truly friendly, helpful and professional, and the rooms are nicely decorated, quiet, clean and very comfortable. Plus the resident restaurant, Brasserie Jo, is a wonderful place to dine. We especially enjoy the Alsatian appetizer Tarte FlambÃ©e Classic which helps us to relive wonderful memories of our visits to Alsace. And we usually end our meal with the most delicious French dessert - Floating Island! We always look forward to a return trip to Boston to stay at the Colonnade and to dine at Brasserie Jo. We have never been disappointed there!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: quickjaunt1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights in October 2011. Took public transportation from the airport(bus to blue line to green line) It was a little bit of work but it was only $4 for 2 of us to get to the hotel. The Prudential subway exit is right next to the hotel(green line). Colonnade Hotel let us check in early(8am). Room was nice and quiet. Huge window with a nice view. Bed was comfortable. TV had a lot of channels and most were in HD. I would definitely join the hotel's frequent guest program which entitles you to free internet and upgrade if available(it wasn't for us). Staff was nice and attentive. Room was better than average size with a table and 2 chairs. For the price $175 a night over the weekend, it was a great deal. Area around hotel is nice and the green line will take you to quite a bit of touristy Boston without transferring too much. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern rooms, good location”
Reviews.Author: LondonWelshDragon
Reviews.Content: This is a very good choice for someone who needs to be close to shops/T location. The standards are good although the room service red wine is to be avoided!! I would have liked better lighting in my room too but these are small comments about an otherwise good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay at the Colonnade”
Reviews.Author: skifastinvermont
Reviews.Content: Booked great rate of $159.00 per night (with free parking) for a midweek stay in October. Great Back Bay location. Nice (newly renovated) room. Two double beds is not my first choice of bedding, but no complaints based on the rate. Would stay again for this price.

Reviews.Title: “A nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: pirksts
Reviews.Content: The Colonnade is one of those places that doesn't look much from the inside, but when you are inside, you are pleasantly surprised. The hotel is newly renovated, modern, but in a comfortable type of way. I stayed at the Colonnade only 1 night while on a day-long business trip to Boston. My meeting was near BU and I took Amtrak to Boston. Tuns out the Colonnade is right between the two. My room was spacious with floor to ceiling windows, tons of pillows, a writing desk, flat screen TV, and an alarm clock with music jack to play music on my mp3 player. And a bonus, my room came with Keurig coffee maker. The bathroom is quite nice, cheery and warm (it comes with a rubber ducky). I checked in quite late and the kitchen in the hotel restaurant was already closed (the bar was still open), so I walked across the street to a burger joint. I can't say much about the surroundings since I didn't have a chance to explore. There was a T stop right by the entrance and there is a mall right across the hotel. The only two negatives about the hotel was that the shower pressure was very strong (I guess a plus for some) and the mattress seemed really hard (a plus for others).

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ayear0ff
Reviews.Content: The concierge, Jeff Good, sent a bottle of champagne to our room when he heard we were celebrating our anniversary. He also made a reservation for our dinner. We asked for and received a quiet non-smoking room. We were within walking distance of the Boston Symphony and the Fine Arts Museum. All in all, a lovely stay and we will go back again. Everyone was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, quiet and comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laura507
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was wonderful. The rooms are designed especially for business travelers. We had a nice table with two lamps for working, plenty of space, and lots of places to plug in our laptops, cel phones etc. The bedding is very high quality and the shower has great water pressure. One of the front desk staff Tamayo (not sure of the spelling) was wonderful early one morning getting me a cup of coffee around 5:30 am so I didn't have to wake up my colleague fiddling with the Keurig machine in our room (the restaurant adjacent to the hotel doesn't open until 6:30 am on weekdays and 7am on weekends). Friendly, wonderful service and an extremely thoughtful well planned room. We very much enjoyed our stay at the Colonnade Hotel and look forward to staying there in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel. Friendly service. Fantastic French Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: R H
Reviews.Content: I discovered this hotel earlier this year and I have stayed there three times since. Very clean and comfortable accomodations and very professional and friendly service. Love Joe's Brasserie; Boston meets Paris. Great melange indeed!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: RJH1234567
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 4 nights whilst on business. The location was excellent, very well placed for restaurants and the Prudential Centre. The rooms were spacious and very clean. The main thing that struck me was the attitude of the staff. All were professional, friendly and very helpful. I travel the world extensively on business and this combination is rare. I would 100% recommend a stay here for both business and pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: TFernandes
Reviews.Content: This hotel stands in ver nice area of Boston. The staff is very friendly, especially The bellmen. large and confortable room. Not so large bathroom. In front of a Mall and Metro station. Nice amenities (coffee, toiletries etc). Paid internet, but you can use Marbles & Nobles in the Mall.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location. Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: nuggies186638
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. Staff were very friendly. Rooms lovely. Bistro restaurant was really good and was good value. Location excellent. Prudential Centre (great shopping) just across the road and we took a 'Duck' Tour from just outside, which was fun. Also went up the Prudential Tower, which has amazing views of Boston. Loved this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: SarahB1957
Reviews.Content: Fantastic room in this beautiful hotel. We could not have asked for more! Everything was in pristine condition with crisp white sheets and the comfiest bed I have ever slept in in my life! The Boston Trolley Bus stopped right outside the hotel and just across the road was a huge shopping centre. It was also walkable distance to the Boston Library and so much more. Sadly only had three nights here but would definately stay here when I come back to Boston. I'll just HAVE to do that because it's such a wonderful city - enjoyed it so much more than New York!

Reviews.Title: “This is the way to do Boston”
Reviews.Author: Traveler P
Reviews.Content: You cannot beat the location. Adjacent to the Prudential Center with shopping, etc, next to the T stop of the same name and a pleasant walk from Comm Ave, Newbury Street and the Common. I have lived in and visited Boston many times and this ranks right up there with my best experiences in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: wernoles
Reviews.Content: I accompanied my husband on a business trip to Boston and stayed at the Colonnade. I can't say enough good things about it! The rooms were beautiful and quiet, the bed wonderfully comfortable, everything was very high-tech, bathroom amenities exceptionally nice, one of the best showers I've had in a hotel room. The people were all very friendly. The bar and restaurant delicious. It happened to be very rainy the first day we were there and we were directly across the street from a wonderful mall. What's a girl to do? We could also walk straight out the door and get on the train. It was quite the perfect stay. I'm afraid I sound like I work for the hotel, but we travel a lot and this was seriously one of the best hotel experiences we've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice - would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: Mani50
Reviews.Content: Good location and nice clean room; Comfortable king size bed, good quality pillows and bedding. (Not sure why but hallways are not well lit...)

Reviews.Title: “Position, comfort,wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: cherylw769
Reviews.Content: We stayed here august 30th for 4 nights starting our trip around USA have only recently returned to UK .This hotel exceeded our expectations The position was so central for ease of getting around Boston The tram stopped right outside and the staff will even ask them to wait for you. The rooms were fantastic Bed soooo comfortable.Although we were overlooking the main road there was no problem with any excessive noise.If all that was not enough then just across the road was a very good shopping mall and even a good supermarket if you want to pick up snacks and drinks or even a ready cooked meal.A couple of minutes walk to the right of the hotel there was a superb bakery selling snadwiches soups salads and much more either to eat there or takeaway.The only complaint I have is that my husband forgot to pick up his sunglasses on our early departure and I did email the hotel to enquire if they had been found but sadly I did not get a reply.Apart from this superb choice of hotel at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “The Best in Boston”
Reviews.Author: RAFAELAMADOR
Reviews.Content: Great service, excellent location. I stayed for the past 4 years, and I will highly recommend. The location is superb, the staff are very friendly and and the rooms are great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: juliejelliebean
Reviews.Content: Hotel had a luxury feel, rooms were spacious with 2 large double beds in ours. We didn't eat in the restaurant but the menu looked good. Drinks in the bistro were expensive but after a long journey were worth the cost! You can walk to the centre but it is quite a hike but do-able. The prudential centre is opposite and lots of shops, restaurants bars within easier walking distance. Hotel staff excellent and lots of little extras in the room. Pool was a huge bonus in a very hot August!

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of Boston .. great staff and location”
Reviews.Author: TerrenceDana
Reviews.Content: Regular readers of my reviews will know I travel a lot, at all kinds of hotels .. and that QUIET it paramount about all else. So in this respect the Colonnade fails I'm afraid. The staff is very friendly and courteous, some of the best in the world in my experience actually; the location is excellent, super clean, convenient parking, tons of shopping and restaurants all over; but the room walls are thin as paper so you can hear every conversation going on next door, and a common problem in many hotels is that the main hallway doors of all the rooms SLAM shut with a massive boom; never understood how any hotel manager thinks this is acceptable. Other things .. bathroom is tiny, but reading lights on flexible arms over each side of the bed is very handy. Decorative accents are very cool but the carpeting ( at least on the 11th floor ) is absolutely hideous ( what were they thinking!? )

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: stefijh
Reviews.Content: The Colonnade was a very nice hotel for the price. Great location in Back Bay, steps away from the Pru and the Green Line T stop. The rooms were spacious with great views, and the linens and bedding super comfortable. Brasserie Jo was very good for breakfast and light fare. The hotel staff were very nice and professional as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay great staff”
Reviews.Author: Silvertraveller40
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff are the jewel of this hotel. Always very helpful, courteous and obliging. Hotel in a good location close to subway/tube. Food excellent, room we had on top floor to the side was good. Huge beds well for a Brit they were. Parking was expensive but we understand this has been contracted out.

Reviews.Title: “Many Thanks to Hilary the doorman for excellent service-he truly made it feel like home away from home. Maryna Theron”
Reviews.Author: Marynat7
Reviews.Content: Excellent service -especially from Hilary! He makes his guests feel special and cared for.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and great value”
Reviews.Author: Herman M
Reviews.Content: Everything very good. Priced reasonably for Boston and location. And super good restaurant Brassiere Jo's on premises made dining delightful, tasty and an equally good value

Reviews.Title: “Great Boston neighborhood and hotel...”
Reviews.Author: RockiesExpert
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Colonnade for three nights in early October at the beginning of a pleasure trip through New England. We thought the neighborhood was very desirable with great shopping and restaurants, while we also thought the hotel itself was very comfortable if not luxurious. Be sure to ask for a room on the residential side of the hotel, which is quiet. The rooms are a bit cramped but fine for two people. They had a good flat panel TV and plenty of towels and toiletries in the bathroom. The internet is an extra charge, but you can get that waived by applying for a hotel chain membership. Breakfast food in the restaurant is fine, but there is no buffet. The best thing I can recall about the hotel is the bed, which is very comfy with great sheets. We had a good night sleep there each night. Whether on business or pleasure, the Colonnade is a solid bet, especially if you can get a good deal on the internet. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is the room size, which is on the small side.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: Lisa L
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to the Prudential shops, restaurants and Northeastern U. Hilary the Doorman was great as he ordered a van for a group and invited me to join them for a trip to the airport at a reduced rate. The French Brasserie Jo's was out of this world. Would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stephb6
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and within walking distance of Fenway. The rooms have nice views and big beds plus modern bathrooms. We had a great nights sleep and the hotel was quiet and peaceful. The only negative I found was that you have to pay for parking. The hallways are very dim too... I don't know if that matters but they were.

Reviews.Title: “upgraded product meets traditional professional service”
Reviews.Author: YYZbOY
Reviews.Content: Location is great. Rooms are very comfortable and upgraded. Great TV's, bathrooms, bedding, in room safe that works etc. Service was very attentive. Good eye contact, polite (and young!) front desk staff. Bellman acknowledge you every time you walk past them. Concierge is well connected and quick to accommodate. Nothing went wrong throughout the three day stay. Didn't use the parking but heard guests in elevator commenting on how above ground indoor parking is a real 'find'. Would strongly recommend this hotel. Even the bartender treats you like an old friend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: TravelLover77_5
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and we had a great experience. The hotel is clean, beds are comfortable, the shower is nice and location is perfect for exploring Boston (the Prudential subways station is just outside the hotel). We also found the services to be great. They let us stay in the room on our last day until 2:00 pm so that my 2 year old daughter could take her nap. Any service was just right and we felt pampered and well taken care of. The room was also quiet, which I appreciated although I think there were not that many guests in the rooms adjacent with ours, and this played a great role in keeping the room quiet. Strongly recommend this hotel to anyone interested in exploring Boston while having a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Convenient & Fun”
Reviews.Author: danazz77
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed our stay at the Colonnade very much. It's location is very convenient. The staff was helpful and the rooftop pool was amazing. Our only complaint were the rooms were quite small other than that I would love going back.

Reviews.Title: “First and Last..ing Impressions”
Reviews.Author: Jeffery P
Reviews.Content: Let's make this simple from the very first greeting from Norman Maines the exceptional greeter/doorman/guest advocate my entre stay this was an exceptional experience. With Norman setting the standard each and every time I entered and exited it was not surprising to find the entire team above the norm and the rooms and service to match. This is one boutique that gets it and knows how imortant the selection of team mebers is.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: haknyc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the weekend of October 14th to visit colleges with our daughter. We had a double room with a nice view of Huntington Avenue. The lobby and interior hallways are not nearly as bright as the rooms. The rooms are nicely decorated and the bathroom was nice. The staff is helpful. We would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: massjhawk
Reviews.Content: We asked for a quiet room and we given a room on the 10th floor at the back of the hotel that looked over a residential area and was extremely quiet. Large windows and high ceilings and a comfortable bed made for a nice stay.The work-out room was well equipped. The hotel is well located to several area attractions and easy to get to. What was really great was the personal service that the staff gave. Everyone was pleasant and worked hard to make sure we were happy. The concierge, Christopher, went out of his way to find out what we liked and make reservations and recommendations. The staff seemed to care that we enjoyed our stay and took good care of us. The bathrooms are small but the shower pressure was great. The restaurant was pricey and the service not very quick in the mornings-the only drawback to the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paul E
Reviews.Content: This place is moderately expensive but very well located. The facilities are first class, the rooms were clean and comfortable, and the restaurant excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Up-to-date and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: dancingnancy
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™ve stayed here several times in the couple of years, and once I got used to the parking situation, it became my Boston standby. First of all, the rooms are about $100 a night less than comparable places down the street. Secondly, the rooms, though average in size, are tasteful, modern and straightforward. Third, parking (right in the building) is a cinch once you get used to the absence of valet service. I also like the restaurant, Brasserie Jo, just off of the lobby. Donâ€™t expect the service of the Four Seasons. Itâ€™s competent, professional and polished but not ultra obsequious. Donâ€™t expect the staff to be too interested in you. This is a hotel that doesnâ€™t try to mimic a B&B, and doesnâ€™t mind if you carry your own bag.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for location”
Reviews.Author: Mark T
Reviews.Content: A great choice if you want to stay in the back bay area. Staff was extremely helpful, friendly and professional. The rooms were very nice. Beds are fantastic. The windows are huge and they even open. The bathroom was not up to par, however. It was small. The doors in the bath have a big space in between them which doesn't make it seem very private. The shower is nothing special at all. The tv and the choice of channels is great for just lounging around. The mini bar is stocked beautifully as well. Restaurant was a different story. It was a little busy for a monday night. I was sitting at the bar and it took 2 and a half hours to eat a couple appetizers and a few beverages. I was not in a rush by any means but there were a very long wait in between each course. The food was fine. Seasoned well, and what you expect from a 'french brasserie' in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Back Bay choice”
Reviews.Author: BackInLondon
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in a great location, right by a T stop and within easy walking distance of Back Bay's wide choice of bars, cafes, restaurants and shops, and will excellent transport links to the rest of the City. Attractive, well-appointed room. Very comfortable bed. Small bathroom but perfectly functional. Great staff: friendly, welcoming and helpful. Shame the free wi-fi is only available in the lobby. Surely that's crazy in this day and age? Ludicrously expensive wine in the hotel bar but that's not uncommon in US hotels and wouldn't put me off returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Steve D
Reviews.Content: My recent stay @ COLONNADE HOTEL in Boston started out very auspiciously. Just after checking in I realized that I had left my cellphone in the backseat of a taxi.
