In a nutshell, the hotel staff including the doorman (Hilary) and asst manager (Eric) sprang into action. After getting the cab company contact info from my receipt they contacted the company and ultimately the driver. Not only did they get my phone back (a miracle in itself) but their assistant manager actually hand delivered the phone to me during my dinner @ Abe & Louie's. The balance of my stay was excellent including the room and the exercise facilities. I'll be back because of the service alone!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at the Colonnade”
Reviews.Author: greenshorts
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Colonnade overnight. Overall, it was a pleasant stay, no glitches. The location is super-convenient, right next to shopping and transportation. My wife and kids enjoyed their breakfast at Jo's. Their pancakes were very good! Self park was easy and convenient right next to the hotel. The hotel personnel were all pleasant and helpful. The hallways were a bit too dark for me. Also, there truly was a musty, but mild odor along the corridors, similar to what I've read in previous reviews. This did not affect our stay in any way, though.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: hikingbee
Reviews.Content: We arrived early and were able to check in no problem. Located right across the street from the Prudential, it is in a good neighborhood and plenty to do and see. There is an additional parking fee for using the garage but it is on average with garages around town. Upside is the hotel is located on the same block as the Green Line Prudential stop; so once you park you can stay parked and just hop onto the T! Had a double bed room and it was clean, neat and cozy. At the front desk during check out, Sonny was very friendly and helpful with my questions. The only reason why I only gave it Very Good vs Excellent was the price was pretty high and it did not include any additional ammenities like wi-fi, continental breakfast etc. But because of the cleanliness, service, and location I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: RoadWarrior101010
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, great staff. For a big hotel I was impressed with how clean the room was and the staff were very responsive even though there seemed to be people coming and going constantly at the front desk. The hotel is directly across the street from a mall, with several convenient food options. There is a T stop right on the corner so getting anywhere in Boston is really easy. I definitely agree with several other reviews on here that the internet connection is horribly slow. To get work done I actually ended up across the street at the Barnes and Nobel. The fitness facilities were great. It rained most of my trip so I was not able to run outside and ended up in the fitness center most days. There are two full rows of cardio machines, several weight machines, and an open floor area for stretching or working with free weights. I was impressed. The room was clean and the bed comfortable with plenty of extra pillows. The room did have a bit of a musty smell to it, but opening the window to let in some fresh air solved this problem. It is a bit pricy, which seems to be the norm in Boston, but it is possible to find less expensive and comperable places if you look early enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, most comfortable bed, incredible food!”
Reviews.Author: sharaBseigel
Reviews.Content: The Colonnade Hotel's beds are worth the stay in itself! Incredibly comfortable and provided one of the best nights sleep ever. The room was modern and spacious yet cozy, and I loved the alternative (and more functional) table and chairs to the traditional desk found in most hotel rooms. An increidlbe dinner at Brasserie JO was also a highlight!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Omaghlass
Reviews.Content: Had four nights in this hotel. Overall staff were friendly but the door men certainly made everyone feel very welcome. They were also helpful with directions, taxis and general enquiries. The room is spacious and modern - on the down side I would say this room is not dusted/hoovered every day and the glass lamps were reflective of this even in hallways. Still the location is excellent and the Cheesecake Factory is directly opposite as is the Mall in the Prudential Building - very handy when the rains came.

Reviews.Title: “"I will be back!"”
Reviews.Author: Victoria G
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Colonnade for 1week while I was in Boston for training.And I wished that it was a holiday so that i could enjoy the very very comfortable bed and soft pillows.....I cannot find the right words to describe the extent of comfort that came from laying my head down on the pillows every evening when i got back.The rooms are always very clean, the staff were so helpful and tried to meet our specific needs.The doorman even got us a calling card that cost $5 for almost 3 hours of talk time to Africa! so i didn't miss a thing being away from home. My husband and I will definitely be back in a few months for a more restful stay. also well located with shopping mall and restaurants right opposite it. i unreservedly recommend this hotel. Well done to teh staff of this hotel.You are all great people! Cheers. Vickie

Reviews.Title: “October stay”
Reviews.Author: Luan T
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with my stay at the Colonnade. The front desk staff was very courteous and helpful. The doorman was always polite. The rooms were very clean and the beds were comfortable. The location was excellent as it was right across from the Prudential Center. There were shops and restaurants all within walking distance. There was also the MBTA (subway) line right in front of the hotel. I would definitely recommend this hotel for any visitors to Boston looking to stay within the Back Bay area.

Reviews.Title: “5 ***** treatment”
Reviews.Author: sylvana51
Reviews.Content: If you are planning a trip to Boston, try and stay at the Colonnade Hotel. The service is excellant. Beds and pillows are so comfortable - heaven! The staff cannot do enough for you and are very helpful in anything that you ask. The hotel is well placed for all sightseeing trips. The only down point was the drink prices in the adjoining Bar - very pricey. Overall would recommend again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing But Good Things To Say!”
Reviews.Author: namyevad
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for four nights while vacationing and we have nothing but good things to say about the Colonnade Hotel Boston. I did my homework on Trip Advisor and found this hotel more highly rated than several well-known flags and at a far more reasonable price. However no place is inexpensive in Boston! We were not disappointed with the Colonnade. Our room was ready when we arrived early and check-in was fast and easy. Our room was ample size, modern, attractive, clean and comfortable. Floor-to-ceiling windows let us enjoy the view. We used the concierge service and they were very helpful. They recommended the Old Town Trolley for our initial tour of the city (more expensive than the competition but more frequent service and it stops right in front of the hotel). They also familiarized us with the subway (MBTA) with an entrance to the Prudential (Green Line) stop right outside the door of the hotel. Don't hesitate to take the subway to get around! Several times we dined and stopped-in for drinks at the hotel's Brasserie Jo. Excellent food and service. The bartenders were friendly and freely gave us their sightseeing recommendations. The highly rated Atlantic Fish Company is just a short walk from the hotel. Please make a reservation or you will have to dine either very early or vary late. Two places to visit while walking in the immediate area are the Boston Public Library (beautiful interior courtyard) and Trinity Church Boston (American Institute of Architects - Top 10 most significant buildings in the country). We would definitely book here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great place! Nice value!”
Reviews.Author: nuggetspam
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel! Front desk clerk was really great and it just went uphill from there! Clean and modern in the rooms, charming in the rest of the hotel. Only complaint was noisy guests in hallway for several hours. Not really the hotel's fault, just rude people!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location, Service, Food...PILLOWS!!!!!!!...and a cute little rubber duckie :)”
Reviews.Author: Shannon T
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this by saying that I travel quite extensively and this is only the second review I have ever written due to lack of time and in most cases, lack of customer service and quality deserving of the time to write reviews. That said, I just had to let everyone know how wonderful this hotel is. I can not say enough about my 4 day stay this week at the Colonnade Hotel. My company chose the Colonnade as the site for this years conference. Having stayed in the 4 walls of the hotel for the majority of my stay, except for a dinner cruise night, I can honestly say that for the entire 4 days of my stay, they completely wowed me. Right from the start, I had a pleasant experience at the front desk. They were friendly and helpful, offering area maps and suggestions on where to go and what to do. I declined because I am a Bostonian but it was still nice that they are helping out-of-towners to get out and see our beautiful city. Right away I was pleased with the appearance of the room. Clean, modern, inviting. My view was of the south end, not the city view. It didn't matter. My view was amazing both in the daylight and at night. I started by ordering room service since I was in for a long night of work. The menu was excellent, the staff was courteous both over the phone and upon delivery of my meal. I am always nervous about the quality of food in any hotel, especially room service. The food is all prepared from the downstairs restaurant, Brasserie Jo's. It was wonderful. I ordered the steak and asked for salad in replacement of the fries. The steak was delicious and the salad was huge and excellent as well. It came with a warm loaf of bread. The cappucino was also great. Over the course of the week, we were served breakfast, multiple snacks, lunch and dinner. Everything was perfect: presentation, fun and different snack ideas (ie. Hot pretzels w/ mustard and Fenway Park ice cream bars to name a few), lunches and dinners that were high quality and well prepared and presented. I have been to quite a few conferences and even more hotel weddings...never have I come across this kind of food. Needless to say I ate A LOT this week. Moving on to the service: I did not encounter one person who was not smiling at me, asking me how I was, asking if they could get me anything, etc. Such a wonderful and amazing staff. Hotel management should feel extremely proud that they have such a wonderful team interacting with their guests. The location: Again being a Bostonian, I did not need to sneak out during downtime to explore but if I had, and others did, there is tons of shopping, eating and even the Duck Tour, right outside the front door. Now for the pillows: Oh the pillows! The bed as a whole was fabulous with soft sheets and a comfortable mattress but the pillows had me at hello. I think the best way to explain them is heaven right here in little ole Boston! Several others could not stop talking about them as well. I found myself hitting snooze in the morning and day dreaming of them all day. I know it sounds totally silly, but you wouldn't understand unless you tried them. Great choice Colonnade! One last thing: They did not spare one detail. I never use any products from hotels but I did here. Their shampoos and soaps are wonderful and a great size. Then the rubber duckie. CUTE! Nice touch, Colonnade! It made me smile and I took it with me as a reminder of my wonderful time in your hotel. Great job!

Reviews.Title: “Colonnade Hotel Boston”
Reviews.Author: Fiona H
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this great hotel for a week. Used the T from Airport to arrive right outside hotel only 2 dollars a ride anywhere in the city. Room good size and plenty storage. Bed was huge and comfortable. Brassie Jo is a must try, although expensive and need to make reservation for a saturday night I would highly recommend the steak. For breakfast Thorntons a popular dinner is just along the street. The 7/11 is just round corner for soft drinks etc. Roof top pool was closed for season but looked nice and there is a fittness club in hotel but was too lazy to try out. Go for the duck tour tickets in prudential across from hotel and ducks are acrosss the road just up the street. Then get out and walk only way to see everything follow the red lind freedom trial. Also go on the whale watch its amazing. Cheers Bar on Beacon hill food is great and then follow trail to other cheers bar at Qunicy market. Loads of market stalls and great shops. Lastly do the ghosts and graveyard tour very informative and spooky in the dark, tour guides are so funny. If you get tired walking the T is very easy to find your way round. Hotel staff are friendly and helpful and a paper arrived every morning. Clean towels and bed was perfectly made and bathroom shining. Would recommend the Hotel for your stay in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Fun weekend in Boston”
Reviews.Author: RCH16
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a good value in Back Bay. The room, staff and restaurant were all first class. It is a good base for sightseeing in Boston. We will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Colonnade”
Reviews.Author: Loanhead
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at the Colonnade in September. The location was excellent for shopping, eating out and for transport as there is a T subway station right outside the hotel. The room was a reasonable size for a city hotel and the quality of the bed linen, mattress and pillows was excellent. The bathroom was small but well appointed. The room was clean but the bathroom needed some attention to detail, very dusty ledges, mirror lights, back of door, top of phone etc.. Reception staff, concierge and doorman were very helpful. Disappointed that the roof top pool had closed as this was one of our main reasons for choosing this hotel. Brasserie Jo the only eating option, some coffee in the lobby would have been nice. Would certainly consider staying at the Colonnade again.

Reviews.Title: “Really good for Boston Hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: Davcan
Reviews.Content: This hotel has great comfy bedding, clean (but tiny) bathrooms and excellent location. The staff is EXCEPTIONALLY friendly (Adriene at the door, Elizabeth at the front desk). I only wish they offered coffee in the morning but Dunkin Donuts is practically across the street. The hotel restaurant is a good place to unwind.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience!”
Reviews.Author: crazymugal
Reviews.Content: Convenient location to Northeastern University and the convention center. Transportation was no problem - the T is right outside the door and taxis were waiting all the time. It cost about $25 for a cab to/from the airport. Lots of shopping, grocery store, and restaurants are nearby. I did have to walk a few blocks to find a good cup of coffee in the morning. The staff were all very pleasant and helpful. They even provide a convenient map of the Charles River trail for runners! The rubber ducky was the icing on the cake!

Reviews.Title: “Colonnade Hotel great place to stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Debby S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a fine hotel. All the employees are very friendly and helpful. It is one of the best hotels that we have stayed at and we have traveled a lot. There is really nothing bad to say about this hotel. We were very pleased with the choice of hotel and would definitely stay here again. I checked into many hotels before selecting this one and am very happy with my choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SFWOxford
Reviews.Content: Stayed here whilst on business in Boston. T (subway) stop is right outside so easy to get around. Prudential Centre shops are directly opposite and a few yards up the street there is a great supermarket and also the stop for Duck Tours. Room was spacious with a great view - I was on the 10th floor. A/C was a bit noisy but I preferred to have the window open so no problem. Staff are friendly, helpful and efficient. Turn down service with a card giving the next day's weather forecast is a nice touch. Restaurant is nice but there are loads nearby so it's good to get some variety! All in all a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Central and Cordial”
Reviews.Author: Dercov
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Colonnade Hotel on a recent visit to Boston from Ireland and were more than happy with our stay.The location is perfect for sight seeing especially as it is right beside the subway and across the road from the Prudential .We enjoyed the roof top Pool and the view from there is spectacular as indeed it was from the room we stayed in.All in all a very relaxing atmosphere. The staff we met at reception were very helpful especially Karen and Elizabeth. We thought Karen was very quick to pick up our accents and it was nice to engage with her about the Kennedys while she googled us the details of how to get to their homestead.We were sure glad we choose the Colannade for our Boston trip.

Reviews.Title: “One of My Favorite Hotels”
Reviews.Author: ihitchhiker
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels and the Collonade is one of my favorites. I had a hard time finding anything bad to say. The location in the center of the Back Bay is great, just above a subway stop and across the street from the Prudential Center complex. Itâ€™s a wonderful area, with dozens of great restaurants and shops within walking distance. And itâ€™s close to the symphony and Fenway Park. For some reason it is popular with international flight attendants and Europeans. The rooms are modern and tasteful. They are clean and bright and the beds are comfortable (only the elevators are too dark). TV gets a lot more channels than other hotels. They have a roof-top pool, but it is only open in the warm months. And on occasion, the rooms are affordable. Neighboring, less attractive hotels nearby charge much more. My only very small caution: donâ€™t believe the thermostats in the rooms. They always read colder than they are. Turn it down all the way for a comfortable sleep. Try Tapeo restaurant up on Newbury Street.

Reviews.Title: “great for conference base”
Reviews.Author: Seabird21
Reviews.Content: I was travelling to Boston for a conference and brought my mum along. We were pleasantly surprised at how nice a hotel this was. The location is excellent, across the road from the Prudential centre (full of shops including a supermarket, restaurants and a great food court) and with a subway stop just outside. My conference was at the Hynes convention centre which was an easy 5 min walk through the prudential centre and Mum was able to walk or catch the subway everywhere. The rooms were not huge but comfortable. Since we were staying for 7 nights we were able to get an additional fridge in the room. The beds were fabulous, my only complaint being the pillows. I think they were down-filled as opposed to foam and therefore compress to nothing after minutes. Still managed to sleep though, as the block out drapes worked well :) Bathroom adequate with a tricky single tap in the shower (had to call reception to ask how to get hot water) and great water pressure! TV impressive. Being non-US in origin the selection of TV stations was mind-blowing... I think we lost count around 60! Staff were always helpful and friendly and the concierge entertained my mum with sightseeing suggestions everyday. He also managed to get us great tickets for the Boston Red Sox game and walking instructions on how to get to the ball park. Some of the comments on trip advisor recently made us worry about cleanliness but I couldn't fault it. I agree that on occasion there were room service carts left in the hallways but in my experience this happens in any big hotel. Nothing ever appeared to get to the "stinky" phase. It is at the pricy end of the spectrum but then everything in Boston seems to be. I was certainly happy to spend my money here and would come back in a flash.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: t47
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Boston on July 4th for a two week art class only to discover that our original accomodations were under construction and created a very unhealthy environment. We called the Colonade on July 5 and spoke to Jill, one of their very friendly and helpful reservation agents. After explaining our dilemma and the fact that we would need two connecting rooms for the duration of our visit, Jill worked wonders for us. She was able to arrange the rooms and an American Express deal that included breakfast and other amenities. Our stay was wonderful. From the doorman to check in, concierge, housekeeping, and the delicious breakfast and engaging staff in the dining room, we were constantly pleased with the friendliness and efficiency of these employees. The rooms were spacious and the pillows and mattresses were beyond comfortable. And, we could not have asked for a better location. With the Prudentai Shops and restaurants across the street, and the T Line right outside the door, we were able to easily discover the joys of this lovely city. We plan on returning to Boston frequently in the next few months, and staying the Hotel Colonnade will definately be our top priority!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but dated”
Reviews.Author: jhunjhun1981
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location; just outside the metro (they call it a T here) station, a few minuted walk from Copley Place, the Espalande(great view of the Charles river by dusk) and Newbury street ( a very lively street with lots of dining options and a good night life). With the proximity to the metro, you could easily get yourself to the Boston Commons, Harvard Square, Chinatown and Quincy for more fun. The hotel itself is a bit dated and can be easily missed since the name is not very conspicuous. The pricing falls in the average 150$ band, but then it depends on what you expect from such price band. I found it ok. The reception area is small. The concierge is very helpful. They were nice enough to receive not one but three packages for me during my stay of 5 days. They have just one restaurant, which is French. I was not impressed by the restaurant at all, but they had great coffee. I somehow found myself going in there just for their coffee. Parking is expensive and is on the first and second floors. I had wifi charges included in my room rate so i was happy. The corridors were a dark and not well lit. If you came back to the hotel during the afternoon from bright sunshine, then you would think you are in a cave. The elevators are very slow and sometimes i took me all of 5 mins to get from my floor (10th ) to the lobby. The elevators lacked good lighting. The room itself was spacious enough. Due to the floor to ceiling windows, the rooms were well lit and had good views. The AC was controlled and effective. Overall i liked the location and the hotel, but they need to improve the lobby and the corridors.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Proximity to all things Boston”
Reviews.Author: FoodNomad53
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the top floor (11th floor) on the backside of the building (window facing SE). Nice quiet, clean room. King bed, pillows, linens, and bathroom amenities . . . . All perfect. Beautiful morning sunlight and views toward South Boston. The "T" subway stop is just outside the hotel front door to the left. Right across the street is Prudential Center with lots of nice shops . . . . walk all the way through to the other (north) side you'll find lots of nice shops & restaurants (e.g. along Boylston or Newbury Streets). The bell captain (Jimmy) is quite the conversationalist; he has worked at Colonnade Hotel for 28 years (no shortage of knowledge for the area).

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed”
Reviews.Author: RCFChicago
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed by this hotel, especially after all of the great reviews on TripAdvisor. The room itself was nice, and it was clean; however, the hotel is very dark (as some have commented). The corridors are dark, which make them a little depressing, and the room itself was dark at night. There were not enough lights in the room, and the lights used low wattage bulbs. The hotel lobby area is not very inviting. On the plus side - the metro stop is right in front of the hotel, and it is in a very good location. I also enjoyed going to the restaurant connected to the hotel for breakfast. So while the experience was not a terrible one, I will look for another hotel the next time I am in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Red Sox Trip”
Reviews.Author: Rich M
Reviews.Content: I try and get to Boston acouple of times a year to catch the Red Sox and this is the perfect Hotel for that. I've stayed all over the city and this Hotel is a Must Stay!. Its a 15 min walk to Fenway, acouple of blocks from Newbury with great Restaurants/Pubs, hop on the T-Green Line (is just out front) and in a few minutes you're in the North End for fantastic Italian Restaurants and Mike's Pastry. It doesn't get any better then this. The room was great and very comfortable.......hard to leave when you have a nice flat screen TV, comfy bed and Keurig coffee machine. Very easy to get to from the airport, I used Ultimate shuttle service, they were very efficient and got me from the airport to the Hotel in less then 30 min. I want to give a big shout out to Eric in the Concierge, he worked hard and got me some outstanding tickets to a Red Sox game. The Staff at this Hotel is fantastic and I give them 5 stars. They give a great military discount and I really appreciated that. I can't wait for my next trip back.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service, perfect weekend, top quality all around”
Reviews.Author: TBerry3
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Colonnade Hotel September 16 and 17, 2011. I had made last minute reservations after canceling a conference in Orlando, and was basically just looking to escape to the city for a few days of shopping, watching sports and dancing. When I first drove up I found the service (giving me directions into the parking garage) easy and friendly - I am not much for city driving, but they immediately made me feel comfortable. Check-in took only a few minutes, my room was amazing, I ordered breakfast in my room each morning and it arrived within 15 minutes, my shower had terrific waterpressure, the room was the right temperature, the tv was huge... but nothing compares to the great concierge service! I was given directions on where to shop, along with a map, then directions to some great sports and dance bars, and they even grabbed a cab for me - then checked in with me the next day to see if I'd had a good time. This is not your average hotel, this is a little slice of relaxation in my favorite part of Boston! Thank you Eric and Sheb!

Reviews.Title: “Best roof-top pool ever!”
Reviews.Author: Nano-matte
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife was in town for a conference and had the priviledge to stay at this pretty exclusive hotel for six nights. The room was excellent, and had everything one could ask for. Room service from JO Brasseri was quickly delivered and very tasty (had the hamburger), and not too expensive. The BEST part of the hotel experience is however the roof-top pool area, with a hard-working staff which make sure that you are never thirsty or hungry. Super!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: NikkiBrown5
Reviews.Content: Great room, friendly staff, clean, near restaurants. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: DangerousLady
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel for good AMEX room rate offer and pool - sadly pool area closes after Labor Day and we arrived a week later to brilliant sunshine and temperatures in the mid-upper 80s. Such is life. Hotel has excellent location, close to good (upmarket) shopping areas and within walking distance of the Esplanade, too. Walking in the Back Bay local neighbourhood safe and interesting. Rooms adequate. Opted for one bed rather than 2 as did not wan the room to be "full of beds" but peeking in one day I could see that the 2-bedded rooms were spacious. For a city-centre location rooms adequate size and everything worked well. Internet connection was $12 per 24hours, but Starbucks was literally across the road if you wanted access for free! Breakfast excellent value. On our Amex "deal" we had Continental Breakfast included. In reality this was a $10 "allowance" so that the full American breakfast cost $3. Excellent value and excellent quality and great ambiance at Brasserie Jo where we also ate one evening. Leisurely pace which is unusual in the US and welcomed when on holiday. One of my first stops in the US is for a mani-pedi and My Nail Salon around the corner does a great job at $37.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous Stay at the Colonnade Hotel in Boston During BIG Conference”
Reviews.Author: Jackie R
Reviews.Content: After my first night there at the Colonnade Hotel in Boston, when I was ready to use the iron, I was a little upset, and disappointed with the old dirty iron and the irony board in Room 510 that I could not used. I left my hotel room, and came down to the Lobby at the front entrance/outside, there I met Norman Maines, and shared my complaint with Mr. Maines, what I encountered above. Mr.Maines immediately apologized for any inconvenience, and asked for my name, and Room #510. He used his walkie/talkie radio to contact the Housekeeping staff immediately to go into Room 510, and removed the old iron, and replaced with a new iron. I was very impressed how prompt, and quick that request was taken care of, in a timely matter, within a few minutes. Every since that very first day, and the remaining time of my stay, Mr. Norman Maines was very professional, pleasant, to greeted me with a smile every day, and is very knowledgeable in recommended the Colonnade Hotel guest possible places that he/she will enjoy to tour, and dine in downtown Boston. Mr.Maines will called transporation services for each guest that requested services to and from the Colonnade hotel in Boston (downtown) areas at all times, he greeted me with a whole hearted welcome, and the most up with respect by addressing me in the early morning, afternoon, and evening by my name. He also, recommended when I get sometime to go, and visit the rooftop to dining, and to enjoy a beautiful view, along with recommended some nice restaurants throughout my stay. I felt very special, and was a amazed of the hospitility, that he remembered my name from the first time that I met him thru my entire stay from the date of my compliant above. I plan to visit Boston again in the near future, and will make sure that my reservations will be at the Colonnade Hotel in downtown Boston. Also, I will refer family and friends, who planning a trip to visit the Boston area, to make reservations there. 'Kudos to Norman Maines (Doorman, and A Perfect Gentleman ), and to the Colonnade Hotel in downtown Boston!.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel good location for seeing Boston.”
Reviews.Author: Andrew J
Reviews.Content: Just stayed 3 nights at the hotel. Second visit . Good location and value for money. Staff very friendly from the moment we arrived till we left. We only had breakfast at the hotel which was lovely and not overly expensive. Ducks tours and trolley tours can be booked across the road at the Prudential centre.Harvard is worth a look round get there on the redline of that T subway, if you like Mexican food go to Border Cafe in Harvard , good food and very good value for money and a great atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: etak14
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Colonnade but our 5th visit to Boston, we'll certainly stay at the hotel again. The staff were welcoming especially Jimmy, the restaurant and bar were both great. The roof top pool was wonderful, a lovely place to eat breakfast. The rooms were clean and spacious and the beds were the comfiest ever.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Stay at the Colonnade Hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: robertmann
Reviews.Content: My husband, adult son and I recently spent 5 wonderful days at the Colonnade Hotel in Boston, and we were all thrilled at the sheer beauty of this luxurious hotel and our rooms, the welcoming and gracious attitude of every single member of the staff, and the attention to all details that made our third stay here so special and memorable. We all felt so incredibly taken care of in this world-class hotel from the moment we called to book our rooms--all of our concerns were met with quick and professional responses, and we felt completely pampered by a housekeeping staff that kept us well-supplied with luxurious linens on extremely comfortable beds and amazing toiletries--not to mention the great flat-screen TVs in our stylish, tastefully-decorated rooms-with-great-views. On our arrival, the concierge and front desk greeted us with warm friendly smiles -- and when we reached our room, we found a personal note from the Managing Director, David Colella welcoming us back and wishing us a pleasant stay. Everyone from the executives to the doormen to the staff at Brasserie Jo to Housekeeping, Room Service and Engineering were amazing in their efforts to assure us a great stay. I continually was pleasantly surprised by how accommodating the staff was to all our requests. Our son had packed in a rush, and within minutes a toothbrush and toothpaste were delivered to his door. At breakfast on our anniversary, we were surprised with complimentary mimosas! I have already sung the Colonnade's praises to family, friends and colleagues, and we are already planning and looking forward to our return visit in November!

Reviews.Title: “We Had a Great Time And Will Definitely Be Back”
Reviews.Author: Beps51
Reviews.Content: The Colonnade came recommended by friends and we were not let down. From the moment we entered the lobby on our arrival everyone was very friendly and attentive. Jimmy and Aidan particularly were very helpful and gave us great advise as to where to go and also recommended some good restaurants to eat in. The food in the Hotel although a bit pricey was absolutely delicious. There are several eating places across the road from the Hotel to indulge in particularly the Cheesescake Facrory but be warned the portions are big but the food is excellent. The one thing I would not recommend using is their TROLLEY system. This is a hop on hop off and at $42 per head it is not good value. There is an excellent Underground system which s very easy to use and is Far better value. A trip to Quincy Market is a must. All in all a thoroughly enjoyable location.

Reviews.Title: “We could not have asked for better accomodations....”
Reviews.Author: screenameTallahassee
Reviews.Content: Large hotel with all amenities but with small hotel attention to guests. Stayed 4 nights at Colonade on week long visit to New England. Rooms were attractive and well appointed. Desk/table next to window with many electrical outlets and good lighting perfect for laptop work. Sign up for free, "I prefer" membership online and get free wifi. Many rate plans available, so ask. We negotiated average rate of $243 including two breakfasts valued at $16.95 each beginning the day after Labor Day. Had breakfasts delivered room service for $4.00 delivery charge. Great room service...hot coffee, white table cloth, flowers and excellent food. Hotel brasserie restaurant has excellent food. Very friendly service from front desk to doorman. Hotel located across from Prudential building, which houses shops and foodcourt. Cheesecake Factory across the street. Five Napkins burger restaurant so so. Take subway across the street or taxi ($12 or so roundtrip) to Museum of Fine Arts, a really world class museum with an interesting American Artist section. Ticket are $22 each but can be used for two days or given or shared with another couple for free. Suggest trolley tour for overview, tickets good for two days and hop on and off. Trolleys run every 5-10 minutes. Informative narration. National Park Service gives free walking tours of Freedom Trail.

Reviews.Title: “No kudos for Colonnade Hotel”
Reviews.Author: robert r
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the good part: It's a very clean hotel. As for the rest of the hotel experience? Mediocre to crummy. My first bad impression: Three hotel employees, including the bell captain on duty, watched us enter the hotel while struggling with three large suitcases. None offered to assist us (the guests) until I remarked: "Some help here?". Throughout our stay, room service dishes littered the halls (I finally called the desk and asked if two trays outside our door could be picked up after being there a full day); the air conditioning did not work--we set it at 66 degrees--but since there was only one vent located in , of all places, the dresser cabinet, there was virtually no air circulating in the room; the parking garage was packed for a wedding one night so there was no room for staying guests' cars; the auto valet drove the cars at breakneck speed down the garage ramp as people walked through and, oh yeah, the desk clerk failed to correctly load the "in-and-out" swipe card used to gain entry or exit from the parking garage. Small stuff but it piles up--sort of like those room service trays. This could be a nice place but the staff needs to be managed better--especially at the hefty rate the Colonnade is charging. You've been warned.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel, with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: DavyRos
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel, but lacking a wow factor. We found all staff pleasant and helpful, although we didn't use the restaurant. A large,comfortable, well equipped room, with plenty of storage, and spotlessly clean. A subway station is just outside the front door and taxis are always on standby. A sightseeing bus has a stop at the front door. A leasurely 15 minute walk will get you to Copley Square. A shopping mall is directly opposite the hotel with a food hall, and more importantly.... a "cheesecake factory". A relaxing rooftop pool and bar are available to guests, but finding a seat can be difficult. The pool bar is small, and the waiting staff seem easily confused with orders. I would happily return to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “hotel is economy class not a boutique or luxury”
Reviews.Author: danny l
Reviews.Content: 2 reasons why this hotel is more like a Holiday Inn than a Sheraton/Hilton type hotel: #1 no valet parking and when i leave i have to pack my own bags in adjacent lot. If you have a family as i do, this is a pain. #2 Checked in on last Friday of August. Booked room 1 month in advance. Room was described to be 350 sq ft as per hotel website. the actual room was more like 200sq ft. Although manager helped to move us into a 350 sq ft room, his comment was that some rooms are percieved smaller. Not sure what he meant by that but it irritated me because it puts onus on client. I challenge him to measure the two rooms, if the variance is not as i described then let me eat humble pie. signed Danny from Toronto, Canada

Reviews.Title: “great part of the city”
Reviews.Author: IllinoisRiverRat
Reviews.Content: nice older, highly refurbished hotel. Upscale, in Backbay area. Across from Pru, near Copley Square, Newbury St, awesome roomtop pool, nice french restaurant, subway entrance right in front of hotel; safe enough for teenagers to go across street and shop in Prudential bldg. Very clean, experienced staff. Stayed 6 yrs in a row

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and very Hospitalable, will defintely recommend to others.”
Reviews.Author: Brenda M
Reviews.Content: The service at this Hotel is excelent and wonderful. The employees shows great hospitality. Would defintely recommend this Hotel for others to stay. And whenever in area again will be my first choice pick. The rooms with the front view are great you can see most everything from the front. The rooms are clean on a daily base, that's what I love about it the most.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance and splendor in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Brian W
Reviews.Content: My honey and I recently traveled to Boston for a visit with family. I can't say enough about how great our stay was at the Colonnade. First of all, it's a beautiful hotel, including the lobby with great art, the well maintained and appointed fitness center, the lovely room, and the rooftop pool. We had our nephews come over one afternoon for burgers and a swim. Another terrific feature is the location, which is steps away from the Prudential stop on the green line in Bay Back, which is a great neighborhood. But the best part of all was the classic (but not stuffy) old world service. For example, when we were about to take a walk, the bell captain made sure we had umbrellas because it looked like it was about to rain. The entire staff was friendly, warm, and made sure we were always comfortable. We loved staying here and won't hesitate to come back next time we're in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Rosa W
Reviews.Content: Do NOT order food from Brassaire Jo's!! It is pricey and tasteless. The best thing about this hotel is the great bellman and it's proximity to so much. Across the street is the Prudential Bldg and access to the convention center, subway, etc. The first room that I was given was the absolutely pits. Depressing alley view surrounded by concrete and [hone or wifi signals cannot get through. Additionally, the king lux room was very small. I requested another room with a street view--much better. I have and iPreferred card which is suppose to offer an upgrade and free internet service. I left the number at home so I missed out on the card's amenities. The front desk staff and concierge need lessons in customer friendliness. They are very cool insensitve people who did not crack a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Best experience in Boston!!”
Reviews.Author: GApeachlovestravel
Reviews.Content: I had such a great experience from the minute I walked in the door. Everyone was so polite, professional, and so friendly!! The doorman James and the manager Jerry were the best!! Anytime I'm back in Boston this is where I'm staying!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent !”
Reviews.Author: Ruth O
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for five days with a friend in March. Room was of a good standard, clean and spacious and very quiet. The location was great - right opposite Copley Plaza and a T stop right outside the door. We were unsure as to the best place to go for dinner / drinks but the concierge was extremely helpful (definitely more so than the people on the reception desk!). Would recommend the hotel to anyone and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay and the Hotel Staff was great.”
Reviews.Author: shedrian b
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived and checked in the staff was great. The rooms were very clean and pleasant. I visited the pool and the staff there was outstanding. Our server was Mike and the manager's name was Angela. "Great personalities". I am going to make sure all my co-workers, family, and friends who visit Boston know about the Colonade Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, noisy corridor!”
Reviews.Author: CP_H_UK
Reviews.Content: The hotel couldn't have been in a better location for my wife and I's needs, on a short first trip to Boston. Right across the street from the Prudential Centre and just steps from a T station, Prudential. It had excellent links further into city. Lovely bars just a short walk to fashionable Newbury Street. Try Papa Razzi very friendly bar stafNiceSt had a nice comfy bed, and otherwise not too bad a double room. Just wish that the door to the room had some noise insulation, noise from folks chatting as they went to from their rooms was really intrusive. And the noise went both ways as you could hear clearly what folks were up to in their rooms as you walked passed, ahem!

Reviews.Title: “Not Cheap But A Good Boston Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WolveyGeordie
Reviews.Content: Rooms are a good size for a city centre hotel, and very clean. Right opposite the Prudential building. A quick cab ride to all of the key tourist spots. The kids loved the roof top pool. Make sure that you get a rate that includes breakfast and parking

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel great value”
Reviews.Author: NYC102005
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean, tastefully decorated and spacious. Service was very good (the front desk was very acommodating as we changed rooms to get a better view). Good location near the Prudential mall.

Reviews.Title: “Best location”
Reviews.Author: Rose M
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel if not a bit pricey. Close to everything. Rooftop pool was closed due to inclement weather. Got a special rate so we could afford it. Wanted to stay one more day but the price doubled so we had to check out. Close to great family restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel experience ever...”
Reviews.Author: linda s
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from an extended stay at the Colonnade Hotel in Boston. My experience was amazing. The hotel is beautiful, clean and organized. But the people made the stay. Every single person at the Colonnade was outstanding. I never once felt out of place asking a question or expressing a need. Every guest is treated equally well. I travel a lot for business, and I have never felt more at home in a hotel. If you are in the Boston area, you will fully enjoy your Colonnade stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent indeed”
Reviews.Author: Merimaria
Reviews.Content: I had a good feeling about Colonnade right away when I stepped in and that feeling kept getting better and better the longer I stayed there. Staff at the reception, concierge and bell boys were all extremely helpful and polite. I have to give them credit for all the useful and objective tips and friendly attitude. We got a spacious double room with queen sized twin beds from the top floor. I just loved the stylish and fresh interior of the room, the beautiful bathroom with double doors and a little yellow bath duck. The window wall was all window, from floor to roof and the view was great. I could see all away to Fenway Park from up there. Location is perfect. If you arrive by train, Back Bay Station is just like 5mins walk from the hotel. Nearest subway station (Prudential Station, Green Line E) is just in front as the Prudential Center itself. ThereÂ´s also a dry cleaner / coin laundry just around the corner (W Newton St.) and great breakfast place called ThorntonÂ´s a block from the hotel (150 Huntington Av.). If you want to eat your breakfast at the hotel, it will be served in Brasserie Jo, which is like the hotelÂ´s own restaurant just next door. Breakfast was ok there, food was good, but in my opinion the place was a bit overpriced and service was, yes, polite but also stiff, cocky and cold. I wouldnÂ´t go there again, cause there are so many other breakfast places in Boston having friendly staff and great value for food. I have heard and red that the hotel has also quite a great roof top pool, but unfortunately it was closed during my stay cause it was raining all the time. I really liked the hotel and I would definitely recommend Colonnade to everybody!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: franci329
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location for shopping, dining and siteseeing. The room was very comfortable and the bed and linens are great. Bummer that parking is so pricey and that the staff is NOT so friendly. The Concierge needs a attitude adjustment, he clearly isn't happy at his job. As for the restaurant Brasserie Jo, my girlfriends and I walked in around 11pm and went straight to the bar. There were only 2 others sitting and probably around 10 others at the tables behind us. Anyways, we sat at the bar for about 10 minutes and didn't even get a glance from the bartender. 2 others walked in and stood behind us and the bartender turned around and asked them what they wanted to drink. In my eyes, this is poor service and just for that reason, I would never go back there again. Roof top pool is pretty cool but smaller than the picture appears. We checked in at noon on saturday and around 1ish made our way to the pool. Dissapointed that there were no chairs to sit, so we went shopping instead. All in all, the experience wasn't so great and I probably would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean room and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ldubdc
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean and spacious, the staff at the front desk and concierge desk were really friendly and very helpful. And the hotel is in a great location. We appreciated the floor to ceiling windows in our room and had a nice view of the Prudential Center. We only had one issue. We asked the same front desk attendant two times if he could arrange for turn down service and for some reason he couldn't get it done. However, all of the other staff were terrific. Great service and restaurant recommendations from the concierge. We would gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good all round”
Reviews.Author: PeterADH
Reviews.Content: Pleasant staff, good location, comfortable rooms, only issue was that at this price and grade of hotel one had to pay for interent access in room. Free access in Foyer/lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Overall very good- few suggestions”
Reviews.Author: Gate95
Reviews.Content: I spend a lot of time at this hotel- this year it will be close to 40 nights. I am finishing a 3 week stretch at the hotel. I have had a lot of time to learn about the place... First the strengths: 1) The rooms are uniformly excellent. The furniture, style and comfort are super. The bathrooms are modern, bright and clean. The linens and room maintenance are excellent. Rooms are bright, windows fill one entire floor to ceiling wall. There is a big TV, and nice Keurig coffee machine. 2) The gym is smallish, but well equipped. 3) The Brasserie on the first floor is fantastic. Truly super French food, in a beautiful art deco style. The service is super, the waiters and bartenders top-notch. The food is heavy, the wine French: many a nice night spent here. 3) Location is great. You are directly next to the Green Line E Train, and easy connections to the city. Lots of nearby shopping. Now, the room for improvement: While it aspires to be a luxury option, service is what prevents it from approaching the true luxury leagues. The major barrier is a lack of attention to detail. For a small independent hotel, customer relationships are sub-optimal. Despite spending 40 nights a year here, no staff member has ever addressed me by name, or even appeared to recognize me. Along this vein, CRM is not optimized at all. If I spent 40 nights at the Sheraton across the street, I would be recognized with a preferred status, or an upgrade, etc. In a small hotel, it might be a note from the manager, or a fruit plate. Here- in the middle ground, it's awfully anonymous. Next, service can be very spotty. The staff are very pleasant when you approach them with an issue (in my case a broken toilet). But followthrough is generally poor: days to get a repair with no updates, little attention to the problem, etc. A call for housekeeping supplies was forgotten. Followthrough is the problem time and time again. This seems to hold for room service who can deliver on time, but who seem to pick up plates from the hall once a day. There seem to always be dishes in the corridors (and a perpetual food odor in the halls). At any rate, will I continue to stay here? Probably (although the Copley Square is another nearly, recently renovated, fine choice). The rate/reward ratio is good, assuming you get a good rate. I like the room and the location. For most guests, the Colonnade is an fine choice for a short stay. But is the Colonnade what it could be? Not quite. I'm not sure what the obstacle is: disempowered staff ...absent management? One way or the other, the guest experience is as anonymous as that offered by a large conference center Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “nothing but good words”
Reviews.Author: Andrew L
Reviews.Content: The service was outstanding from check-in to check-out. The room service was outstanding, along with the guys up front, class act. The location is so nice and very easy to move around the City. So many great places to eat around the hotel. Nice size gym on the 5th floor with several carido machines. The Colonnade made my first stay in Boston a unique one and i will be back with my family. I felt very safe at all times and i felt like i was in the center of all activity with that location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for exploring Boston”
Reviews.Author: JUSTINATKIN
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel following a recommendation from a friend who works for Virgin Atlantic who accommodate their air crew there. We pre-booked online and made an excellent saving on the full 'rack rate' - our room was a deluxe double with x2 queen sized beds in a large room that included super en-suite, large flat screen TV with full range of services, coffee maker, i-pod docking station and mini-bar (charged). The room was tastefully decorated in modern browns / greys with really comfortable beds and crisp bedding. The hotel has a fitness centre and superb roof top swimming pool and sun/bar area open 0800-2000 daily throughout the summer, although closes during heavy rain. The hotel is located right next to the 'Prudential' Building and 'Prudential' Metro stop which makes access to the city so easy - we paid just $15 for a 7 day pass with unlimited metro/tram/bus travel. The hotel has a french themed restaurant which does superb breakfasts and not unreasonable prices. As with most hotels, laundry services are expensive but we used Berkley Cleaners, 1 minutes walk away, who charge just $1 per lb of laundry with a next day service. So, in summary, a great hotel in an ideal location.

Reviews.Title: “Had a very nice stay at the Colonnade. Great staff, location and amenities”
Reviews.Author: lmast26340
Reviews.Content: The Colonnade had a huge renovation a few years back, and it's definitely modernized the hotel, giving it a fresher, modern update. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful from the doorman, to bellman, to housekeeping, truly everyone we encountered. The location is fabulous on the edge of Back Bay and Copley, so big walkability factor to restaurants and shops--Copley Square shops across the street--as well as the Blue Line of the T outside the hotel, as well as a taxi stand. The in-house restaurant, Brasserie Jo, was a great bistro for any meal, and also nice for a cocktail. Rooftop pool was very nice but often closed for private events so we had limited access during our stay. Stayed there for a conference but would definitely return for a nice long weekend trip!

Reviews.Title: “disappointed, won't return”
Reviews.Author: fjal
Reviews.Content: Had looked forward to this hotel as reviews were so good, but we were disappointed. Room - luxe double double 1123 - was tiny for the four of us. Admittedly we did have a rollaway as well, as we have teenagers who don't like to share, but with that there was hardly any room to move around. Would rather have been told on booking that it wouldn't fit and I would have found somewhere else to stay. We asked if there were any larger rooms available but the reception desk were very uninterested in helping us and just said no. We were only there for 3 nights and roof top pool was closed for private party for one of those. Needed the concierge only on one day but, according to the receptionist, he hadn't turned up (certainly we saw no sign of him all day) and no one else could help us - ended up going to another nearby hotel for assistance. Reception couldn't help us with sending post to the UK - only dealt with US post. Car parking v expensive. From the wonderful looking website we were left feeling disappointed and irritated.

Reviews.Title: “Rooftop Pool a Great Bonus!”
Reviews.Author: VBeachy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Colonnade from July 1-4 for a shopping and leisure trip to Boston. The room was clean, spacious with great views of the city. We found the location to be very convenient to many attractions. We got the Boston City Pass and found it to be an excellent value and motivator to see the sites by prepaying for them. The Top of Hub at Prudential Centre was great and right across the street from the hotel. The MFA was also close by with a very interesting and varied collection. Our tip would be to head to the MFA close to the opening time on the weekend as it is very busy! The best part about the Colonnade was the rooftop pool. We enjoyed a couple hours of relaxation in a very pleasant environment twice on our trip. For a similar price point, we stayed at the Fairmont Copley Plaza last year. We must say that we would book the Colonnade again as it has the added value of great views and the rooftop pool. Ps. I also must admit that I ate at Atlantic Fish Company twice. Their steamed clams in tomato sauce were incredible!

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodations and fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: MaryS99
Reviews.Content: Our room was very nice and spacious. We had a family of four and had plenty of space. Every staff member was extremely polite and helpful. The concierge service was one of the best I have experienced. Location was great - we walked to Fenway, Newbury St and the Bostom Common. Took the subway downtown and to Cambridge. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time”
Reviews.Author: flower41748
Reviews.Content: We received a gift from our children of two nights at the Colonnade, July 29 & 30. We were very pleased. The room was lovely and very comfortable. We were surprised by the turn down service with a welcoming note from the Manager. From the day we arrived until we drove away after check-out the staff couldn't be more friendly and efficient. The concierge, Jerry Good, was very helpful and most important cheerful, as was the doorman, the front desk staff, the waiter, Greg, poolside and everyone we spoke with. We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves and hope to go back soon. We had Rm 1035 with a view of the Christian Science Church--great

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a long weekend.”
Reviews.Author: Philip007
Reviews.Content: The Colonnade was ideal for us. From the moment we arrived, the staff in the front lobby was attentive and greeted us to Boston, as very welcome guests to a special and beautiful city. The staff was truly helpful and was genuinely there to serve. The hotel was situated in a great location to explore the city. Fabulous restaurants were within an easy walking distance in the Back Bay area, which we found was safe, during both our daytime and evening strolls. The rooftop pool was an extra bonus, after the sweltering heat that we encountered during our stay in late July. Since we didn't bring our car along, take advantage of the Trolley Tours that give a great overview of the city. Overall, a wonderful and memorable stay at a fantastic hotel. Feel free to ask any questions if you have any concerns or questions about the hotel or the great restaurants in the area. Fenway Park was the highlight and was only about a 20 min walk away! Go Red Sox! Also checked out the home of the Bruins and Celtics.........truly the City of Champions. Kudos to the staff at the Colonnade for a great summer vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Silversam
Reviews.Content: Our extended family stayed at The Colonnade Friday and Saturday nights to celebrate my sister's 75th birthday. Because she was ill, we had room service for all of our meals--breakfast, lunch and dinner (including a variety of hors d'oeuvres). The service and food were terrific. Each of our rooms was elegant, all side by side so that we could be together. My sister had a suite, with the large living room easily accommodating eight of us. The chef concierage, the bus boys, the waiters, and everyone else were incredibly responsive and polite, always asking if they could help in further ways. We all gave the hotel the highest marks. We'll be back. John

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful people, with nice rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Thomashunt
Reviews.Content: Wonderful convenience, we walked everywhere. The people were always quick and more than happy to help. Jimmy was wonderful and you can tell he loves his job. Hilary was just as great and so helpful at the door.

Reviews.Title: “We were disappointed and will not return”
Reviews.Author: Mariantonio
Reviews.Content: The lobby looks much nicer on the web than in person. The concierge was hardly ever around and there were no brochures available. Our cot was left standing outside in front of our door when we returned at night and we had to bring it in and position it ourselves, when that should have been done by staff. It was a twin size and did not fold. The roooftop pool closes at 8 pm and the water was too cold to swim in.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with fabulous roof-top pool”
Reviews.Author: BaltimoreRunner
Reviews.Content: Ok, I was wrong. I wrote about the Colonnade over a year ago, panning it because I was put next to an elevator, and the front desk person was rude to me when I wanted to change rooms. Today, though, I had a totally different experience. I went to the hotel before a business meeting, hoping to at least store my suitcase, but Ryan had a room for me--and it was before noon. When I asked for a quiet room he placed me about as far away from the elevator as he could. My room is more than quiet: it has a wonderful view of the city (and sunset) plus the rooftop pool is a delight. The restaurant next door is still producing appetizing French bistro food. The room itself has everything a business (or pleasure) traveler could want, including wine glasses and a yellow rubber duck (not, perhaps, to be used together). I am glad I went back.

Reviews.Title: “Hot city, cool place”
Reviews.Author: sew0915
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place. Great location with T stop and Trolley stop right outside. The rooftop pool was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...with one exception”
Reviews.Author: PrimaDonaMom
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 4 nights at the Colonnade Hotel. Lovely furnishings, great location...close to subway stop and across the street from a mall. There is one big exception. If you book, ask for the times and dates that the rooftop pool will be closed. It is ordinarily supposed to be open from 8 am - 8 pm. Unfortunately, out of the 4 days we were there, it closed early (4pm) two of those nights. I did call the front desk and they said that doesn't happen very often and it is posted at the front desk. They didn't seem very concerned. There is nothing on the website so you can't really plan ahead..you're just out of luck. As I said, we enjoyed everything about the hotel except that.

Reviews.Title: “Rooftop swimming in Boston”
Reviews.Author: five4theroad
Reviews.Content: The Colonnade Hotel is located in the Back Bay area of Boston, close to the subway, shopping, restaurants and within walking distance of many great places to see (Fenway, Copley Square etc). Our room was good sized, comfy beds, nice bathroom (with a complimentary rubber ducky!). The rooftop pool was great, being that we were there during the recent heatwave! One day they closed the pool early due to a private party. It is posted in their information that this sometimes happens, but it would have been nice to have a sign by the elevator stating this that day to let their patrons know ahead of time, since we came back early from our touring just to swim and have drinks at the pool & were very disappointed that the pool closed at 4pm that day. The staff was nice, concierge was helpful, doorman always smiling and acknowledging us coming or going. Parking was pricey (but that's how it seemed to be everywhere in Boston) and paying for internet service is just irritating, should be included with your room. Otherwise it was an enjoyable stay and I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: MJfromNJ
Reviews.Content: Chose The Colonnade for its reasonable (for Boston) price. Seems to be newly renovated, so everything was modern and sleek. Room had 2 full beds and plenty of living space for us. Bathroom was certainly big enough. My daughter and I were doing college tours, not sightseeing, so we didn't need to be in the center of things. The T stop (green line) was right outside the Colonnade's front door -- excellent. And the Prudential Center is right across the street, convenient for air-conditioned walking around (there was a massive heat wave while we were there). Employees were friendly and helpful, the fitness center was nice (several treadmills, step machines, free weights and weight machines, and it was nice and cold in there!). Very convenient to have Brasserie Jo (not affiliated with the hotel, I believe) downstairs, especially after a day of very hot touring that left us unwilling to go back out into the heat for a restaurant search. Newbury St. shopping only a couple of blocks away. Very nice overall. BUT . . . if I were sightseeing, I might want to stay closer to all the big Boston attractions. We had to take the T everywhere -- fine, but as a tourist, I'd rather walk around and attractions were a bit far from the hotel. Oh, and if you're arriving by Amtrak, be sure to get off at Back Bay Station -- this hotel is only an easy 3-4 block walk from the station. Very nice stay overall.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it and its the best so far.”
Reviews.Author: joannajoanna_11
Reviews.Content: the hotel was very nice, I am the kind of person whoâ€™d love to see reviews and compare hotels online, and this one come across as the most valuable hotel ever. comparing with the other big hotels i saw when walking around boston, the colonnade doesnt have a grand entry or lobb, i.e when we wanted the taxi, the staff was so nice but the taxi was hard to get still. but this is just me being picky, otherwise there is nothing else to say other than it is great!! the room was neat and has a modern feel to it, the sleeping quality was great as well!! the rooms a standard room called king superium but its very spacious! with the great view of prudential as well!! they put newspaper outside ur door everymorning and we enjoyed the nice shower every night! not to mension the perfect location..subway literally 5 steps from the front door!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for sites and ball games”
Reviews.Author: pdrucker
Reviews.Content: Our Cubs Destinations tour booked us into this lovely hotel in the heart of Boston. Being across from the Prudential Center gave us access to shopping, restaurants, and even an Apple Store. The hotel was a stop on the sightseeing trolley and within walking distance of the 3 night games at Fenway Park that were part of our package. The rooms were spacious and comfortable and the staff accommodated us with nearby and adjoining rooms. If only the Cubs had won more than one game.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel perfect location”
Reviews.Author: JKFRadnor_PA
Reviews.Content: Bed, shower,pool,restaurant were all great and the staff could not have been friendlier. Natalie at the front desk is a delight!

Reviews.Title: “Prohibition??”
Reviews.Author: StephanieOBrien
Reviews.Content: conâ€¢cierge A hotel employee whose job is to assist guests by arranging tours, making theater and restaurant reservations, etc My friends and I stayed at the Colonnade over 4th of July weekend had a great experience with the exception of an overzealous concierge. Due to the liquor laws in Boston (no alcohol sales on Sundays or holidays) we were forced to stock up for a Monday BBQ at a friendâ€™s place on Saturday. Realizing that a car full of alcohol might attract unwanted attention we brought our beverages for the BBQ in through the front door of the hotel only to be scolded, harassed, and humiliated by the concierge who ridiculed us as if we were 5 year olds drawing on the wallpaperâ€¦in the middle of the lobby no less! I understand his assumption that we were going to have a party in the room (which we werenâ€™t) but his tact and grace were severely lacking, especially for a concierge who is supposed to be the ambassador of customer service. This gentlemen should stick to what his job is; helping guests find places to eat, drink, and have fun. Rather than berate guests with wild assumptions of future wrong doings. Iâ€™d expect an interrogation from security but NOT the concierge! Given the price, Iâ€™d expect far superior customer service from such key personnel as the concierge. This left such a bad taste in my mouth that I will not stay at this hotel again nor recommend it to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “bonus--subway stop out front!”
Reviews.Author: lpinA2mi
Reviews.Content: I plan on returning to the Colonnade, as they are actively recruiting for repeat customers (price & upgrade incentives, as well as some other courtesies--imagine doormen who glance at your luggage tag, so that can immediately address you as Ms_____). I did indicate that I would be returning to Boston regularly, as my eldest is a new admitted student into Northereastern University and that I was shopping around for â€œmy Boston hotelâ€�. Colonnade was the only hotel to jump on this lead. Omni, Hilton, and disappointingly the Copley Square boutique hotel did not. I preferred the large room/small bathrooms floorplan of the Colonnade over the Copely Square small room/large bathroom floorplan. Like the Copley Square, the Colonnade had a recent facelift, albeit not as chic. The best feature is the new bathroom door configuration. It slides, which makes the usual cramped room entry with 3 doors (closet+bath+hallway) much more workable. Unfortunately, our first room had major bathroom issues. The remodeling was not done well, so that the tub was separating from the marble walls and the marble floor was caving at the rear of the tub. I did not notice this until my morning shower, when I stepped to the rear of tub and it flexed like a water mattress. My second room had no issues, and the change was done to minimize the hassle to me. As an aside, such oversight is not unique to The Colonnade. I have found in recent travel years that knowledge of the condition of a room needing attention (major/construction or mechanical, significant/mold or minor/burned-out bulbs, unplugged clocks) is not adequately shared among cleaning crew and management. Surprisingly, when I leave a written note concerning significant or minor deficiences for the crew, so as to prevent any trouble, the requested fix is usually ignored. About 25% of my stays require me, as a customer, alerting the front desk. The Copley Square was not without issues. Although its restaurant served the kind of food I eat most often (noveau healthy cuisine), Its bar attracts quite an evening crowd. When it empties, the noise on street woke me every night. Joâ€™s Brassiere, the restaurant attached to the Colonnade, served authentic french countryside comfort food dishes, which is what I prefer over high presentation and over sauced dishes. I wish that the French inflections of the servers could be dropped, whenever they are not authentic. The only staple that needs improving is the baguette. It is flavorlessâ€”likely due to a quick rise process. It would be better if they served demi-baguettes with more flavor. As a solo diner, I was still given a good table. My vegetarian/pescatarian daughter found foods to eat, when we ate together, as we often order several small dishes to share. I enjoyed every meal I had--especially knowing that some are rare to come across in any city. As an added bonus, there is a subway stop just outside the front door! Those travelling with children might like to know that there is a rooftop pool that is open seasonally.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful lobby, nice room, excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: Mike_at_Work
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location in the city. My room had a good view of the Prudential center (I think that's what it was). The lobby is beautiful; nice waiting areas with comfortable furniture. The room has a modern feel. The bed was comfortable, with lots of pillows. No complaints. The service was excellent; everyone was friendly and helpful. Lobby staff (Norman) was especially friendly and attentive. I was treated like a movie star or perhaps the CEO of something.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: sofang
Reviews.Content: Great choice...super friendly staff, gorgeous pool, great location. A terrific choice!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: babe199
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 12 nights in june/july. requested a room with a view which I got. Very comfortable bed. Graet location. T stops outside the hotel. Prudential shopping centre across the road. Rooms are nice and big. Had turn down service every night. Staff very friendly. Had breakfast in hotel once which was o.k Trident bookshop in newbury street was the best place to have breakfats!Roof top pool was great. Views from top of hotel are fantastic. Would stay again if we visited Boston.We love Boston and would love to return again! Only negative point was not having free internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: Mikvet
Reviews.Content: Room was awesome very clean and huge king size comfortable bed. A nice and happy staff made me very comfortable. Food at conference was superb! Excellent hotel organization!

Reviews.Title: “This is one of our favorite hotels anywhere”
Reviews.Author: Lovetraveling199
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. Great decor in rooms and whole facility. Very comfy beds and clean as a whistle. Super location in the Pru area. Near Fenway, the MFA. T right outside the door. The roof top pool is the best in Boston and a great place to relax after sightseeing or an afternoon Sox game. Great for kids, but you won't be bothered by them in your room, etc.. Staff is terrific and eager to help. Stay on an upper floor and have a choice of great views. Front over looks the Pru and the Christian Science Reflecting Pool. We had the South End view this year on the Fourth of July. Watched fireworks in 6 or 7 locations up and down the South Shore. Always have a great time at the Colonnade. Also a great location for graduation from one of the many Boston colleges.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Blue4Star4
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Rooms are a good size and very clean. Staff was friendly and helpful. The rooftop pool is great - the food & drinks up there are great, too. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A new home in Boston”
Reviews.Author: ricbeard
Reviews.Content: Made reservations at the Colonnade for a business conference nearby, with some concern about not staying at a hosting hotel. Needless concern, since the Colonnade offered all that we could have desired. Housekeeping was efficient, friendly, and gracious, while the attached restaurant, Brasserie Jo, was exceptional. Jerry Good, their omnipresent concierge, offered wonderful service and advice throughout our week-long stay. The front desk was also efficient and courteous. The room was quite comfortable, especialy the bed, with a modern style and all amenities supplied. We found room service to be gracious and quick and the food to be delicious. On-site self-parking proved quite convenient, although the location in the Copley Square area and convenience of transportation did not require use of our vehicle. Take some time to visit the rooftop pool, an exceptional oasis in the city. The hotel also has a commendable exercise and fitness area, which is very conveniently located right off the elevator. All in all, we liked everything about the hotel, but we appreciated the staff the most and leaving the least.

Reviews.Title: “special hotel, staff and location”
Reviews.Author: jackbow44
Reviews.Content: Genuinely friendly staff, clean, great location and great pillows! I was with my 10 year old granddaughter who I often take trips with. She always loved the four seasons but after this weekend she told me the Colonnade was her new favorite. The roof top pool was special for both of us as we had a great time swimming and sun bathing and she got a kick out of having breakfast and lunch poolside.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: LegionVet
Reviews.Content: Look at the map and you might think you want to pass this hotel up because it's not in the historic center. Don't believe it. The Boston "T" or subway is right out the front door and three stops away is the historic Freedom Trail. Across the street is the Duckmobile Tours that go around the historic sites and downtown as well as on the Charles River. They start in front of the Convention Center(across the street) which has plenty of shopping, hotels, restaurants, as well as a nice food court. Take a nice leisurely walk about 10 blocks and you're at Fenway Park! The hotel has a beautiful rooftop pool(a little small) that makes for a perfect end to a long siteseeing day. The concierge answered our questions and arranged for tours and a whalewatching trip. The hotels's attached garage was extremely convenient and they have staff on the garage levels watching over the place when you are coming late in the evening(great touch!) We will definitely be returning and basing ourselves out this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay. Recommend It.”
Reviews.Author: Cabbagetowntoronto
Reviews.Content: As we are budget cautious travellers, we usually tend to stay in Comfort Inn's and similar hotels. We were therefore a bit reluctant to pay over $200 per night, but decided to give a try to the Colonnade. This was a great decision and worth it! The extra bucks we spent at the Colonnade gave us so much more, that we now feel a Comfort Inn is way overpriced for what we get! Clean, spacious room, tastefully decorated rooms, good quality towels and bathrobe (not the ordinary see-through stained and washed out cheap towel!!), comfy bed and pillows, nice bathroom amenities, friendly staff, hassle free check in and out, great location. This is the perfect retreat after a busy day. As we are dog owner, dining out with our pooch is very challenging. So we were delighted to buy our food in the restaurants across the street and bring it back in our room, for a relaxing diner "at home". (and being able to sit on a real table- with a view-, with real chairs... not the ordinary tiny computer desk cluttered with the yellow pages and disposable paper cups!) Lobster and delicious Chowda is just across the street! We were there on Independence Day and street was pretty busy that night. We found out that extra staff was on duty to screen people willing to get access to rooms. A good point for the residents safety! We had our breakfasts at Jo Brasserie. It's reasonably priced, with a top notch service. On the negative side, internet is not free and becomes very pricey if you intend to use it everyday. Same comment for the parking. At $38 per day, it's not a bargain, but offers in and out privilege, and has direct convenient access to the lobby and rooms.
