We are experienced world travellers and have been staying in all kind of hotels, from cheap Inns to pricier Westin's ,Shangri-La's, Hyatt's and so... Staying at the Colonnade is probably one of our best experience, and one of the greatest value for our bucks.

Reviews.Title: “Location! Friendly staff and great service”
Reviews.Author: PRsouth
Reviews.Content: The Colonnade is an excellent hotel. Great location near Prudential/Copley, easy access to Back Bay and South End. Friendly staff and good service. Clean, comfortable rooms. Good value for rate.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Torfig
Reviews.Content: Modern hotel (newly renovated) in a great Boston location! Just opposite the Prudential shopping centre with the entrance to the prudential subway station located a few feet from the main entrance the location is hard to fault. Newbury street is on the other side of the Prudential centre and it's safely within walking distance of downtown Boston. The staff was helpful, the service was upscale, the rooms modern and spacious. HD TV in all rooms. Great views on one side of the hotel! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff and hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: tstan81
Reviews.Content: We went here for our 2nd anniversary and I had booked it becuase of the rooftop pool. The hotel was great, very clean, nice pool and the food service was good too! The concierege was outstanding his name was Jerry and he was so wonderful to us!! We told him we were ceebrating our anniversary and he set up reservations at a nearby restaurant that treated us amazing, and sent up sparkling water and fruit for after! He had a vast knowledge of Boston and was very helpful in us deciding what to do. The hotel was so accomodating to anything we needed, room service took no more the 20 minutes anytime we ordered, staff was friendly and welcoming. Even when we checked out Norman who helped us with our bags went out of his way to make our exit easy!! Can't say enough wonderful things about this hotel, won't stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Clean rooms, Nice Staff - What More Do you Want?!”
Reviews.Author: tantine
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Colonnade this past weekend and were very pleased! We would definitely stay here again. Rooms were very clean and comfy. Hotel looks older from the outside but the rooms have all been redone and are very nice. Beds and bedding are very comfy!! Nice large windows to check out the streets below. Table and 2 chairs was perfect for kids to have a snack. Rooftop pool was a definite plus. Kids enjoyed a swim while we had a drink - a nice relaxing way to spend a couple hours in the afternoon. Front desk staff, concierge, bell man all very courteous and friendly. Restaurant staff were very nice and attentive. We ate breakfast in the restaurant both mornings (we had a rate that included it) and breakfast was very nice. Kids breakfast menu included everything they could want. Nice way to start the day. Hotel is located across from Prudential Center. T stop and Orange and Green Tour Trolley stops are here. Red (Gray Line Tour) trolley stop is a block away at the Sheraton. We walked to Fenway and Northeastern. About 10 min taxi ride to Fanueil Hall or Aquarium. Plenty of food options within a block or 2. Cheesecake Factory, 5 Napkin Burger, California Pizza Kitchen, Cold Stone right across the street on street level. Food court with lots of quick options in Prudential Center across the street. Pizzeria Uno a block away. 7-11 a block away was very handy for water/snack stop. We had heard that street rooms were noisy but did not find this to be the case. You can hear when emergency vehicles go by with their sirens during the night but it happened maybe twice. Not an inconvenience at all. There is a charge for parking but we booked a Boston Escape package which included parking and breakfast for two.

Reviews.Title: “Clearly the best place in Boston, especially the rooftop pool!!!! The staff makes you feel at home!”
Reviews.Author: golfguyigc
Reviews.Content: We just celebrated my son's birthday with a two day stay at The Colonnade. We had an amazing time with my son and his 5 buddies. The roof top pool is simply amazing and the attentive staff combined with excellent food made us extend our stay another day!! do yourself a favor and stay here, the location is great and the overall experience will have you coming back every time to The Colonnade Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “all around excellent”
Reviews.Author: suzz524
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel. Room was comfortable and modern. Rooftop pool was relaxing, trendy and fun. I will return to this hotel on all my visits to Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, only downside reception staff!”
Reviews.Author: pashasNewcastle
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel room, bright and spotlessly clean. Great location. No faults at all with hotel or services with the exception of reception staff. A quick lesson in customer service and this hotel would be spot on. Don't be put off still worth a stay!

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel wished we had stayed before on a previous visit to boston”
Reviews.Author: toffeebonbon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel from l3th to 20th June. It was very enjoyable and good 4 star hotel. You get what you pay for Breakfast was excellent little touches like 'proper butter' and small pots of mamon jam. The room we had was at the back of the hotel which was excellent no complaints at all. We asked the maid if she could clean our room between l2noon and 4.00.pm no problem at all. Did not bother with pool until last day and how silly of us. I like to walk and my husband likes to relax in the sun it was the perfect place to do that. The only complaints that I have as one other reviewer pointed out the hallways are dim and the carpet outside the lifts in the lobby were very stained which I found quite off putting in a 4 star hotel. The other slight complaint would be they should have a proper bar seating area (not by the bar) so that you don't feel obliged tohave a meal if you dont want to by sitting on bar stools. Other than those those two things we had a lovely stay, Boston is such a wonderful friendly American city

Reviews.Title: “Great experience -- will return”
Reviews.Author: Ted006
Reviews.Content: Great experience at the Colonnade, again. Room always really feels clean. Staff is obviously professional, well trained and consistently courteous. Norman, one of the uniformed personnel, was a standout of excellence.

Reviews.Title: “Dim hallways, great service”
Reviews.Author: velojmp
Reviews.Content: Rooms are great, service is very good (with the exception of some waiting for service at the front desk....). Restaurant is very good as is the rooftop pool area and bar (on the downside, they close too early)..... Hairdryers in the rooms are not very good....small detail but one of the only areas where attention to detail is lacking. Hallways are very dark, almost shabby. Doors of the rooms slam shut which makes for noisy neighbors. Rooms on the Huntingdon avenue side (odd numbers) are larger but noisier..... Finally the AC is not great in some of hte rooms and they need to work on the bathroom fans. Would stay there again for price, location and the rooftop pool. A nice boutique style hotel, well located.....

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: wbLA
Reviews.Content: The Colonnade is a well managed hotel with friendly and helpful staff. The rooms are comfortable with all the amenities necessary for the discerning traveller. We were offered umbrellas when it was raining and given assistance with all our travel questions in the city. We have found our home in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “A great wedding reception”
Reviews.Author: JCM11
Reviews.Content: We held a wedding reception at the Colonnade and it was exceptionally well planned and managed. The cocktail hour was held on the rooftop pool area and the skies opened up to sunshine just before the event. The atmosphere, the staff, and the appetizers were great. The following dinner and the dinner service was also top notch. Thanks to Kristyn and the staff, Jerry, and Chef Nick.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but Quirky”
Reviews.Author: lawNc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were at the Colonnade for five nights, as part of a conference held at the hotel. The location is tops, and Brasserie Jo serves excellent breakfasts with very good service. The parking garage is expensive but convenient, as is the location of the hotel itself, near the Prudential Center, public transportation, and shopping. On the downside, the TV-Internet connection was very difficult to use; the lighting in the room and hallways was extremely dim (almost dangerous) and our bathtub seemed to collect water underfoot, resulting in a decidedly squishy feel when taking a shower. We would stay here again, but might even bring our own lightbulbs, to facilitate reading...no kidding.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, staff and location”
Reviews.Author: ChampignonSauvage
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our one night stay here in June last week - I was very pleasantly surprised as I'd seen some negative reviews on here about unfriendly staff but this turned out to be the opposite. The room was very spacious, modern and bright, it even had a dining table and chairs, plus ceiling to floor windows with a fantastic view of the city - Prudential Centre and and Symphony hall - very pretty at night. The staff did their utmost to make us welcome and importantly it felt genuine, unlike other hotels we stayed at where staff sound like robots. We dined in Brasserie Jo and it was a perfect end to our two week trip in the US - the brasserie is stylish, busy and bustling with a city dining atmosphere (also serves food until 11 - we were shocked in Maine where dinner is usually only served until 9) We had a great steak Bearnaise with a fantastic bottle of Bordeaux recommended by their sommelier. The brasserie also has a lovely cocktail bar. The location is excellent - there is a metro stop right outside the hotel taking you downtown within a few stops. Newbury Street and Copley Square are a short walk away. Personally we preferred Newbury Street to being downtown. Unfortunately the weather wasn't great so the rooftop terrace wasn't open but we went up to have a look and I can imagine it would be a lovely spot to have an apertiff on a warm summer evening - sadly we missed that, the weather in Boston was awful so we spent more time in the hotel luckily in a great one. Just a special mention to the reception manager who kindly organised late check out for us - thank you we really appreciated it. Would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a first class hotel without paying the earth.

Reviews.Title: “A New Fave!”
Reviews.Author: KittyGags
Reviews.Content: I always looked at the Colonnade when I was leaving town and wondered why I hadn't ever stayed there...and the next time I went to go to Boston for work, the Westin was sold out. I'm an SPG member so I was annoyed but it was a perfect excuse to stay somewhere else! And boy am I glad I did! I was so welcomed at the Colonnade, the service is fantastic from the moment you walk in, til the moment you leave. The gym is nice and be sure to check out the rooftop pool bar!

Reviews.Title: “Second stay...liked the first, loved the second!”
Reviews.Author: pegfach
Reviews.Content: Best value and centrally located on the T(can walk to fFenway and many other attractions). Rooms very clean and quiet, street side view better. Great K-cup coffee. Beds extremely comfy. Concierge John and bellhop Norman excellent with information and service. Breakfast excellent in Brasserie jo and roof top pool clean, relaxing and great waitress service with unusuall variety of frozen drinks. Parking was pricey but thats Boston. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “A Nice City Retreat”
Reviews.Author: nycmom1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my teenage son, then husband joined later, for four nights, in a double/double room. Room was clearly recently renovated and was very nice - my only complaint I that I wish the room had two queens instead of double beds. Had everything else we could ask for. We were on top floor, so just a quick walk up the stairs, and we were at the small, but very nice pool deck. The food at the poolside restaurant was brought up fromthe Brasserie Jo downstairs. We ate breakfast there t two days, and lunch there two other days. We made good use of the concierge Cindy, who helped us procure Red Sox tickets, and who had good restaurant recommendations and directions. thanks Cindy! The hotel is pretty close to Fenway, we walked home two nights from the game. Good location right across the street from Prudential Center mall and restaurants, including Five Napkin Burger (yum!). Sorry for typos, using an iPad, and the app does not let you scroll back to edit!

Reviews.Title: “Colonnade was first class and we will return.”
Reviews.Author: Doidgemorris
Reviews.Content: We stayed two days at the end of a cruise and were delighted with the location, the staff was helpful and the room was newly decorated and spotless. Our city view room offered a spectacular view. Lots of shopping in the next block, grocery store across the street and several restaurants close by. Brasserie Jo the hotel dining room excellent "linen" table service. Hop on, hop off buses stop in front of the hotel which could not be more convenient. Guarantee price match.

Reviews.Title: “I never stay anywhere else in Boston!!”
Reviews.Author: Snappy65
Reviews.Content: You will be so pleased with your stay at the Colonnade Hotel. The location is perfect for sights and dining. The rooftop pool is so beautiful and relaxing that I sacrificed many hours of shopping just to stay in my chaise. The fitness center was also a huge draw for us and did not disappoint. You'll have what you need for an excellent workout. We are going back two more times this summer! You can't pull us away!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Visitor155019
Reviews.Content: Niece clean hotel and rooms also very friendly, helpful reception staff. Hallways a bit noisy, but fault of inconsiderate guests.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous”
Reviews.Author: staffer12
Reviews.Content: the room was ready for us on arrival, which was very early. the staff were very helpful when asked questions about boston. the rooms were very clean, the bed was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great family holiday for families with teenagers.”
Reviews.Author: snwall
Reviews.Content: Was very surprised at how upmarket this hotel was, the rooms where above what you would expect from a 4star hotel. The pool was a great place too relax after a morning or afternoon off sightseeing, with the pool bar serving excellent quality lunchtime meals. The hotel was very clean and the rooms had good quality toiletries. With the underground station on your doorstep this hotel provides easy access to Harvard, Cambridge shopping mall a must for fashion concious teens and downtown Boston. Newbury street is just a short stroll and do check out The Pour House for excellent value evening meals which will satisy any family. Another plus is that the cheesecake factory is opposite for those with a sweet tooth.This hotel is excellent for a relaxing city break.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, will definitely stay there on return to Boston”
Reviews.Author: angelakane75
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Colonnade for 7 nights and found it to be a lovely hotel with excellent and attentive staff. My initial attraction to the hotel was its excellent location with the trolley tour stopping right outside, the subway stop also being right outside and the Prudential Centre right across the street. The staff were fantastic. I had forgotten to request non-allergenic bedding (I have asthma) and phoned reception after we had checked in - the replacement bedding was with us and the bed remade within 15 minutes - very impressive indeed! The room was very spacious and the bed the most comfortable I've ever had in a hotel. The hotel also has a roof top pool and we made use of this as the temperatures soared in the 90s. Lovely clean and comfortable area with bar and restaurant facilities. We had a lovely lunch beside the pool, a real treat in a city location.

Reviews.Title: “Trying too hard”
Reviews.Author: honeymooncanada
Reviews.Content: The Colonadde Hotel has a nice, convenient location. The outside of the building looks dated. A significant amount of money has been spent renovating the inside. It is an odd blend of very old/art deco era styling and very modern touches. I personally don't feel like it works. The hotel seems to be trying to be very chic, similar to a W property. The lighting on the elevator was so dim, that people were having to get very close to the buttons to see which one to push. It also featured some thumping techno music which really wasn't necessary for my couple minute trip upstairs. The hallway to my room was also a bit dark and had a stale smell to it. When you open up the room, the TV turns on automatically. Why that is necessary - I have no idea. The room itself was very modern. I found it reasonably spacious for a big-city hotel room. The complimentary toiletries were very nice but strong smelling when you entered the bathroom, which I assume most male business travellers would not appreciate. Almost like you were walking into Bath and Body Works. I paid $13.95 for 24 hours of internet access. When I went to the business center, I learned that my payment from upstairs in my room didn't "count", so I would have had to pay again. The quirky electronics continued to haunt me after a storm that evening. My TV proceeded to turn itself on every 5 minutes. I suspect the sensors that figure out if someone is in the room went haywire. It was a big hassle and I wasted an hour of sleep. After several calls to the front desk, the only remedy was to unplug the TV. It wasn't a great first impression.

Reviews.Title: “A home from home!”
Reviews.Author: LittleJoolz
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 7 nights and found it thoroughly chilled. It is brilliantly located, as the Old Town Trolley Tour stops bang outside the Lobby and the T System subway was also right outside too! Also centrally located for walking. Staff couldnt do enough to help, shame the same couldnt be said of Virgin staff! The Colonnade helped us with info on trips, local shops/streets etc and the housekeeping staff were friendly, attentive and even came knocking with extra coffee when we were stuck in our room for 2 days, when my son was sick. Norman the doorman, gave us some good places to go to save money. The roof top pool was very clean, well maintained and staff friendly, attentive yet not in-your face. I guess my only complaint was that my room (603) faced the Colonnades Residences so we had no view what so ever, which was awlful when stuck in the room for 2 days, because of this is was also very dark, as lighting in the room is limited and im just glad my husband brought a touch so I could see into the wardrobe! Would definately come back if in Boston again!

Reviews.Title: “Great, enjoyable trip”
Reviews.Author: mmmmm77
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conviently located across the street from the Prudential center and a very short walk to the famous Newbury Street. On sight parking. Very friendly and helpful staff. Perfect place for business or pleasure. Be sure to visit the roof top pool!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: frito5
Reviews.Content: Everything was great! Room was clean, modern, comfortable bed, no complaints at all! Pool area was very nice, the staff was very helpful, and polite! Would recommend this hotel to anyone. We had a great view of the city!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable beds. Great location. Great staff. Good restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: Geowin79
Reviews.Content: In Boston for a graduation and combined leisure trip. The Colonnade was very comfortable, convenient and friendly. Highly recommend and would go back. Restaurant excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for graduation trip!”
Reviews.Author: carolynanddavid
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Colonnade Hotel in Boston several times a year for the last four years, with our most recent trip this month being for our daughter's graduation from a nearby college. The hotel has always met all of our needs--good service, helpful concierge with great recommendations for dinner and help with reservations and a wonderful location. Handy to Newbury Street, the Pru Center and a number of colleges. All in all, it's been a good choice for all of these stays and we hope to continue as our daughter stays on in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “The personal, friendly service and prime location of the Colonnade made this our favourite place to stay in Boston.”
Reviews.Author: hallie_griff
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Colonnade always went out of their way to make our stay fantastic. The hotel is centrally located to great shopping, restaurants and tourist attractions. You certainly don't need a car if you stay here. The food served by friendly waiters, was delicious at the restaurant in the hotel, Brasserie Jo. We will certainly stay at the Colonnade the next time we are in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing at best”
Reviews.Author: Calibre57
Reviews.Content: This is the lowest end of a 4 star hotel I can imagine. The lobby is unimpressive. The conceriege station was unstaffed on a Saturday afternoon. The front desk staff does nothing to indicate they value or appreciate their guests; very indifferent attitudes. The valet is the best part of the check-in experience. He's great. The rooms are dark and dowdy as are the hallways. Our view was into a back alley type of area. Ugly. The restaurant off the lobby is a french bistro that's quite handsome aethestically but the service is so rushed it's difficult to enjoy the food (which is mediocre). We ate there twice thinking the first time was the result of a busy Saturday night. It was no better for Sunday brunch. Wait staff is rushed and rude. The location is the only thing about this hotel that I can recommend. At tempted as I am to check out the pool in the summer months, (outdoor rooftop pools are rare in Boston) the experience was so unpleasant, I would not go back even for the pool. There are many much better choices in the Back Bay of Boston (pretty hotels with warm, inviting environments and hospitable staff) to waste one's money here.

Reviews.Title: “Top class”
Reviews.Author: Tonyvaya
Reviews.Content: I can not critise anything that the hotel provided. Everything was at its top, spotless rooms, friendly front desk, comfortable lounging area, great location. Would definitely recommend it to anyone who is going to Boston! Loved it

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from the Colonade at all cost; Boston too if possible.”
Reviews.Author: Epodec
Reviews.Content: 1. The hotel has no free wireless for guests, even Motel 6 has that in 2011. 2. The "rooftop pool" is completely off limits due to construction, one can't even relax on the roof. 3. The gym is also inaccessible after 8pm. 4. Do not expect a polite desk clerk or staff, they are more apt to treat you like a criminal stealing a room after you've paid. They even card you when you come back if you go for a walk! The ONLY positive is that the room is fairly clean, but at these prices I expect more than a room with a made bed and clean floor. Save your time and money to go elsewhere, this town is a smelly dump and The Colonade isn'Å£ an improvement on the town.

Reviews.Title: “4 star hotel? worst front desk service I've ever had.”
Reviews.Author: LOOKA-DC
Reviews.Content: We always have two family trips a year. Trip advisor always gave good advice which hotel we can stay with the best choice. Obviously Colonnade Hotel seems not the case. We had stay in three hotels during our first trip this year. Colonnade was the first hotel. We booked a Non-refundable King size bed room about one and half month ago. We drove about 8-9 hours from DC finally arrived the hotel at 3:00pm and we are exhausted. , at the front desk, without any Greeting, a Front Desk Manager just simply ask us to sign an safety agreement of our dog and hand in us the room key and saying nothing to us. We just found out that instead of a king size bed room the front desk manager gave us a two queen size beds room. After our complaining, without any apologize she finally gave us a king size bed and say to us booking through the internet can never guarantee anything. The day before we check out, we receive a bill from the front desk charge us 9 dollars of using the mini-bar. We did not take anything out from the mini bar so we call to the front desk ask them to removed the charge. Front desk told us all the charge has been removed. When I come back, my credit card has been charge another 4.75 dollars. So I have to call again to the hotel to ask them to remove. They suggested me to call to their accounting department to fix this problem since they can do nothing about it. Not all the service staffs were bad. Actually, the Bell Desk Staff- Jimmy was great. I just hope the hotel General Manager can see my review and training their front desk staffs. Specially the bad service was given by a front desk manager. what a sham...

Reviews.Title: “The Colonnade Hotel is our home away from home, and has been for the last 3 years!”
Reviews.Author: RobertMarvel
Reviews.Content: The Colonnade Hotel is centrally located to great restaurants, to the Copley Square and Prudential malls, to the Duck Boat rides, and its 5 star restaurant Brasserie Joe is superb! I highly recommend this boutique hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fab location - near shops and restaurants and subway .”
Reviews.Author: plasticpaddyLondon
Reviews.Content: we have just come back from a really good time in Boston, MA . Hotel was so nice, it had bacis facilities but the location is great . twenty minutes form the airport, across the street from a fab shopping mall and great restaurants . Literally next door to the subway . door staff and concierge very friendly and helpful (front desk staff less so ! ) Recommed the seven day subway pass for just $15 . Cheese cake factory restarant is sooo good with great food and fab staff . Hotel restauarnt for breakfsst is over priced and service not great but we used it a couple of times for convenimce. i thnk next time I would not bother.Great vacation and cannot wait to go back !

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, Handy location”
Reviews.Author: Julie_PwMS
Reviews.Content: The main reason we stayed here was to go to the baseball - Fenway Park is walking distance from here. Yes the renovation is nice, and the beds are comfortable. The window took up the entire wall of the room. However the bathroom was small and the air conditioner / heater was noisy all night. The Prudential Tower (Sky Walk and lots of shopping, incl Barnes & Noble) are directly across the road. Newbury Street shopping and Boston Common are within walking distance. The entrance to the Subway is immediately left of the hotel entrance, so you can explore a lot of Boston with very little effort. Try the Cheesecake Factory (huge menu) or Californial Kitchen (both over the road) for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: csmith707
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel located in the ideal spot to tour Boston. The restaurant served a wonderful lunch and a great price. Staff is very friendly and helpful. We stay here ever time we visit Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Mediocre Service”
Reviews.Author: LucyEths
Reviews.Content: Check in was great but after that the staff was a little rude. The rooms were really nice and the beds were amazing! The room even had a nice view. Usually when I travel the front desk staff and doormen are always excepotionally polite but in this case they acted a little snooty. The price was right so I can't complain too much, plus they let us check in a little early which was really helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: LynseyDublin
Reviews.Content: Great hotel...big rooms with big comfy bed! Service was excellent and location was perfect

Reviews.Title: “Frequent traveller loves this hotel”
Reviews.Author: DonGoesDigital
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 3 times and love it. The staff is helpful and friendly. The location is great. Parking is $38 per day (more than a Texan like me would prefer, but this is Boston, after all), but is part of the hotel and conveinent. The restaurant is very good. Internet at $14 per day is too high.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotet & location - although not for the full price!”
Reviews.Author: nlay
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Colonnade for 3 nights at the end of March. We managed to get a really good deal online, paying only Â£65 a night, and the hotel was great for that price. Positives: The location was great for exploring the city. The prudential T stop is literally right outside the hotel entrance and it's a 5 minute walk to Newbury street. We didn't eat in the restaurant but ordered some breakfast room service which was delicious and the coffee machine in the room was a real plus for us. Negatives: The rooms are a little on the small side, as are the bathrooms. WiFi was only free in the hotel lobby. The rooms weren't particularly sound proof - not great if you wanting a lie in! We were also disappointed that having requested a king room when making our booking that they were unable to fulfil this request. Overall, for the price we paid I would definately recommend staying at the Colonnade although I do stuggle to see how they justify the $249 per night price they recommend on their website.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Stay. Great location, great staff, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dave0625
Reviews.Content: Rooms were quiet and comfortable, service was outstanding, location was great and the food terrific.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel perfect boston location”
Reviews.Author: Mizzreb
Reviews.Content: had a wonderful weekend at the Collanade Hotel in Boston. It's located right across from the Prudential Ctr and Copley Sq. The staff was friendly, very clean room and hallways. The restaurant is french themed, sorry I didnt have the chocolate mousse, it looked delish. Only comment would be that the bar did not serve any munches with our drink orders, I thought it rather stingy. Should be some nuts or crackers or something.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in a great Boston hotel”
Reviews.Author: rodman954
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Colonnade was an absolute joy. The building looks fresh and well-maintained and the staff was professional and kind. Large, well decorated rooms. Service was quick and reliable and the price was right. Management even left a personalized happy birthday note for my partner and sent wine and chocolate covered strawberries to the room. Room service was prompt and the food was fresh and hot. The location is close to everything, and the subway stop is right outside the door. Prudential Center mall is right across the street with easy walking access to Boylston and Newbury Streets.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in downtown Boston”
Reviews.Author: TSTraveler1340
Reviews.Content: I recently tagged along with my wife on her business trip, and we were lucky enough to stay at the Colonnade Hotel. The location was perfect for my day excursions while she was down at the Convention Center, with the green line right outside the front door, which couldn't be more convenient. Not only that but on the one day it was rain/snowing, there is a huge shopping center with tons of restaurants and shops to kill some time or drop some money. The check in was pretty quick and painless, and the rooms were a very decent size, looks to be recently renovated, and very clean. The staff was accommodating and friendly. The star of the staff, has to be Norman at the bell stand; courteous, friendly and extremely helpful. We didnâ€™t get the chance to have dinner at the hotelâ€™s restaurant but on one of the days my wife was at her conference, I ventured down for a solo lunch. If you go you have to try the French Onion Soup. UNBELEIVABLE! Maybe the best I have ever had. Next time we stay in Boston, I would definitely stay again at the Colonnade Hotel. Great staff, location, food, and comfortable and clean rooms. Keep up the good work, Colonnade !!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: Gordonashworth
Reviews.Content: As a virgin Atlantic cabin crew member, I'm lucky in that i stay in some of the best hotels in the world. The job can be tough but this one of the perks!! We fly to over 45 international cities around the world, but I have to say that one of my absolute favourite stays is at the colonnade, Boston. This is one seriously classy hotel. The staff are exceptional, the rooms and beds are exquisite, and it's a great location. I only wish all our hotels were as good as this. This hotel ranks alongside the ritz Carlton montego bay, the ritz London, the cullinan, cape town, and Caesars palace, las vegas. It's just superb. By the way, I am not on commission for writing this review!! I just love this hotel. X

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Daylove
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel more than few times and I like the service offered + the location is great. However, the rooms are small and traffic noise is a bit of a disturbance especially in early morning hours.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite five star, but good value and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: DC_Untied
Reviews.Content: Stayed here March 11-13 in a Parlor Double Double room. We had an excellent stay and I would absolutely come back. Our room was very nicely adorned, I liked the stylings -- not uber modern but also not cookie-cutter hotel. Everyone was friendly enough, the location was great (right on top of the green line and plenty of food, groceries, etc. within a very short walk). I knocked them down a couple points on service for one reason: the gentleman who booked my room over the phone for me misrepresented the room slightly. I was told it would have two full baths, two double beds, and a sleeper sofa. In reality it had 1.5 baths, two double beds, and a normal sofa. The value was still good at around $350/night, but not as good as it was made out to sound on the phone. Also, the Internet access was an extra $14/day. That's not a big deal though, and you'll get that a lot of places, but really, in this day and age you shouldn't. (Much more basic hotels, like Hampton Inn, give free Internet access to all guests, Colonnade needs to make this a revenue generator? Really?) All that said, I don't want to make this sound like a negative review. Everyone was perfectly friendly, the beds were quality, the suite was extremely spacious, the doorman was willing and able to get a cab for us nearly instantly any time of the day. We'll be coming back to Boston for PAX East 2012 next year, and I expect the Colonnade to top our list of potential accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “There are no words for such a breif review - just a great place to unwind away from the problems of the day + life.”
Reviews.Author: Contentraveler4
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many hotels in Boston over the past few decades and this was by far is my best experience to date. I'm returning next week...need I say more?

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: TaraChatt
Reviews.Content: Everything was clean, the staff was wonderful and the room was beautiful. Nothing went wrong whatsoever. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “The most amazing hotel experience I have ever had”
Reviews.Author: vttym
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel for the Pax East 2011 convention, and despite the influx of people, we felt like we were the only guests the hotel had, the way they treated us. They were able to have a room ready for us for early check-in (we drove overnight, and came in at 8:00am), provided a fantastic gift basket of assorted crackers and cheese, gave personalized directions to areas of interest. The room itself was incredible, comfy, and well stocked. Our room overlooked the Prudential center area, and it was perfect for our young daughter, who loved watching the cars go by. I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. Even before arriving, their presence on Twitter was great, and they answered some questions right on the spot. The location is close to everything, and has bus and subway stops right outside the door. Room service was prompt, and the food was warm. The kids menu portions are ample, so if you see something there you like, it would suffice for a normal meal. If there's any downside, it's parking at almost $40 a day, but considering that's an issue everywhere, it was acceptable. Do not miss a chance to stay here if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms...but”
Reviews.Author: Valesch
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is not bad: the rooms are actually very ncie, quite big and comfortable but the service was not adequate at all: awe satyed 4 nights and had to change our room after the first night as we santed aking size bed and not 2 queen. Eah time we went to the reception for some information the girl wouldn't recognize us. The concierge wasn't helpful at all when we asked some adivse for restaurants. And parking sapce for one night was SOOOO EXPENSIVE. I mean the room is nice (only air conditionig was too loud), but don't expect too much from concierge and reception. and WIFI only at the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in a great town”
Reviews.Author: ruralphil
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for a college audition. The location was within walking distance, so no taxi fares. Received great advice from the concierge for leisure and dining ideas. Restaurant recommendation to Sola's was ideal. First time to Boston, but won't hesitate to stay here again if we return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the heart of Boston”
Reviews.Author: Bosseler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in downtown Boston, so all the POIS are accessible easy and fast. The rooms are very spacious, even work is possible due to the large desk and comfortable chairs. The beds are perfectly padded, like the bathroom and other modern equipment make the price of 200 dollars per night for a 2 bed room. We were able to check out later, so if demanded the hotel staff grants staying until 2 p.m.

Reviews.Title: “Lacking in the basics.”
Reviews.Author: JH685
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week long business trip to Boston. I chose the Colonnade Hotel due to its proximity to the Prudential Center. I was very surprised that they did not offer valet parking, the front door was a hub of activity and it was a bit confusing to figure out where to park at first. There is a garage attached to the hotel thankfully. I used the business center as I needed to print some last minute documents, and was shocked to find there is a per minute/per page charge for using the business center. I was also shocked to find at checkout that they also charge for internet access. The hotel is average in most other respects. I ended up checking out three days early and found another hotel in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure what all the fuss is about?”
Reviews.Author: Emptynester20102011
Reviews.Content: I booked two connecting rooms at this hotel based on all the positive reviews here. I will start with what I did like: Self parking Beds were comfortable Location of hotel Door man (the one with the accent) was the best employee at the hotel When we entered our rooms we noticed that one of the AC/heating units was running despite being turned off. The front desk sent up their Engineer to look at it and he immediately announced that it was normal and there was nothing he could do about it. I took him into our connecting room and showed him how that unit was quiet and that it made no sense why he couldn't shut the other one up. Only then, did he actually take it apart and fix it. Took him about 15 minutes. During this time, I examined the rest of the room. The bathroom floor was covered in hair, along with the tub. The glasses had finger prints on them and the coffee mugs were covered in dust. The sheets on one of the beds had multiple tiny holes in it. Two of the bedside reading lamps were not working and one of the alarm clocks was busted. These are not things you would expect of a hotel of this caliber. Also, the first morning I left all the towels from both rooms in one pile, thinking I was being helpful. Apparently, housekeeping didn't like that and only left one towel and wash cloth for my husband and myself. Having wasted over an hour on the Engineer to fix the ac unit we did not pursue having these other items fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Very up-to-date hotel with great amenities and location.”
Reviews.Author: MarionG79
Reviews.Content: Traveling with 2 teens looking at local colleges while staying at the Collonade. We all had a great time and loved the room we were in. It was very modern with large LCD TVs and a DVD player, even an eTV keyboard! The kids loved it! Very modern-looking bathroom, and the room was arranged nicely. The beds were comfortable with nice down comforters. Parking took awhile to adjust to their process, but we didn't have any trouble with it. We had some trouble with the DVD player and someone responded to our call within 15 minutes. The water pressure in the shower was great and the temperature stayed consistent. The "T" was located right outside of the hotel, and trolley tour packages could be arranged right there, also. The location was very good, as we could walk to several locations, there was a beautiful mall right across the street with good restaurants or snack locations. I was with 2 artistic teens and they just loved it and the ceiling to floor windows. We also ate breakfast at their restaurant, and though a little pricey, was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: sachuest48
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights on business. It was my first experience although I live 75 miles from Bosotn and have been a frequent visitor over the years, I didn't know about this hotel. The parking garage is part of the building and on a cold stormy winter day the attendants couldn't have been more friendly. I got right into my room that morning and was able to go right down to my conference on the first floor. The rooms are updated and modern. the hotel os directly across from the Prudential Center and the T stops were right outside and across the street. The food at the conference was excellent as was a dinner attended in the restaurant. the staff are friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “ultra comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: helioal
Reviews.Content: One of the best sleeps of my life. Bed and pillows were super comfortable. Staff went above and beyond to help you out, from valet to front desk. The rooms are georgeous and very modern and the location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Back Bay, perfect practical place to stay”
Reviews.Author: 154913Elizabeth
Reviews.Content: Excellent value. For the price, quality and service exceeded my expectation. Rooms somewhat small but clean and above average linens, etc. Friendly and quiet. So close to shopping and conservatories. I would definitely stay there again but if travelling with my husband, would choose a small suite just to have the extra room. Would not hesitate to recommend it for superior quality at a value price.

Reviews.Title: “The finest and highest quality hotel experience for a romantic Valentine's experience”
Reviews.Author: pwennik
Reviews.Content: A special occasion requires the utmost care in chosing the very best --in this case--for Valentine's--only The Colonnade would fit our bill. Despite being familiar with all the Boston hotels, we came back to The Colonnade because of the marvelous previous experiences we've had there--and last week's stay was just terrific. The room was immaculate--(I'd like to own a bed at home as comfortable as their's!) and the sound system in the room was great. We had a romantic dinner in our room--room service delivered within 25 minutes and everything was piping hot--a wonderful sirloin with fine veggies, etc and a lovely wine. Brunch next day in hotel restaurant was perfect--Great burger, fries, mushroom soup(yummy!) and nice light imported beers. We hated to leave, but--back to work--and waiting for next trip on thanksgiving, Everyone who works at The Colonnade seems to love their jobs--it's just great as they treat you with genuine interest and care. Keep up the great work--guaranteed that we'll be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Boston”
Reviews.Author: nhcarol
Reviews.Content: We returned to our old neighborhood to have a nice weekend in Boston. The hotel was clean, well-appointend, and very comfortable. The service was also helpful and friendly. We ate in the restaurant Friday night and for breakfast Saturday and Sunday mornings. The food was all great and the service outstanding. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I have ever been to”
Reviews.Author: Varsh29
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 weeks and the experience for my whole stay was excellent. Hotel staffs are so kind and helpful all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Hands down, best hotel experience I've ever had.”
Reviews.Author: wanderlust430
Reviews.Content: Went for a romantic getaway, but wanted to be in the heart of the Back Bay. Our room was spacious with the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in. The consistent drone of the city bustle was the perfect white noise for sleeping. Hotel staff was extremely pleasant, room service was great, and our view of the city was spectacular. The GM sent a personal thank you letter for staying there with a bottle of wine and a fruit/cheese plate. Hotel is located right across from the Prudential shopping center and two blocks from Newbury St. The ONLY complaint I have is that there is no valet parking and it's $38 a day in the garage. Garage is conveniently attached to the hotel and was easy to get in and out of, but parking in Boston is pricey. We will stay at the Colonnade each time we return to Boston, no doubt.

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay anywhere else in Boston again!”
Reviews.Author: brighid86
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Colonnade on a Friday and were more than pleasantly surprised with not only the feel of the hotel but the room was incredible. We had a beautiful view of the city through a wall of windows. The bed was extremely comfortable and everything was very clean. We were given amenities from the General Manager which were beyond appreciated. We did not want to leave! Thank you very much to the Colonnade for an amazing experience - we can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “best back bay hotel”
Reviews.Author: bonedr33
Reviews.Content: awesome location across the street from prudential center mall entrance. clean very cool rooms especially 10-11 floor very modern. i'm a chiropractor and I recommend these beds for any patient with a back ache. this was my 2nd stay in 1 month. both times very quiet rooms. Kathy at the front desk was very very accomodating, definitely ask for her. check on web site for specials dynanmite place

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel with amazing service”
Reviews.Author: Ariel310
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this quaint, yet modern, hotel. My room had a gorgeous view of the neighboring brownstones and it is located within walking distance of the mall and subway stations. Very convenient to everything not to mention the most amazing service I have ever experienced. The staff made me feel like royalty. My only complaint- and this would have been a problem if the hotel were packed with guests- is that the walls are very thin. I could hear people talking when they walked down the hallway, even if they weren't speaking loudly. Luckily, there didn't seem to be anyone staying in the rooms next to mine...

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel with very friendly and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: cjctf
Reviews.Content: Seven of us girls had a "girls weekend" in Boston. The hotel is very nice and in the perfect location, Back Bay of Boston. It is easy to get to the T, the mall, Newbury Street, and so forth. The hotel restaurant, Brasserie Joe, is excellent. The rooms did get a bit hot at night, maybe the thermostats need some adjustment. We had to open a window during January! But this certainly did not ruin our weekend in any way. I would highly recommend this hotel for it's quality, location, and friendly staff. Room service even brought us a spoon very late at night to our room for some ice cream we had bought! If you can get a deal on a room that includes parking it's very helpful. Overnight parking is expensive in Boston. But if you can get it included, you can park your car in the garage, and get anywhere by way of the T. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel. Close to Everything”
Reviews.Author: Dessy67
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. Very clean. Close to everything. Walk to Copley. Great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Suprisingly pleasant”
Reviews.Author: V_Damo
Reviews.Content: Positives: The staff are extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms are large, comfortable and very modern. It's in a convenient location. Negatives:- No free internet access and if you have an adjoining room you can hear every sneeze next door.

Reviews.Title: “We absolutely LOVED The Colonnade!”
Reviews.Author: addygirl
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect! The T stop right outside the front door is so handy. Even without that feature we loved the Colonnade. Spacious rooms, amazing staff, delicious food, fun bar! Next time we go to Boston, I know exactly where we'll be staying...The Colonnade!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with only one complaint”
Reviews.Author: BrownBalto
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Colonnade when we were dropping our daughter off at Northeastern University. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms are large, clean, and inviting. The beds are very comfortable. We overlooked Huntington Ave. and the view was nice. My only complaint was that we could hear what was going on in the next room, as well as loud noises on the street, and we were on the 8th floor. Otherwise, it was a great location and a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at a great location in Boston”
Reviews.Author: DuxburyMarie
Reviews.Content: Celebrating our wedding anniversary. Great location with subway outside the door. Snowing and we could walk to Prudential Center and Copley Square area without going outside. Room very spacious and well appointed.

Reviews.Title: “A great find and a good value.”
Reviews.Author: billgorm
Reviews.Content: I always get nervous when I think I am getting to good of a deal especially on hotels and I felt that was the case with the Colonnade in Boston. However, when we arrived I immediately had the sense we had nothing to worry about. First it appears that the hotel recently completed a renovation. Rooms are of average size but in great condition. Be sure to sign up as a preferred member and then the wireless internet is free. Also, be sure to ask about different packages. We had two rooms (my wife and I and four kids) and were able to get a free breakfast, which was excellent, at Brasserie Jo each morning. The kids loved going to the rooftop pool and my wife and I could sit and enjoy a drink. The hotel is located at a "T" stop which was great for getting around and we were able to walk to Fenway Park and Northeastern University. The only negative was that the front desk seemed a little confused at times especially when figure out what my package included. It took several trips to straighten everything out. But overall a great find and I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Best night sleep ever...”
Reviews.Author: raceytay82
Reviews.Content: I have no idea where the Colonnade purchased their bed and linens, but they were amazing. The bed was so soft and all of the linens were so comfortable! The room is a little noisy as there isn't much soundproofing, but I just turned up the tv a bit. Overall, I love the hotel, the decor and think the staff is amazing! Also, definitely get the French Onion Soup in Brasserie Jo and their cocktails are potent and amazing!

Reviews.Title: “great ambiance with professional staff in one of boston's best shopping locations”
Reviews.Author: storminnorm_10
Reviews.Content: stay there, walk the inside corridors for blocks with good choice of restr. and stores.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and facility. Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Vermonter41
Reviews.Content: In addition to a wonderful package which included breakfast and parking the facilities were clean and well maintained. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Looking forward to our return. This hotel stood out because of their wonderful staff. Brandon at the front desk was especially helpful.

Reviews.Title: “This is my 'go-to' hotel in Boston. I always enjoy staying here.”
Reviews.Author: JFristensky
Reviews.Content: Ideally located for me: you barely go outside to hop on the 'T' to Northeastern University, MFA, Symphony Hall. Prudential Center across the street. My real regret is that I usually only stay one night moving my daughter into/out of housing. The staff has always been welcoming and friendly. Either the rooms are very well insulated, or they only allow quiet guests - I never hear hall noise!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Patsuk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in December as we were travelling down to Gillette stadium from Boston via train for the Patriots game. Firtsly location is excellent, we caught the subway from the airport, changed at gvment centre and got off at prudential, came up the escalator and the hotel lobby was literally right there in front of us, easy to get to and convenient and only $2 from the airport. The service was excellent right from check in to check out, we asked for more coffee for the room and it was sent up immediately, room was spotless and welcoming. Only 3 slight negatives, one has been mentioned on here before, the walls are very thin, we had to call reception on the first night as there seemed to be a party going on next door to us at 3am which woke us up, to be fair reception dealt with it and from then on it was fine. The 2nd slight negative, and this is only for people with children, is to warn about the windows. We were on the 5 th floor and the windows fully opened, pretty scary for those with children. The biggest negative for me was the lack of free Wi-Fi in the rooms, there is free wi fi in the lobby but you have to pay for internet access in the rooms, pretty poor considering most hotels offer this as standard now. Other than that an excellent stay, close to back bay train station for anyone catching the train to the pats game and somewhere we would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Super comfy beds at an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Kazlet
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for a shopping trip or visiting the MFA or Symphony Hall. Beds are the most comfy hotel beds I have ever slept in. Staff are helpful and Brasserie Jo does a great American Breakfast. The only drawbacks are a shower system that takes a while to figure out and having interconnecting rooms. Not all rooms have a connecting door but the problem is at 1am I could hear every word of the phone conversation of the woman next door. The front desk say there are rooms that don't connect so I'd advise to get one if you are a lighter sleeper. Having said that I would stay there again as everything else was very good.

Reviews.Title: “nice change from franchise hotels.”
Reviews.Author: MountainRun
Reviews.Content: My room was very comfortable. Nice HD TV. The restaurant "Jo Brassiere was terrific. The location, in the Back Bay, is close to shopping and night life.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, every need anticipated, way under-rated”
Reviews.Author: Mario_Masala
Reviews.Content: Can't beat this place for value, location, food, friendly efficient service, cleanliness, room design, amenites, convenience, parking, only regret is lack of indoor pool (but they have a rooftop pool in the warm weather that is incredible). Stay here and enjoy Boston in a wonderfully unexpected way.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.great staff,clean!!!”
Reviews.Author: t0309999
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel. the rooms are not that big bug enough. Really clean rooms and fresh.staff is great. the bathroom is nice and big. internet is a bit expensive but doable. the only negative was that i could hear the people next door too clearly.only a door separated the rooms.otherwise great location,across from Prudential mall.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - but lock away your purchases”
Reviews.Author: Holidayfan007_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, nice location across from the prudential center and we had no issues until we were leaving and my friend discovered she was missing a bottle of perfume which had been stored in her luggage. We informed the front desk who informed housekeeping. Upon returning home i also found I was missing a make-up set which had also been stored in our bags and not moved so the items could not have been lost after leaving the hotel. I am very disappointed that I would have to lock away purchases and since so many people travel to Boston to shop I would not recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “best small hotel in boston!”
Reviews.Author: peach30
Reviews.Content: the colonnade is ideally situated for fine dining, wonderful shopping, fabulous cultural venues (boston symphony, wilbur theatre, art museums), walking tours - you name it! the staff is exceptionally professional in every way - you are made welcome the moment you arrive and walk through the glass doors in to the handsomely appointed lobby. the wonderful french restaurant, 'brassiere jo's', is on the first floor of the hotel and is a must-do! the dining experience transports you to a fine parisian bistro, right in the heart of boston's colonnade hotel - your perfect choice for lodging!

Reviews.Title: “First class from the moment I was greeted outside the front door!”
Reviews.Author: artgrrl
Reviews.Content: The first class service in this hotel was evident even before I got out of the taxi - someone came to immediately greet me and make me feel welcome after a long trip. All the staff I spoke with were ready to accommodate any special requests. I've stayed here before - convenient to culture, museums, shops. Highly Recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: arshimbo
Reviews.Content: I don't know if I've ever had a more pleasant stay in Boston. I used to live there and would enjoy the Colonnade for its restaurants and its pool. Now, I love to go back and enjoy its AMAZING beds. I had not had a more restful night's sleep in at least a year. AMAZING!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK in the Back Bay”
Reviews.Author: ExpeditionDaddy
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at most of the hotels in Boston's back bay for business: the Westin (a total dump), the Marriott (poor quality), Copley Square Hotel (OK), Fairmont Copley Plaza (faded glory) and the CharlesMark (nice but very small rooms). This place, like its neighbors, is just OK. The rooms are clean and perfectly acceptable for a business trip, though nothing special. The service was a complete mixed bag from friendly to gruff, prompt to totally unreliable (i.e. I asked room service to read my order back to me when I was sure they had it wrong, they read it back correctly and still got the order wrong and 45 min. later). The heat in my room was malfunctioning and so I had to keep the window open otherwise it would have been 80 degrees in the room. If you have business in the area this is probably about as nice an option as you'll get, definitely much better than the Marriott or the Westin but nothing to write home about. If you're looking for something special near here, try the Taj, the Liberty or especially XV Beacon.

Reviews.Title: “Had a fabulous visit to Boston!”
Reviews.Author: kathymix
Reviews.Content: The Colonnade Hotel is beautiful, in a great location, and has a fabulous restaurant. The rooms are luxuriously appointed, immaculate & very comfortable. The staff is very committed to the comfort of their guests, and are all very friendly & accommodating. I will definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Best customer service I've seen in a long time!”
Reviews.Author: anne111310
Reviews.Content: My daughter's wedding was held here...everything exceeded our expectations, the service, the food...so glad we chose The Colonnade!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Disneyfan95
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel during my sons college orientation. We received a great rate through the University and got upgraded to a suite for a very reasonable price. The suite had a bedroom with King bed, living room with queen pullout, and two full baths. It was very comfortable, clean and convenient. Lots of luxury amenities like a Kurig coffee maker in the room. The location was great, right across the street from The Cheesecake factory and P.F. Changs. The staff was pleasant and very accomodating. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for first trip to Boston ! Would recommend!!”
Reviews.Author: Specialklk
Reviews.Content: Did alot of research on hotels around Boston and after being here 5 days I would choose this hotel again . T is right out front of hotel and Old Townes Trolley picks you up at this location ... Beds are amazing !

Reviews.Title: “Well located quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: brynjolfurs
Reviews.Content: The Colonnade Hotel in Boston is a fine hotel and ideally located for a weekend getaway in Boston. The room we had was modern, comfortable, clean, large and well equipped, the beds are very good and overall the hotel seemed in top condition. It's location right across the Prudential Centre and close to shops and restaurants at Newbury and Boylston is ideal and the T is just outside the hotel. The staff was nice and helpful regarding recommendations and any needs during our stay. The only negative was poor sound issues regardind adjacent rooms and guests being able to hear eveything happening next door. In summary, we were very happy with our stay and would recommend the Colonnade (and Boston) to anyone looking for a place to go for a holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Grat Place For Family”
Reviews.Author: Benjy56
Reviews.Content: With its rooftop pool and unbelievable (food) restauant plus nice, very helpful, and friendly staff, this is a great hotel in a great location in Boston. With kids, you need two connecting rooms, however, but they have great deals for these. The staff really goes out of its way to help in all situations- I had a car problem and they handled the whole thing for me while the family enjoyed the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for meetings at Hynes--well appointed, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: smokeykgrd
Reviews.Content: Pricey, but similar to other hotels in the neighborhood--great location and excellent and accommodating staff from front door to front desk to housekeeping. They were even very friendly and informative when I telephoned ahead several times. Very comfortable beds, very clean and well appointed rooms. Free internet if you join "I Prefer" Fast elevators. I was there for a meeting at Hynes Convention Center and it is a very short walk. Also, Shaw's grocery is less than a block away. The hotel's room service food was very good, too.

Reviews.Title: “Crappy beds, heater/cooler too loud to sleep with wake up in sauna”
Reviews.Author: aro3600
Reviews.Content: The noise of the heater/cooler is rediculous. No way you can leave it on during sleeping. I was on the top floor so the heat rising from lower floors was excessive and I constantly woke up covered in sweat - ended up leaving windows open to 'enjoy' the loud noise of the airplanes that take off and fly straight passed every few minutes from 6 am. THe bed is terribly uncomfortable - the pillows a joke (make sure you ask for foam pillows in checkin). After 2 terrible nights (of 6 planned) I had to move to another hotel. Bad bed, can't use heater/cooler and aircraft noise from 6am = stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Customer Service + Wonderful Location = A Wonderful Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: KarlaWilliston_VT
Reviews.Content: We are returning customers and received the service and quality care we come to expect at the Colonnade. This time, especially, the check-in desk was very helpful and everyone did all they could to make our stay relaxing and fun. We loved being able to hop over to the Prudential Center for shopping and then come back and relax in the comfortable rooms. It was a great weekend visit and I hope there are more in our future. We'll stay at the Colonnade again the next time we come to Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Top Marks from this moving-Mark”
Reviews.Author: AmericaOverEasy
Reviews.Content: I spend a great deal of my time at 35,000 feet or in hotel rooms world-wide...and I can spot a winner on most occasions, before I even leave the curb-side to check-in. This hotel set the stage for a wonderful stay, right from the start for me, and it kept pace with my expectations throughout my stay. I love real pillows, and real people, and I think the owners of this property spend a good bit of time and talent paying attention to both the brick and blankets as well as finding the best help. I had a fistfull of meetings, tight schedules and 'must do' activities while I was in this city...made possible in large part by helping hands at the hotel... The people for me, make any place & this hotel quietly boasts some of the best in Beantown. Please, Don't take my word for it, sample the sheets for yourself... Mark Sheehan, author of "The Scent of a Dollar" by New Holland Books * This property will make my list of top-tens for the next time-around.

Reviews.Title: “What you'd expect for the location, except that the soundproofing is subpar.”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaRes
Reviews.Content: The Colonnade Hotel in Boston is a fine hotel. The room that I had was decorated in a contemporary style, the bathroom was small but well designed, as is the fitness center. The staff at check-in was great, and just about everything went very smoothly. The only negative that I experienced was being able to hear loud and clear a phone conversation taking place in the room next door. There is a door between the rooms, so that they can be connected if guests book both rooms. The problem is that it is not a double set of doors, and it appears that no effort was made to introduce any type of sound proofing. Whatever is happening in one room (conversation, TV, romantic encounters, ...) is heard loud and clear in the adjoining room. Did not turn out to be a big issue during my stay, but I could see where it could be a huge problem. Summary, a quality hotel, except for potentially bad sound issues when adjacent rooms share a door.

Reviews.Title: “WEDDING”
Reviews.Author: kslucht
Reviews.Content: Our daughter was recently married in Boston and had her reception at the Colonnade Hotel. Her bridal party and many of the quests stayed there~~including us. I can not say enough good things about the hotel, food, and staff. Everyone was so friendly and went out of their way to make us feel welcome. It is located in a very convenient part of town making it easy to get around. The rooms were very clean, quite, and comfortable. Next time we are in Boston we will diffidently be staying at the Colonnade Hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Boston by far!!”
Reviews.Author: gecko6788
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to come to Boston to escape our hectic work schedules and busy lives. We chose the Colonnade because friends suggested it to us, saying," It was a beautiful hotel that went the extra mile. I am glad that we listened! Upon checking in an adorable front desk man (Brandon) was entertaining and "taking the floor" as it were, so we immediately felt welcomed and happy. He did check us in and was so pleasant and courteous! He gave us great recommendations at Lucca. The concierge gave us great recommendations on what to do in the city(which were great by the way) Everything in the room was perfect and comfortable. We felt right at home and didn't want to leave. The beds were to die for, and I could have spent our entire stay sleeping in them(ha ha). The location is so convenient, the city view was spectacular at night time. We had a small problem with our TV and when we called to the desk it seemed like as soon as we hung up the phone the mechanic was right there to fix it. What a great hotel, we will return!! Thank you for a great getaway

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great staff”
Reviews.Author: AnnaKellan
Reviews.Content: 1st time in Boston, great hotel for exploring. Staff were very friendly and helptful. Cannot fault hotel. Great clean, well equipped rooms. Great location for shops!! exploring the city - T station just outside hotel door. Brasserie Jo - food wonderful, couldn't find a better breakfast. Can't wait to back to Boston and it will have to be this hotel. Hello from Argyll, Scotland

Reviews.Title: “Great base for exploring the city with kids!”
Reviews.Author: TravelMom9999
Reviews.Content: The big attraction here is the rooftop pool. That was a novelty for our kids and they loved swimming up there after dark with the underwater pool lights on. Also a lovely place to start the day with breakfast and an early swim. The T stop is right in front and we were able to go everywhere we wanted to go by T. We also could walk to Fenway and to all kinds of restaurants and shops. The Shaw's was across the street for picking up snacks and light meals, plus rental DVD's for after dinner on early nights in. They had a fitness center for Mom and Dad and the Charles River running paths were right nearby. All in all, a convenient location and the pool sealed the deal. We were able to get a good deal on our overnight rate and felt this was a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel with excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: Maggie C
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at the Colonnade in mid-September. The room was very comfortable and the service was really good. In addition the hotel restaurant, Brasserie Jo, was excellent both for breakfast and lunch. Breakfast prices were better here than in other Boston hotels we tried. The location is Back Bay Boston near Copley Square and it is right on one of the T lines so getting around is easy. We walked around looking at the Christian Science Mother Church--see the Maparium there- and the Boston Public Library (John Singer Sargent murals as well as lovely architecture) but the best place we walked to was Fenway Park, about 20 minutes away. Surprisingly reasonably priced. We got a deal at the Colonnade which seemed not to be available in October when we passed back through Boston. We paid a little more than $200 per night in September and the price in October was more than $400 per night. So you can see it was a good deal and a good place for the price. At that price, in pricy Boston, I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “So many options in Boston, great value - great location!”
Reviews.Author: Phoenixtraveler67
Reviews.Content: After hours of searching the internet and looking at dozens of properties, I choose this hotel for my husband and I to be able to "play tourist" in Boston and would definitely stay here again. Hotel is literally right above a T stop, across the street from shopping & restaurants at the Prudential Center and a short, nice 5 minute walk to Newbury Street and Copley Square.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, watch bathroom door!”
Reviews.Author: Bigsister1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a recent business trip for which the reservations were made for the group. We arrived very early and were given our room well ahead of the check-in hour. This was so convenient because we were heading to the Sox game. Service is outstanding. We needed a small fridge for medicines and it was brought very quickly. The room was very small and dimly lit even though there were several lamps. The bedside reading lamps were very strong so I shined both of them out into the room which helped. . Only one of us could move around at a time. There was no desk which was unfortunate because I had work to do. There was a round table with 1 chair and 1 hassock that flopped around when you moved...dangerous. The internet connection was fine and there were plenty of plugs...often a problem but not here. There was a power strip..very helpful. The bathroom was also very small. I appreciated the pocket door on the bathroom because it did not swing out into the small room...until I got locked inside the bathroom! The door latch jammed. Fortunately, there is a phone in the bathroom so I was able to call and someone came immediately. I could tell from the condition of the door frame that this had happened before. There were dents and scratch marks from the last captive. If there had been no phone, I would have beenthere till housekeeping arrived and have missed my meeting. But all was well. Clean, clean clean. Nice towels, shampoos, bathrobes. Wonderful service. Nexttime I will ask for a bigger room and never close the bathroom door all the way.

Reviews.Title: “A Birthday to Remember”
Reviews.Author: maxinelk
Reviews.Content: I have never in my life counted down the hours until I can return to my hotel room, and yet: I am staring at the clock, willing time to go faster so that I can leave work and get back to my suite at the Colonnade. Let me preface this by saying: I live in Boston, and chose the Colonnade for a two-night midweek stay to celebrate my birthday (today). When making my reservation, I informed the hotel in passing that my stay was a special occasion. Upon checking into what was supposed to be a standard King room, I found I had been given a complimentary upgrade to what is, hands down, the nicest and most spacious suite I have ever stayed in. The decor is understated and modern, with touches of warmth throughout. The bathroom is large enough to get lost in. The bed is impossibly large and comfortable. Did I mention the two enormous flat-screen TVs? The floor-to-ceiling city views? I have traveled extensively and stayed everywhere from the Ritz to a Motel 6-- and thus far, the Colonnade has been the most grand, considerate, creative and lovely hotel I've ever had the pleasure of staying in. Within minutes of my settling down into one of the gorgeous, plush sofas in my suite's living room, the doorbell rang: behind it was a room service waiter with a complimentary cheese&fruit plate and a kind note from the General Manager, wishing me well on my special day. This is a small hotel that treats every one of its travelers (even those on a poor student's budget, such as myself) as though they are royalty. I want to extend my thanks to the entire staff for making my birthday the best in memory. I will return and tell everyone I know to do the same.

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond Service Excellence”
Reviews.Author: BostonBiz
Reviews.Content: Although I live within commuting distance of Boston, I stayed at The Colonnade Hotel recently to organize a conference. The Colonnade Hotel was the host hotel for out-of-town guests, and we could not have been more pleased with our experience, As the conference organizer, I had a couple of logistics requests. The hotel staff was completely accommodating and seem empowered at every level to fulfill client requests without delaying the process by having to ask permission of managers; being of assistance to the customer is a mission they take seriously. Our out-of-town guests were delighted with the quality of the accommodations, the food at Brasserie Jo, and the over-all welcoming feel of the hotel. The conference theme included the effect of social media on many aspects of business and society, and The Colonnade Hotel has made a concerted effort to be Boston's premier "social media" hotel. You can find them on Twitter @Colonnade, and you will be more than pleased if you choose to stay at The Colonnade Hotel during your next visit to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: peetr
Reviews.Content: It's tough to find downtown/Back Bay hotels which live up to their price-range promises. The Colonnade delivers. They deliver on all fronts, but what impressed us most was the staff: friendly, conscientious, and professional. We now know what our Boston hotel is; no reason to go anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca8754
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, in a great central location for many things. Loved the rooms, they were very clean and comfortable. The staff was great, especially Jimmie the doorman. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to the area. The rubber ducky was such a cute touch!

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend experience. During the...”
Reviews.Author: ilantlv
Reviews.Content: Great weekend experience. During the weekend the prices are competetive and it gives great value to the price. The hotel is well designed, room was spacious and pleasant. Location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “such a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: bec_crew
Reviews.Content: i have stayed at this hotel in the past and always love going back !! i travel quite a bit and this is my favorite hotel to stay at when i am traveling for work !! this is our 9th year at the Colonnade

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: lshouse
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel for a conference across the street. Subway entrance right by hotel, worked great for rainy days, we could just walk through the tunnel below ground to conference center instead of in rain. Hotel was convienent, comfortable, clean, worth the price, and the perfect size (not to large). The concierge was incredibly helpful with our sightseeing questions and gave great local restaurant suggestions! Best Italian ever just two blocks or so behind the hotel! Gave us free wifi when we signed up for hotel membership card.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Fabulous Bed”
Reviews.Author: Itsme710
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was great the staff was helpful and friendly.. the rooms were quiet and the bed was to dies for.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Great rooms, lovely place, staff keen to help”
Reviews.Author: JJtraveller54
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely 4 days (even though 2 of them involved non-stop drizzle) staying in this hotel. All aspects of the hotel were excellent with just the one exception; wi-fi was only free down in the lobby area, which just meant a little trip down the lift with the laptop. The room was quite large and certainly big enough for 2 adults. Everything was clean and tidy and we found the staff always pleasant and keen to answer any queeries.The hotel has an excellent French style restaurant which was well used by the locals as well as guests. At the time of writing prices were expensive compared to the UK but not too bad when you consider that you are in one of the USA's main cities. The roof top pool is small and busy but well managed. One big piece of advice when visting Boston for the first time; Get the 4 day tour bus pass which has a hop-on, hop-off policy.
