It is an excellent way to get round the city and stops outside the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Back Bay Boston”
Reviews.Author: hotelconsultant60745
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Colonnade Hotel with my 2 children on a Saturday night for a quick weekend away from home. The service was exceptional, the room was very comfortable, the food in the restaurant was delicious, and the location is fantastic if you want to see the Back Bay sights. Our favorite part about the room was the comfortable beds and the awesome water pressure in the shower. The room was immaculate. I liked that fact that for breakfast, they offer reasonably priced menu items for children, and they made us something that wasn't on the menu. The front desk couldn't have been nicer when we checked in. I recommend this hotel to business travelers and people on leisure travel.

Reviews.Title: “Probably more suited to business travellers”
Reviews.Author: T3TDL
Reviews.Content: Whilst this hotel was perfectly functional it lacked any personal touch or atmosphere and was frequented by a large number of airline staff. We thought the receptionist was abrupt and unfriendly, but very businesslike and this was our view of this hotel overall. Having just spent a lovely few days at the fabulous Hotel Elysee we were very disappointed at the contrast at 2 equally star rated hotels. We had no need to tip the Concierge as they never offered to help us with anything! We didn't eat in the hotel so cannot comment on the restaurant but we did use the rooftop pool one afternoon, on the other occasions we tried to use it, it was closed for private function. Drinks were pricy at $10 for an average Pina Colada. As for Boston, we enjoyed the cycle tours but overall struggled to find much else that really kept us interested although there were some nice shops and the trip to Harvard was interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Comfortable Rooms”
Reviews.Author: cancun1104
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 nights in September. The hotel was within walking distance of Fenway and Prudential Center was across the street. The rooms were very nice. Loved the rubber duck. We purchased a 2 day troley ticket to see the highlights of Boston. Had a great time in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Room - No Service of any value”
Reviews.Author: emjaytx
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised as this hotel has been renovated and the room was spacious with lots of windows, bright and airy. However, when I sat down to watch the US Open and the channels kept changing and I called down stairs to let them know that there was obviously some interference with another room they sent up an engineer who changed out the batteries in the remote control which did not work. I called down again, actually the feeling I got was nobody was going to do anything. They just kept apologizing an hoping the problem was going to go away. Of course it didn't. A very aggressive concierge, Carol, talked us into going to Skip Jacks for dinner when I wanted to go somewhere else. Said she had been referring it for 25 years and had never had a bad report. It was the worst seafood I had ever eaten. The lobster was over cooked. The second night we got Justin as our concierge and he was fabulous. The air conditioner was really loud and housekeeping were banging around and constantly talking from 7am on both Saturday & Sunday morning. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - great rooftop pool!”
Reviews.Author: emmaly2
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel - nice room w/ updated bathroom and a gorgeous (but small) rooftop pool. Drinks by the pool are a unique experience in downtown Boston - though on the weekend it was impossible to get a chair by the pool. Food/drink service was inconsistent - some servers were very friendly while others were strangely rude to almost all patrons. All in all - I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “RUDE, RUDE, RUDE”
Reviews.Author: danielweaver
Reviews.Content: I had a long weekend stay (3 nights) here last weekend in August, 2010. Although this hotel was very clean and modern, the staff at the front desk were very rude and disrespectful. We paid our bill in cash and they treated us as if we were low class. Even though we let them hold an extra $500 for what they call "incidentals", we were not allowed to have a key to the mini bar or order room service from that money. So, I asked them, "Since I cannot get anything from the mini bar, cannot rent movies, and cannot get room service or charge to the room, what incidentals might I get that the extra $500 you needed would pay for?" They did not know.... But said I might strip the room. I asked to speak with the general manager and was basically refused. They were rude, condescending, and insulting. I would recommend many other great options in Boston, but never stay at the rude Colonnade.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible management and staff if you have an issue”
Reviews.Author: allswag
Reviews.Content: We booked a room for a busy July weekend but when we arrived there was no record of our reservation - even though I had a printed confirmation email. The entire city was sold out and the management did nothing to help us find a room. He basically hid in the back while we were left to call around. We were able to leave our bags and go to the Red Sox game we had ticketsfor but upon return the bell hop was snide at our predicament. We ended up paying $550 for the Marriott only because we are Platinum members and they had to have a room for us. We were not offered any kind of compensation and we were not the only ones in this predicament. At least 2 other guests showed up with reservations and did not have a room. Worst hotel experience we have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: rshh97
Reviews.Content: The staff was exceptionally attentive to our every need! I slept better than I have ever slept in a hotel. The location was excellent for shopping, sight-seeing and dining. We came for a wedding and had a wonderful mini-vacation as well!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: Icelandic81
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Colonnade very much! The staff was very helpul and friendly. The location is amazing. The room was clean,very cozy and nice, the bed very comfortable!!

Reviews.Title: “thoroughly enjoyed staying here; great location to everything”
Reviews.Author: camsev
Reviews.Content: we brought our son to Northeastern Law school and wanted place close to him. This hotel far exceeded our expectations with lovely rooms, a terrific restaurant and close location to the mall and other restaurants. We took advantage of a summer price special and couldn't have been happier with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Colonnade Hotel”
Reviews.Author: massfuntime
Reviews.Content: This hotel attends to your every need. They are courteous, available and efficient. The rooms are large and well attended to. It is a perfect choice for a function. The event coordinator is superior and knowledgeable and the chef is top notch. I highly recommend the Colonnade Hotel in Boston. Your stay will be most enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Jaetay
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located in the "back bay" area. Hotel staff is personal, knowledgeable and service oriented. The concierge is one of the best I've ever dealt with...and I'm sorry to say that I don't remember her name.... but, she helped me on several occasions during our stay. The rooms are lovely, and everything is clean, fresh and new throughout. Oh, and the Trolley stops right in front!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & clean hotel”
Reviews.Content: The location is tops. You are right by the Prudential Center shops & the Back Bay. The T is right outside the door to get to other parts of town. Our room was just like the photo on the website. It was nice; the only thing missing was a refrigerator. The hotel was very quiet; we didn't hear any other guests in the halls or rooms adjacent. The roof top pool was a nice spot to sit & relax for a bit. Overall, a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boston location ~ rooftop pool a bonus”
Reviews.Author: familygrl7
Reviews.Content: The location is fabulous. T stop right out the door. Grocery store down the street for incidentals. Shopping and coffee across the street. We liked the bedding, the coffee maker, and the spaciousness of the bathroom. It would be nice if there was a table or counter for toiletries. The air conditioning worked very well. Our room was at the end of a hallway and very quiet. The view and the pool on the rooftop were very cool. I like staying in hotels that have under 250 rooms. This was the perfect size.

Reviews.Title: “High Class Service + Roof Top Pool”
Reviews.Author: SkiBune
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I went to Boston to visit BU & Northeastern. With the NEU rate it made this wonderful hotel much more affordable. The hotel is beautiful & the staff very pleasant. Our room was on the 9th floor (out of 11, the pool is on the roof and 1 flight of stairs up) Our view was over Huntington Ave and looked at the Prudential Center, which has restaurants and shoppes. The location was great. the subway is right outside the front door. Even though there are plenty of places to eat right there, we took the subway (the charlie) and walked through Copley Square & Fanueil Hall area (for shopping & food). The parking is a self park deck ($38/day), I prefer to park myself & not have to wait for my car. The deck is below the hotel, so it's just an elevator ride to the lobby or you rroom. When leaving to visit BU & Northeastern the next day we were also very centrally located (If you are interested in attending a Red Sox game, it's also not that far away either. The room is beautiful & well appointed. The beds are very comfortable and loaded with pillows!! We loved our stay at the Colonnade. If our daughter goes to school in Boston, we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel at lower price”
Reviews.Author: Catherine155032
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Colonnade Hotel. The place was affordable and the rooms were way above our expectations. Everything was perfect! On top of this, the place was affordable. I recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel as long as you don't pay full price”
Reviews.Author: tlh02
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great if you get a discounted room rate but would be a disappointment if you paid full price. Our room was large with a big television and a comfortable bed. Nice work area for the business traveler. The bathroom is rather small but two people were able to make it work. The gym was satisfactory but crowded and the pool provided a nice break from the chaos of the city. The hotel is in a great location being near tons of restaurants and shopping. The Colonnade is a 12 minute walk to Fenway and the green line has a stop right outside the front door. The problem with the hotel is the service. There is no service. The front desk clerk didn't talk to us except to ask for a credit card and provide the room number. The bellhop who stored our luggage upon arrival returned our luggage to us but never offered to bring it to our room. No one greeted us at the door. The concierge was seldom there to provide any assistance. There was no turn down service, no fresh towels in the evening. The gym was frequently out of towels as well. Bottom line - this is a really good hotel for the price we paid. It could be a great hotel but only if service improves dramatically.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dissatisfied0008
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel a few years ago. It was a great experience. When we decided to revisit Boston I saw that the hotel had been renovated. We arrived at 2:45 checkin was at 3PM. The room was not ready until 4PM. They asked for our cell phone # yet never called us to say the room was ready. The front desk was rude. Upon entering the room it smelled like someone had just smoked marijana it was awful. The bed pillows had stains, the sheets had hair on them, the curtain on the window was torned and dirty, the shower curtain was stained, the toilet seat moved when you sat on it, there was no refrigerator in the room, no ice bucket for us to keep our water cold but yet there was an ice machine on the wall outside our room that guests used all night long noise was awful. The handles on the sink were falling off as was the mirror on the wall. I am not sure what they renovated but surely it was not the room we stayed in. The price was definitely not worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “first class hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: yvesonadvisor
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 great nights at the Colonnade in Boston. Location is great, Hotel is first class with 4star level rooms (modern design, first class bedding, quiet large room for a big city hotel). Staff was perticulary friendly and pro, from frontdoor men to concierge. Comfort of a big chain with service of a family hotel. To give an idea, we use to travel in the US and Europe. This was part of a 3 weeks travel in New England and New York. We booked only 3 to 5 stars rooms from 200 to 450$ per night. I can be consiered as a tough client: correct but no tolerance on failure vs. expectation/promisses. Thi was- by far- the best value and experience we got amongst the 7 hotels visited. Special mention for to top roof pool: I expected a small pool, just for the fun, but it was a really nice pool with terrasse, long chairs and bar. Great place to be in the afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & great rooms for the price”
Reviews.Author: montana-traveler65
Reviews.Content: The hotel is within walking distance of Fenway and several historic sites, not to mention some nice shopping. The women in our family loved the sleek, modern rooms, which are just big enough not to feel cramped. The boys had great fun in the rooftop pool. And for me, the price was right: we paid $189 per night plus taxes. Try to avoid using a car because the daily garage fee is $38. The fees are even higher at nearby garages. The Boston subway has a stop right outside the hotel. If you need a car after a few days, there's an Avis rental office within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great location- poor service”
Reviews.Author: spagirl104
Reviews.Content: You can't get a better location. We had several problems during our stay. Our first room was by a wirless router that had poor connectivity. After notifying the manager- and walking under the other routers to test my suspicions. I was told by the manager that I was mistaken and initially he (Damien) refused to move me. After insisting we were moved to a room where the minibar was broken. Damien, again, told me I was mistaken. After three workers checking on it and 4 hours later- we recieved a new minibar. The pool is nice- but small. The excercise room is very small- and several people who live in the hotel residences work out there with a trainer- so there was no room for hotel guests. There are plenty of other hotels in the area- so if the price isn't a bargain- stay someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Good central location, great rooftop pool”
Reviews.Author: LondonThelma
Reviews.Content: Having spent a long time trying to choose which hotel to spend the first part of our holiday, we chose the Colonnade because of its rooftop pool, which was fabulous. However on two of the three evenings we were there it was closed or partially closed off for private functions - so if a pool is a priority, this could be really annoying. We booked through hotels.com and got a good bargain - I would have resented paying the full price though as it is not really that special. The concierge and door staff were lovely, the receptionists not so helpful. The bedroom, a double double, was really too small for four people, and the public areas are not cozy. But the location is great, and if you get a good price, I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: squiggles1118
Reviews.Content: We arrived in the evening for a 5 night stay in Boston. I had changed the reservation due to the pool from a previous reservation and glad I did that. Room was very comfortable (526) - negatives were that it only had one mirror in the bathroom (difficult for two grown adults to get ready at the same time) but looking at their website, this may be due to it being a handicap room- larger bath area for wheelchair access. This room shared a wall with the fitness center - you could hear the hum of treadmills by 6:30 am - this was a minor inconvenience but important if you are a light sleeper or late sleeper. This room was also set up as a possible adjoining room which meant we could hear EVERYTHING coming the next room from TV programs to a heated business conference call at 7AM one morning. Luckily the room next door was not booked for our entire stay. Positives were the staff - very helpful and I'm pretty sure if we had complained about the room, they would have tried to move us but we were settled in by day 3. We had just returned from a two week trip to Eastern Europe and the staff at the Colonnade treated us very well - everyone from the front desk, to bellman, to maid service and concierge - very professional and friendly. Room was very clean and comfortable. Great bed/pillows. Air con easy to use and accurate. Roof top pool was wonderful and a great place to relax. Pretty busy in the afternoon - had to wait for a chaise but plenty of seating. This area had food/beverage service as well. Can't say enough about the location. Just steps from the Prudential T stop on the green line and a very easy walk to the trolley stop across the street at the Sheraton Hotel (we took the double decker trolley (green) and highly recommend it!) PS: If you sign up for the Colonnade's rewards program you will have free wi-fi for your entire visit. Not sure how long this will last, but ask if you arrive without having signed up from home. Highly recommended and shop for price. I had checked earlier and then right before we left for Europe and found a great rate online.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stays at the Colonnade”
Reviews.Author: northsoutheastwest
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Colonnade over the past two weeks as a bookend to a New York City Trip. The hotel has a wonderful location in Back Bay close to lots of attractions and next to the Prudential T Stop. Other T Stops are close by. We chose the Colonnade based on its proximity to the Back Bay Station which serves as the Amtrak Station, the general location, the competitive rates, and the positive reviews on Trip Advisor. The hotel rooms are beautifully decorated in an updated contemporary style, and though the regular rooms are small , the space is very well planned. On our second stay we were in a fantastic, and large suite. The staff including , the bellmen (Juan especially) were great). We were always greeted by named. The hotel stored some of our luggage for the four days we were in NYC, and when we came back Juan without inquiry or our ticket retrieve it for us. We enjoyed our stay at the Colonnade and look forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: DomMtl62
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the great reviews on Tripadvisor and all came as advertised. Room was very clean and modern, bed was very comfortable. Parking on premises was appreciated, but $38/night is still a bit hard to swallow. A special mention for the courteous and friendly staff, always smiling and helpful. The location was great for shopping and dining, but I would have probably preferred something closer to Beacon HIll as it is a better walking neighbourhood. Rooftop pool looked terrific, but didn't use it.

Reviews.Title: “Loud Loud Loud rooms but great location”
Reviews.Author: pbthec
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect. It's walking distance to everything. BUT the walls are paper thin. You can literally hear flip flops in the hallway and every word from the next room. It's really too bad because the rooms are nice and have a nice amount of space. There is a bit of a smell in the hallways but its not terrible. Not much attention from the staff in the lobby during the day. There is a pool on the top floor which is a fun feature but its pretty crowded on a nice day. parking is 38 bucks kinda steep in my opinion. I would not stay there again it is that difficult to get to sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: DMFH
Reviews.Content: Hotel and restaurant were great. Rooftop pool was fun.

Reviews.Title: “Did not RESERVE the rooms I made a RESERVATION for”
Reviews.Author: trailblazer25
Reviews.Content: I made my reservation well in advance (6 months), for Two connecting rooms with double beds. I was told at check in that they didn't have any of these available. What is the point of making a RESERVATION if you aren't going to RESERVE the rooms? So they had us switch rooms for the second night which was very inconvenient. Still not in the connecting rooms we reserved, but at least for the second night we had the correct amount of beds. I realized shortly after moving to the second room that I had left something very expensive in the first room. I knew EXACTLY where I had left it. The front desk could not be more useless. They said house keeping didn't have it. And that was that. S.O.L. Let me remind you, if I didn't have to switch rooms in the first place, I would not have lost this item.

Reviews.Title: “Could be perfect with some minor tweaks”
Reviews.Author: Paperface
Reviews.Content: The journey from Logan Intl. Airport to the Colonnade Hotel lasted about ten minutes at 2.30am, and the taxi fare was a very reasonable $26 (excluding tip). The Colonnade Hotel has excellent access to the 'T' (metro service) with the Prudential stop (on the green line) directly outside the front door. A single fare to the airport costs just $1.70 and involves three hassle free changes (green line, blue line and airport shuttle bus). Situated in a great location, the hotel is conveniently close to two up-market malls, Newbury Street (boutique shops and restaurants), Copely Square (City Library and Trinity Church) and within walking distance to most of Boston's landmarks. Rooms at the Colonnade Hotel are enormous, bright (floor to ceiling windows) and beautifully furnished in a contemporary style with an extraordinary large, comfortable bed and a very efficient, quiet air-conditioning system. There's a coffee maker, full sized ironing board and iron, flat screen tv and lots of storage space. The bathroom is stocked with quality cosmetics, a hairdryer, bath and an excellent power shower. On the minus side I'd have to mention a few things as tweaking them could make this hotel the perfect retreat in Boston. Our room was at the end of a long corridor and beside the access door to the hotel's apartments. From 6-9am and 5-7pm there was a constant flow of people using this route. The continuous loud click as the door was opened, not to mention the fact that guests tended to stop and have a chat before opening the door wore thin after our first two nights (we were too tired to notice initially). I would suggest that guests staying more than two nights are not given this room. I also got the impression that the reception staff were inexperienced and not particularly friendly or interested in our welfare. I did not get the impression that 'customer is king'. However, the bell captain made up for this with his genuinely friendly and helpful manner as did the porters to a lesser extent. Our room was generally very clean but could have done with some closer attention in relation to the skirting boards, scuffed walls and bathroom floor. There's a policy of changing the sheets after three days unless you request for it to be done on a daily basis, however, during our five day stay they were not changed at all. I don't want to sound harsh as the overall atmosphere at the Colonnade Hotel is very relaxed and not pretentious. We would definitely stay there again as the pluses out weight the minuses, however, when paying nearly â‚¬200 a night (inc. taxes), with no breakfast you tend to focus on exactly what you're getting for your money. I find value a strange concept in relation to hotels in the US - value to me is when you get a little bit more than you expected but in truth, at these rates I would expect something closer to perfection. Enjoyed: Mumbai Chopsticks and Charlie's Bar and Grill (Newbury Street); Museum of Fine Art; Harvard Yard; Prudential Viewing Deck; Harbour, Esplanade and Brown Stone Residential areas; Trinity Church; and the Church of Christ, Scientist complex

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Pentonys
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself plus my sixteen-year old daughter stayed in the Colonnade recently for 3 days. We have stayed here before and not been disappointed. This hotel is wonderfully located opposite the Prudential Centre. It's a stone's distance from Copley Square and there is a T-stop directly outside the door. It has a wonderful roof top pool and there is a "Cheese Cake Factory" restaurant directly across the road. The rooms are spacious and comfortable and reception were friendly and helpful. What more could any holiday maker want?

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great location.”
Reviews.Author: typicaltraveler_10
Reviews.Content: Room and service was top notch. Everything is clean and updated (new). Staff is courteous and professional. I was disappointed that for the price and quality of the hotel that the shuttle service was limited and not typically recommended and cabs were not worth the price. Downtown location was excellent to many attractions and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “colonnade boston - the heart of boston - rooftop pool, beautiful rooms, and service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: funinboston
Reviews.Content: With so many hotels to choose from, how does one decide where to stay in Boston? The Colonnade always delivers excellence during my stay s for various purposes -- when visiting colleges, traveling alone for business, and when on a family vacation. This spotlessly clean hotel feels calm and intimate, which means I feel relaxed every time I am there! The front desk staff is always helpful and everything goes smoothly, even when I've been lucky enough to secure a room when the hotel is close to sold out. I have never had to wait long to check in or out -- another plus. The parking is great and provides me instant access to my car at all times. Everything works quickly and smoothly at The Colonnade, which means I have more time and energy to enjoy my reasons for being in Boston. The rooms and bathrooms are beautiful, with their tasteful elegance. They are immaculately clean, as well. The beds provide a restful night's sleep. Soft lighting is soothing. Another one of my favorite features of The Colonnade is the rooftop pool. I can't say enough about this sparkling gem in the city. The pool is never crowded or noisy. While welcoming to families, everyone is respectful in this beautiful space, which is the perfect setting to enjoy the city's views. I've enjoyed many meals at the rooftop pool. Another reason I love The Colonnade is the location. It is truly in the heart of Boston, near shopping, colleges, restaurants, and many other pleasures that Boston has to offer. Every time I return home from my stay, I look forward to my next trip to Boston, many thanks to The Colonnade.

Reviews.Title: “had a wonderful stay, friendly, courteous employees, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: SightseeingMom
Reviews.Content: Everything was great here! Only problem I saw was that the bathrooms should have exhaust fans- very steamy after showering. Also the roof top pool was great but wished it could be open later that 8 pm. Beds were very comfortable, and great pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Turn54
Reviews.Content: Good location . Within walking distance the best shopping and restaurants in the city. If you request a quiet room they deliver. Absolutely the best nights sleep I have ever had in any hotel. Fabulous views of the city and a rooftop pool:)

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ShopTravelLove
Reviews.Content: I revisited The Colonnade after its complete renovation, and was thrilled with the result! This is now a truly luxurious hotel, and the location is perfect. I especially love the warm and friendly feel -- the staff could not have been nicer or more professional -- and the manageable size of this hotel is a welcome change from the huge, convention-oriented hotels surrounding it. If they continue to offer reasonable rates and specials, I will definitely become a frequent guest!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fine hotel if you get a good price”
Reviews.Author: kangaroo5050
Reviews.Content: If you get a good deal then this hotel is definitely worth it. However, I definitely wouldn't pay the going hotel rate. [Despite their claims, no they don't match on-line options as the latter only say double rooms whereas the Colonade call theirs "lux" doubles]. They also say that it's a boutique hotel focused on the details and I certainly didn't see that; if you want that "boutique" experience I'd opt for a Kimpton Hotel. Again, it was perfectly nice, clean, comfy beds but there was barely room to get around one bed to access the closet and only one chair to sit on (there was a foot stool for another person). If you want a place with a great location--ten steps from the subway, huge grocery store across the street along let alone a major mall, good restaurants nearby, this would be the place--provided you got a good price.

Reviews.Title: “OVER RATED!”
Reviews.Author: ebarrettSeattle
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Colonnade first for business then for personal events. The room was extremely small to say the least and had no microwave - a must considering we were there over a week. Also, we specifically asked for a room with a view and we got dumped into a room with a view of the adjacent brick wall and alley. The food on the menu was expensive, unexpectedly so for breakfast. The rooms were clean but had an old and outdated feeling to them. Don't waste your money staying here. It's not worth it! Very over-rated. The Extended Stay hotel we went to afterwards was far more superior and half the cost.

Reviews.Title: “fine hotel in a great spot!”
Reviews.Author: weets
Reviews.Content: stayed for 3 nights in july 2010 - room had 2 double beds. Clean and comfortable room with individually controllable air con. nice quality fixtures and decor and full length window although view from 9th floor not overly impressive. Great HD TV and coffeee maker. clean bathroom with plenty of towels etc. Visited roof top pool on a really hot afternoon - welcome dip in the small but clean and not crowded pool. We had package deal so had included the American breakfast at Brasserie Jo -- good food and excellent service. I think if you choose alternative items they charge for this but not sure as we stuck to the American!Where this hotel wins is location - literally across street from Prudential Center shops etc - the T green line station at Prudential is just out of the door and there are usually taxi's waiitng outside as well (nb taxi from Logan $35 but to Logan at 6pm only $25!). Easy walk to Newbury Street and Coley square etc as is the Boston garden area. walked in the day and early evening and felt safe - plenty of people and traffic about. Pru centre has a great Cheesecake factory restaurant! There is a Shaw's supermarket - I think 24h - across the street too. most of the Boston trolley tours seem to go down Huntington avenue as do the Duck tours but we chose Old Town trolleys ($38 adult) as they stop at the hotels door! Tickets for sale in the Pru centre - great tour and ticket last 2 consecutive days with one added 45 minute harbour tour per ticket. There is a samll stand in the Pru centre which has alot of tourist leaflets etc and most of the trolley tours, duck tours seem to have stands in there. Boston is a great city and the Colonnade is a great base too. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodations but costly internet and parking.”
Reviews.Author: JoannaGen
Reviews.Content: The rooms are great, the people are wonderful but I find it hard to believe that internet is still considered a luxury. It should be included just like coffee is in the rooms. I would gladly give up having the hotel logo on the hand towels in the public bathrooms near the conference rooms for free internet. The same holds true for the parking. At $38 per day, it adds up. It is more than airport parking! Also, don't get an adjoining room, you can hear EVERYTHING that happens in the next room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful! Loved the reading lamps on the bed. T-stop right outside the front door.”
Reviews.Author: TravelerDG
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights over Memorial Day weekend. King room for $160/nt with AAA discount. Room was spacious. Table w/2 chairs by the window. Plenty of space for luggage, snacks. Bed really comfortable w/reading lamps on either side - perfect for my husband, who goes to bed about 2 hours after I do, so he was able to read in bed while I slept! Parking garage right next door to hotel - self-park w/in and out privileges. Liked that we didn't have to worry about valet or bellman to carry our luggage. Rubber duckie greeting us on the edge of the tub in the bathroom was a nice touch! T-stop is right outside the door of the hotel. This was amazingly convenient after walking around for an entire day to come up the escalator and be back at the hotel. Rooftop pool is pretty cool - not very big, but I went in the AM and was pretty much the only person in the pool. Hotel restaurant (Brasserie Jo) was good, but way overpriced for breakfast. Glass of OJ was $4.25 for maybe 8 oz. - probably more like 6 oz.

Reviews.Title: “The Family Connection Package is perfect!”
Reviews.Author: kayleigh_10
Reviews.Content: We loved that the hotel guaranteed connecting rooms. The Family Connection package included Duck Tour tickets and NE Aquarium tickets and breakfast. What a great value. The kids loved the roof top pool, and the staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been a disaster...”
Reviews.Author: Mimi247
Reviews.Content: I arrived at this hotel with my husband and our six year old grandson following a five-hour Amtrak trip. We were hot and tired. The receptionist couldn't find our reservation which had been booked and pre-paid in March through 1-800-HOTELS.COM. Finally, after much searching found it HAD BEEN PAID THEN CANCELED! I always book online although this was my first experience with 1-800-HOTELS.COM. So here we are in Boston in July with no reservations, not to mention the money I had paid in March. The clerk (whose name I'm sorry I don't remember because I was in such a panic) sent someone to ask my husband and grandson if they would like a cold drink while she assured me that they did have a room. Now I had originally booked a Courtyard and had been sent by 1-800-HOTELS.COM to this much nicer and more expensive hotel. The Colonnade staff was gracious enough to offer a discounted room rate (2 x more that original hotel but still a kindness they didn't have to offer) and then on top of that, they gave us a suite. The hotel was great, service outstanding, and, you may have read about "Norman, the doorman" elsewhere--he's the best. He truly understands the meaning of first class service to the customer. (If you go, avoid the in-house restaurant--ask Norman how to get to the Thornton for breakfast.) Arrived home yesterday to find that 1-800-HOTELS.COM had filed for bankruptcy.

Reviews.Title: “very nice 4th at the Colonnade”
Reviews.Author: rosimmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the 4th with 3 other families. All our kids were 9 and under. We booked a package that included breakfast for two adult at Brassierie Jo. The hotel staff was fabulous. They were super nice and very accomodating. The pool was great. The food at the pool was reasonable in price. Our room was very clean and was always cleaned promptly. The staff let us have a late check out and we were able to use the parking garage till three of the day we checked out. The location was great. Right across the prudential center. There are great dining options there. Check out Wagamama's. Great noodles. The only complaint we had was that on our last day breakfast at Brassierie Jo's took two and a half hours because they didn't aniticipate that many people on monday. But it was a long weekend they should have known better. Say hi to Norman the doorman when you go, he will give you all the info you need. BTW, the t stop is righ outside the door of the hotel. We didnt' use our car the whole weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Beadwitch
Reviews.Content: We were spending July 4th visitng kids who live in Back Bay. The Colonnade Hotel was the perfect location. The initial major selling point for us was the excellent rate found at 800-hotels.com; it was 50% cheaper than through the hotel reservation service. The reservation associate checked what I'd found and gave us that rate! The hotel itself is wonderful - Modern luxury without being over-the-top. Perfect for us with, friendly, helpful service all around. The beds were comfortable with luxury linens. Plenty of lighting in room, plus robes in closet, iPod/iPhone-compatible clock radio. Bathrooms clean and bright. Large magifying mirror was perfect! Brasserie Jo was convenient for breakfast and the food was good. Best feature: roof top pool (day was 90 degrees plus!). Fantastic location if you're planning to catch a game at Fenway!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service by highly qualified employees”
Reviews.Author: disp1222
Reviews.Content: The staff were fantastic and very knowledgeable. They went out of their way to ensure all our requests were filled and their can do attitude is second to none. I can only think of one downfall and it was not the fault of the hotel or the staff. It was the late night guests who came back to the hotel late that would slam their doors. It would wake us most nights. The location is great. It is right on the T green line and you purchase a weekly pass for $15.00 and can travel just about anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great dog friendly hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Bioteacher67
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Colonnade for 2 nights with our teenagers our Border Terrier. The hotel is clean, friendly to the dog with recommendations of dog parks in the area. The boys loved the rooftop pool and the soft and comfortable beds. We all loved the little rubber duck in the bathroom. Staff were friendly and efficient, sorting out a minor issue with the TV in under 3 minutes! The location is fabulous, right on the subway and across from great shops and restaurants. We would stay there again in a heartbeat. Cheaper than the Marriot and much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Stay”
Reviews.Author: tl56
Reviews.Content: We all enjoyed our 4 night stay at The Colonnade in June. We look for hotels that are welcoming to our children. Our room on the 11th floor was a great location with a lovely view of the Brownstones and VERY easy access to the rooftop pool which is located on the 12th floor. The pictures on the website do not do it justice and need to be updated. What great way to spend the day or a part of the day after seeing the sights in Boston. The room and bathroom are tight but comfortable - all the amenities you need. The service is excellent and it begins with the welcoming bellhops, front desk, housekeeping and pool staff. We look forward to our return next time we visit Boston.

Reviews.Title: “A Commitment To Quality”
Reviews.Author: tvlingchef
Reviews.Content: The Colonnade is a great example of what a four star city hotel should be. Across the board aggressive friendly service, with a definite commitment to quality in every respect to our stay. The organizational culture at the Colonnade is well developed and is exhibited from pool to parking. Brasserie Jo is an outstanding restaurant and we frequented it for breakfast, lunch, dinner and Sunday brunch. In room dining was outstanding as well. We wanted to enjoy a family city trip and we chose Boston, we had originally planed on staying at the intercontinental but it was sold out for the weekend and the Colonnade did not disappoint. It is located in the heart of downtown Boston and you can walk to Fenway, the harbor, or just about any historic tourist destination. I travel extensively and I have never enjoyed a more comfortable bed or pillows. The service and facility are certainly four star but unassuming enough to feel comfortable and allow us to do what we came there to do, Relax.

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss the Roof Top Pool!”
Reviews.Author: tennisfan2010
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, LOVED the shower... water pressure was amazing. Beds were luxurious and the Roof Top Pool is a must see. It was relaxing and fun and the wait staff there are great. In fact the entire staff was fantastic! Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Look Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: bbfergu
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my daughter while she was prepping for a course at BU. The room was expensive, $340/night. After our long drive, and questioning that we had a good room at check in, we arrived in 1101, the top floor only to look out directly into their residences next door. Absolutely no view of the beautiful city of Boston. Tired, and disappointed, we didn't feel like making the call to see if this was the best they had to offer. Since it was only 2:00 and the parking lot was empty, I seriously doubt it was. Our internet was intermittent and booted us off for know apparent reason many times. Frustrating for my daughter; she lost her work several times. We spent hours with engineering and directly with the provider but it never got fixed. We were overcharged and mislead on our "included" breakfast. Warning, do not sway from the American breakfast or you will be charged for your juice and coffee, Concierge was cold and crabby. We felt like we were really putting her out when we asked for advise and a map. The are many great hotels in this area including the Westin, Lenox and Fairmont, and all rooms look as though they have views. We travel a lot for both business and pleasure and get quite annoyed when the expected value is not met. We will be traveling here a lot in the future while our daughter is in University and we will try another hotel next time. I also wish I had booked directly through Tripadvisor. I find that you always get a better room/upgrade that way.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: shmemmie
Reviews.Content: a group of us had a wedding in boston. a few months back we started talking about where to stay. we decided that because we were going in june that we wanted a hotel with a pool. all fingers pointed to the colonnade. one of the group works for a company based in boston and she had a connection, so she got us 4 rooms(2 adults per room) for $179 per night. we all have young kids so we were thrilled. we were very excited until someone told us it was old and run down. we kept looking at the pics online and it looked nice. we pulled up and asked where to park bc we were staying there. instead of asking to help us with our bags, we were told where to self park. i had read that the service was not too great, and we hadnt even gotten out of the car yet...we parked and schlepped our stuff into the lobby, which we decided looked very nice...ok....we go to check in...again, prompt, but not overly friendly. we are still kinda skeptical about the decor, etc, but we have not yet disappointed. we were on the 7th floor, we opened the door and the room was great! it was kinda small but we were in a city after all(nothing could compare to my tiny studio i nyc!!), but new and modern and cool. the bathroom was small as well, but clean and new..and even had a little ledge for our stuff...we went up to the rooftop pool..this is worth everything. a FABULOUS rooftop pool deck with great pool and amazing chairs. they serve food and drinks up there. unfortunatly, the weather was awful so we really didnt get to use it. but its amazing!! if you want to be in the middle of the city, close to everything, this is the place. we ladies loved it bc the mall was directly across the street. our husbands were not so happy, but we were!!! always cabs, tons of everything.. beds soo comfy as are linens. bathrobe in room(2) which we love..products are sufficient but not outrageous. hd tv with flat screens in each room. if need be, i would def stay again. if you want to be in the heart of the city, i would say def stay here. the people that work here are a little rude but besides that its great!!! fyi-the parking is really expensive..$40 a day. see if you can work that into your room rate!

Reviews.Title: “Overall superb, but curtains, bathroom door, and price noteworthy”
Reviews.Author: gijoeczar
Reviews.Content: Superb stay overall. I couldn't open the left side curtain fully and the bathroom doors (two have doors that don't lock) are cooky. Additionally, this place is certainly on the very high end of the spectrum and at $38/day for parking you're better off finding a monthly rate lot somewhere if your stay will near a week in length or longer. And, $13.95/day for Internet is an insult; don't pay it as there's a Barnes and Nobles with free high speed Internet right across the street. That said, the staff was fricken awesome, especially Erica at the front desk. The rooms view was fricken awesome and because the windows were full length and hieght it felt like you were outside when the windows were open. The audio video setup is superb. The shower head water pressure is better than any place that I have been in my life. And the bed itself -- absolutely to die for. Lastly, the location doesn't get better. I'll do it again in a heartbeat -- sooner if they'll discount their rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great Base for College Visits”
Reviews.Author: Cortesefam
Reviews.Content: The Colonnade provided an ideal base for a family visit to Boston and college search for our 17 year old. With the T stop (Green Line) immediately at the front door, and parking included in the "Breakfast Escape" package, it provided total flexibility for our stay. We reserved two connecting rooms, one king and one with two doubles, and the hotel accommodated our request. The rooms were very clean, modern, and comfortable for the family. Wi-Fi was $13.95 per night using the i-bahn service at the hotel. Our package included breakfast, which was spectacular! Not to miss are the Eggs Benedict, the Chocolate French Toast with Almonds, Belgian Waffles with Fresh Berries and the Croque Madame. Breakfast at the Colonnade had no connection to usual business hotel meal experience--truly exceptional. We dined both nights on Newbury Street, just 2 blocks from the hotel. We also had a late lunch Sunday in the North End, followed by cannoli at Mike's Pastry on Hanover--the highlight for our patient 14 year-old. The Back Bay neighborhood around the Colonnade made it the right choice for our family, in contrast to the Financial District and Waterfront hotels I've experienced on business trips--we enjoyed strolling along Boylston and Newbury streets, and could walk to Northeastern and Boston Universities. Advice: even numbered rooms face east, and catch a very bright morning sun--it is vital to carefully and fully close the drapes on the floor to ceiling windows!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: LaDyonna
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very comfortable. Service was good and staff was friendly. Convienant locale if you are going to see some of the other surrounding areas. Do buy the Trolley pass, well worth the money, stops at 5pm :(

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend with Teen Son”
Reviews.Author: Momtraveler7
Reviews.Content: My teen son and I (mom) planned a special long weekend. The hotel was great- 3-block walk from the train station and a short walk to Fenway. We were given a top floor room with a sweeping floor to ceiling view of the city and Fenway. Great, friendly staff in a very upscale yet welcoming environment. Right across from Prudential Center and T-stop right in front of doorman entrance-near restaurants and shopping at Copley and Newbury Street. Room was large, clean and had a nice sitting area. Enjoyed the 3 days in Boston at the Colonnade.-

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Friendly Staff, Great Location! Best Choice in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Shoshi18
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Boston from Guatemala with over 20 students to attend a conference in, and I have to say that we where all impressed with the quality of the hotel; everything was extraordinary! I had read mixed reviews about the hotel and had my doubts when i first booked the hotel, but they were quick to assure me that they would help us with any special needs we had. All of the group was impressed with the quality of the rooms, and the decoration. Everyone from the front desk to room service were more than helpful. The concierges were always willing to help, and would always provide excellent advice. At all times they were able to meet are needs as a group. Having travled with groups before I know this can be bothersome for some hotel, but it was not the case at the Colonnade. I have never been in hotel were staff is as attentive and always ensuring you have a pleasant stay. I have been traveling to Boston for more than 10 years and have stayed at several luxury hotels both in Boston and Cambridge and can say without a doubt that the Colonnade is your best choice when choosing were to stay. It has a T stop *(Subway Stop) just outside the door, the mall is just across the street, walking distance from Newbury street, the location makes everything in Boston easily accesible.

Reviews.Title: “Colonnade Hotel â€“ â€œTruly a Dogâ€�”
Reviews.Author: hipmaster
Reviews.Content: We just returned from three excruciatingly long nights at the Colonnade Hotel. This was a return to the Colonnade after sampling some fine hotels over the past 5 years including the Liberty, Nine Zero and recently the Inn at St Botolph. We chose the hotel due to its proximity to our daughterâ€™s University and graduation proceedings. The Colonnade touts itself as a hip, boutique hotel after major renovation. Do not be confused by this claim, this is NOT either. It is a hotel confused about what its identity is. It is still very tired in many ways with no soul or style. Its price point generally compares with the hotels mentioned above but does not come close to any of them in a singular category, especially management and follow-through. As always, these are both the keys to success. Upon check-in and moments after, we realized we did not have a key to the mini-bar, no big deal in itself, but we had perishables to store. We turned on the television but it did not work. Attempting to call the front desk, we realized our hotel phone did not work. There was no choice but to go back downstairs, tired after a 6 hour flight, and immediately now had to wait for engineering. Apparently the televisions have issues, and we would get to know engineering quite well over the next days. Okay, small details, but a glimpse of the lack of care and attention to guest services to follow. Our neighbors next door arrived late (we assume from New York), and carried on until about 2 a.m., arguing between themselves through the paper thin walls at the top of their lungs, nearly overshadowing the barking dog they smuggled in. We reported them to management several times and learned of the unwritten dog policy, expecting to have them quieted down and moved appropriately. Due to overbooking the 5th floor, set aside for guests with pets, we were their lucky neighbors. As a dog owner, I love dogs. However, the marital bliss next door between the most obnoxiously loud, argumentative â€œlove birdsâ€� was unbearable, bordering on constant domestic abuse. Late at night, or early in the morning, they kept us awake. After numerous complaints, they finally offered to move me! We were totally situated, and having to pack up my daughter from her dorm and 5 years of school, I was offered the inconvenience of moving by Colonnade staff. Are you serious? You have obnoxious guests, arguing at decibel levels unheard of, with a smuggled dog, that staff indicated was not known to them at check in, and I get to move??? Security and management were both useless in solving the issue by moving them to the appropriate dog floor and not among pet-less guests. It was clear that the problem was mine. Upon check out, I explained to management once again my displeasure with their inability to satisfy the situation appropriately. I was stonewalled by them into thinking I was wrong, and offered a slight rate reduction. I shared with them that guests have a lot of choices out there, including the new W and Ames hotel that both are actually fun and hip. The Colonnade is neither. In the end they can say what they want on their website, but in the end, the Colonnade is a dog.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home!”
Reviews.Author: mrunc136
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay where the service is top notch and you want to be treated like you are family stay at the Colonnade in Boston. Jimmy, Juan and Norman are always greet us with a smile and it is good to see them each year that I return for the marathon. My travel experiences is enhanced by the Colonnade staff and the stress of worrying what will happen on race day is reduced by the comfortable, clean accommodations and the overall experience at the Colonnade. It is tough enough dealing with the stress of a special event but to be able to count on having a clean, convenient, nice place to stay means everything. Thanks to the staff at the Colonnade and I will see you for the Boston Marathon in 2011.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireRedSox
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about the hotel. We stayed at the hotel as part of honeymoon and it was by bar far the best room, service, location I have ever experienced. The staff knew it was our honeymoon and really went further than any other hotel on our trip to make our stay as perfect as possible. The hotel is incredibly clean and stylish. Go to Boston it is a great city, stay at the Colonnade it is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We felt like we were the only guests!”
Reviews.Author: sandyBrowerville_MN
Reviews.Content: Prudential bldg and subway stop right outside the hotel. Staff is very friendly. Loved the cute, yellow, rubby ducky that is placed on the bathtub. Room is small. Great coffee/tea available in the room. Very comfortable beds. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Got the best room at the lowest price!!!”
Reviews.Author: Loma1
Reviews.Content: It was my Wedding Day. The hotel staff made it unforgetable. They were so nice! Everything went the way I want! I got the best room-Luxe king at the best price!!! Did not want to leave the hotel on the next day. Wish I could extend my stay;)

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, the staff is way above average!!!”
Reviews.Author: DutchOmi
Reviews.Content: The staff in this hotel is kind, knowledgeable and way above average. Great rooms, good restaurant with very attentive waiters. Definitely recommend them for a Boston Trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: prettywoman52
Reviews.Content: Clean, beautiful room; professional staff. The hotel provided the food for our business event and it was enjoyed by all - espeically the desserts! Great central location within walking distance of Barnes & Noble, restaurants, shops, and street life.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding gem”
Reviews.Author: cjpCt
Reviews.Content: phenomenal location - T station right outside the front door and across the street from the Prudential Center. Room was immaculate and well thought out. Staff were professional and very personable. Felt like we were the only guests! The restaurant is terrific - not what we would expect from a "hotel restaurant" Our package included breakfast and parking for an awesome value. Definitely going back!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: carneybe
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at your hotel for a buisness trip. We have been staying in Boston once a year for the last 12 years. This was to be our last trip there. I was very happy that we picked the Colonnade Hotel. The people are very nice and gave us a warm welcome. The rooms were just so nice and comfortable and clean and airy. I also left something behind and they were kind enough to send it to me with no charge. I am hoping to get to visit Boston in the summer so i can enjoy walking around in the nice weather and to see everything in bloom. And when we do, we will be making plans to stay at the Colonnade. We had a wonderful stay there. The Carney's

Reviews.Title: “Great surprise- Don't judge a hotel by its lobby!”
Reviews.Author: miszkinkz
Reviews.Content: I typically don't let the boyfriend pick the hotels because I tend to be very picky when it comes to style/comfort. When we arrived at the Colonnade, I was a bit scared. The lobby was small and I had a feel of a scary old haunted hotel from movies. I was already expecting for the worse! But when we got to the room I was very surprised. It was spacious, modern/chic and the bed was very comfortable! I definitely didn't think that the rooms would be this nice... We had a great view from the room, windows from floor to cieling and it was a great location...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and stress free hotel”
Reviews.Author: halljolar
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel for its easy check-in, self parking, and great new rooms. The rates were excellent for Boston and very easy to get to shopping and restaurants. I would stay here again when i visit Boston.

Reviews.Title: “"I'm Sorry"”
Reviews.Author: snowwhiteMilan
Reviews.Content: This is a pretentious hotel and as such one would expect excellent customer service for any kind of problem. Not the case here. First off, the rooms are small and so are the bathrooms! I would rather forego the amenities for a bigger bathroom. It was March so that meant the weather was changing from cold to warm in a matter of days. When Justin brought our bags up he explained the room and it's amenities and such. During this he explained how the building is transitioning from winter to summer and the rooms may seem warm so to just open the windows to get some of that great Boston air. Yeah right. The open windows did not help the heat and the cooling system was not yet turned on, (the air conditioning) so one only had a fan to use and super noisy at that. So, we opened the windows, which have no screens or a bar across, so these things open out and they are long panels makeing it so easy for any suicidal client to have a go at it. The street noise sort of canceled any desire to rest and since they did not lower the room temperature at all during the night (even wide open) no one slept. So what is the point of going to a hotel if you cannot sleep because it is either too hot or too noisy? The next morning we went to complain and instead of finding a solution all we received was an "I'm sorry" and she actually started to argue with my other half. She informed him at that time the AC was not on and that there was nothing she could or would do and suggested we could leave. So we did and as fast as we could. Checking out she took off the internet charge and the parking fee, unbelievable. Needless to say, we went across the street to the Sheraton Boston and they took us in happily and warmly giving us an early check in to boot. The concierge was not on his best behavior and sort of threw the map at us and whizzed over the directions and that was it. Placing him in the middle of this large empty unwelcoming lobby makes him seem as if he is a king of some sort; pretty odd set up if you ask me. Anyway, he was a tad snobby and I kept asking myself why. The frustrating part of it all was how much time we lost for playing tourist; the whole day was soured and we ended up rushing to get our car returned at the airport and by the time we got back the rest of the afternoon was just trying to get over the incredulity of their reaction to the issue and the extra physical effort and expense the whole thing cost us. We ended up spending more for our room at the other hotel as well as having to give a nice tip to them to hold the bags while we went to dump our car. So, all in all, not a great experience! Maybe our room was hotter than most or maybe other clients were not as uncomfortable as we were but the next day, (the temperature was higher than it had been the previous day) I noticed from our room with a great view at the Sheraton, most of the windows on the Colonnade hotel were open... Those at the Sheraton told us VIP's like the Colonnade and now I see why, they like the snobby atmosphere and to pay for people to pretend to kiss up to them. By the way, Justin deserves oodles of kudos! He was great with directions and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: complikada
Reviews.Content: My friends and I decided to stay here during the Penny Arcade Expo which was held across the street from this hotel. Checking in: They put a lot of holds on your credit card for incidentals, etc. I have to check and make sure I was charged for the correct amount. Parking: $38 per day until 3pm in their garage. I'm not familiar with this area so I'm not sure if that's expensive. Room: We had requested a suite, but they told us that it were a bit ambiguous in explaining why we were not given one. Our room was tiny, especially for 6 people, however, we made best of the situation. There were two queen beds and an roll-away bed. We had a nice view of the street from our windows. The room was newly renovated and modern. The best part about the hotel was the location. It was right across the street from the Prudential Center/Mall which was very convenient. We mostly ate at the Food Court in the mall and the Cheesecake Factory. There's also a PF Chang's inside the mall. We went out Saturday night to a bar/lounge called Vox. It was a few blocks away which was a cold walk from our hotel. There's also a Shaws (grocery store) which is open 24 hours. Overall I had a pleasant stay at this hotel. However, I'd probably consider staying at a different one with a better value. It is a bit expensive.

Reviews.Title: “If "perfect" really exists, it is the Colonnade Hotel, Boston!”
Reviews.Author: kkgreader
Reviews.Content: Ours was a two day event, combining meetings, receptions, two ceremonies and celebration brunch - events for 150 to 200 people. From the beginning of planning four months ago, the catering staff was efficient, thinking of everything - to the most minute detail. We used five spaces in this elegant boutique hotel which involved quick and drastic turnarounds by hotel personnel. The staff was efficient, pleasant and helpful - over the top! Meals and receptions' presentations were beautiful, the food unique and delicious. We brought in our own flowers, props and many guests needing rooms. Assistance and suggestions for ease in transport and set up was offered easily. The Colonnade staff offered references for rentals outside of their auspices - those companies were professional, clean and efficient. Colonnade staff worked tirelessly to anticipate our needs and assisted us at all hours of the day and night. When privacy was requested it was respectfully granted. Special requests for room access were offered, even with last minute requests. We were called by name from the time the cab door let us out on Huntington Ave.. This staff is extraordinary, the amenities flawless and the hospitality welcoming. Comments from guests of our events ranged from "classy and beautiful to "not a stone unturned" - fantastic! This is the only place I would ever stay in Boston, no matter where I am going in the city! Thanks to all at the Colonnade.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location with great amenities and accomodating staff.”
Reviews.Author: CinderChloe1
Reviews.Content: The Colonnade is the perfect hotel for the business or leisure traveler. It is well-located and has great amenities. Brasserie Jo, attached to the hotel, is a wonderful, classic French brasserie. The gym/workout facility was well-equipped, clean, with good machines and equipment. The rooms are comfortable with great beds and pillows and linens and adequate bathrooms with good lighting. Every staff member that we encountered could not have been more helpful and cheerful. All in all, a very pleasant place that I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: casey99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 overnight in January. Loved it Able to check in early..walked around South End Lots of great bars and restaurants in the area. Staff friendly and helpful. Rooms spacious and gorgeous..great view of Prudential Building and Christian Science Center. Bed was super comfy. Robes and toiletries fabulous TV and internet access good( free internet w/ I Prefer membership) Got a great rate through New England Inn and Resorts Association..$119/night Onsite parking is available, but $38.00/night..however, that is not unusual in Boston or any other large city. Would definitely stay here again..Hotel does not have a "chain" feel to it..very cozy.

Reviews.Title: “So glad I stumbled upon this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tripsamPhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: Great staff-- they were able to accomodate both an early check in and a late check out in accordance with my business schedule, and did not charge a handling fee for mailing packages in advance. Room was spacious, clean, plenty of towels and bath amenities, fitness center had lots of machines, and the hotel was in walking distance to the Prudential Center, Hynes Convention Center, lots of shops and restaurants, and a T line.

Reviews.Title: “Good nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: garun
Reviews.Content: Our flight from Chicago was delayed due to bad weather so we arrived at 2 am at the Colonnade. When we asked if late check out was possible we were offered to keep the room until 3pm. The new beds and down comforters made us feel like in heaven. When we finally got up we had our first good cup of coffee in days and the fluffiest pancakes. Since our flight home wasn't until late we stored our luggage at the hotel and enjoyed a stroll around the neighborhood. The Colonnade is very well located.

Reviews.Title: “i had an awesome time!!”
Reviews.Author: dolaher5
Reviews.Content: i had the best sleep that i have had in a long time, so comfortable and i loved being on the 11th floor so i had an awesome view.. thank you for everythng!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with two problems”
Reviews.Author: clyde1010
Reviews.Content: Two things ruined our stay at the Colonnade and made it dubious that we would return, even though we travel to Boston often. First, the positive: Great location, beautifully designed hotel, rooms and bathrooms are beautiful, with very comfortable beds, great light and views, and nice amenities. The downstairs restaurant is not cheap but is excellent and lovely. the hotel staff is friendly and mostly extremely. My husband and I were traveling with our two teenagers. The negatives might seem unimportant but it rankled us and tainted our experience: One, we requested a non-smoking room. Unbeknownst to us, the 6th floor is the first non-smoking floor, so the smell of smoke wafted up to our floor. The hotel staff obviously sprayed the halls (and maybe rooms) regularly with air freshener, which is disgusting in itself and only makes things worse. Anyone who is healthy and doesn't want to smell smoke also would not want to breath chemical air freshener. It made me feel asthmatic, and I don't have asthma. I learned to cover my mouth and nose with my fleece while I walked in the hallways. Also, the in-room movie (and TV) selection was so poor and sub-standard that it ruined an enjoyable aspect of traveling with my family that we have enjoyed in ANY hotel we've stayed in, even in much cheaper hotels. We had only about 10 awful movies to choose from, none we'd want to watch (although the hotel made sure there was enough porno available!). At almost any other hotel, you get a far superior type of film rental service (it's usually the same service in all hotels), with tons of selections and variety. When I clicked on each movie category at the Colonnade, it came up with the same awful 10 movies. And, when I complained to the front desk, they told me, as did the TV technician, that there was something wrong with the TV in our room, that we should have a lot more movies listed, and that they would fix it. Then, the next night, the same movies appeared. When I complained again, they told me that those were all the hotel's service offered, there was nothing wrong with the TV. So, I was given misinformation the previous night. We were visiting colleges for my son in the pouring rain, and at the end of several very long days and evening activities, we looked forward to settling down and watching a movie, and because of the sub-standard system that the Colonnade has chosen, we couldn't. We spent way too much time trying to wade through the misinformation to try to solve thisâ€”all to no availâ€”and I resented the waste of my traveling time. I would have preferred a straight answer and less time spent on the issue. And, to top it off, the hotel made no effort to credit us with anything to make it up to us. I don't like to ask for credits, so I let it go, but the hotel staff was wrongâ€”and foolishâ€”not to try to make it up to us in some way with some kind of credit. The hotel is beautifully designed and comfortable, in a great neighborhood, and has a lot of great characteristics, but the smoke/gross air freshener and entertainment deficits really cheapen this hotel experience for the traveler. If not for these issues, we'd return to the Colonnade.

Reviews.Title: “very comfy and nice”
Reviews.Author: Squeak65
Reviews.Content: We only spent one night, but it was delightful. Our king size bedded room on the top floor overlooking the south end of Boston seemed very newly decorated. Everything about it was comfortable and clean. The service that we had was friendly and nice. We took advantage of a spring special so it wasn't even expensive compared to nearly hotels. The Colonnade is in a great location in the Back Bay with easy access to shops and restaurants and the subway to all other parts of the city is right out the front door.

Reviews.Title: “I loved the service and the swanky decor.”
Reviews.Author: ErnieandBert1
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with the service. My son had an audition at New England Conservatory. It was our first time in Boston.We felt so welcome when Norman opened the door of the taxi and greeted us. He knew our names and that we were traveling from Pittsburgh.Albert helped us with our luggage and was very friendly . He showed us the amenities and gave me a rubber duckiie and then made sure my son got one later. Norman and Albert showed interest in my son's audition and also gave him some encouraging words. If my son goes to school in Boston, I will definitely stay at the Colonnade again.

Reviews.Title: “Our Oasis in the City ... Affordable Luxury ...”
Reviews.Author: 4-star-traveler1952
Reviews.Content: My wife and I like 4-star hotels and the Colonnade fits us in every way. We like to come into the City some weekends to escape our normal life. On this trip we did have a temporary inconvenience when my wife noticed that the rug was not spotless but we have never been moved to a second room so fast in our lives and #2 was indeed spotless. The view ! top floor with wall to wall glass looking straight down a busy street. The bed! so many pillows draw you in, then you find out that it is as comfortable as it looks. The thoughtfulness! Someone quietly slipped a note under our door with extras like free breakfast. The staff! Friendly but not fawning, attentive but not in your face. I can only imagine the full experience in late Spring when the rooftop pool opens. We want to return then to once again restore our souls in this urban oasis.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful staff made our stay a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: NUParent
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Colonnade on numerous occasions and have never been disappointed. The saff consistently go out of their way to be friendly and helpful, the rooms are always clean, nicely decorated and comfortable, and the location cannot be beat. The T-stop is right out front, the doorman will always get a cab for you, and there are a ton of places to shop and eat all within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, perfect hotel, outstanding staff.”
Reviews.Author: champptg
Reviews.Content: We had never been to Boston before; however, my twin girls are both interested in Boston Universities. The Cononnade hotel was the closest hotel to the 2 colleges we were looking at so I chose it. The 1 bedroom suite was so roomy for the four of us. The living room was very spacious with a pullout bed and a separate bathroom. My husband and I had our own bedroom and bathroom. We really like new and modern and this place fit our needs. The staff was outstanding. Everyone was so friendly and helpful. Each time we returned to our hotel their the staff was there to greet us. They couldn't have been more helpful. I must say that I have never had faster room service. I received our food within 15 minutes of ordering. I am used to waiting an hour for room service. We ordered breakfast 3 times and each time it was delivered fresh ,hot, and quick. If my girls go to school in Boston, I will always stay here. Having the mall directly across the street was also a bonus. The shopping was excellent as well as the variety of restaurants that we ate at. I hope to return to the Colannade.

Reviews.Title: “Overall the service exceeded my expectations.”
Reviews.Author: cjpGreatNorthWoods
Reviews.Content: The room service was consistently the quickest I ever experienced anywhere, which is very important after a long day of travel. The order was accurate, hot and accompanied by all the appropiate condiments. The rooms are clean with a nice view on the city side. I would recommend to stay on a higher floor if you are on the city side since it is a main street. It is quiet at night, but the buses are out early in the a.m. The beds were clean and comfortable. Plenty of towels and wash cloths are available in each of the rooms without having to ask for extra. The bathrooms are modern and the water pressure is excellent!!! While I have stayed there for a month of consecutive weeks (M-F), I found the staff to be very accommodating when I had a specific room request. The manager and front desk associates were very attentive to my needs when there was a temporary TV outage due to a storm. There is a DVD player in each of the rooms in addition to the many stations and movie selections on the large, flat screen televisions. This is particularly convenient for me to bring along my exercise tapes. Speaking of exercise, the fitness center is excellent...very, very clean, well stocked with at least 5 treadmills, 3 or 4 eliptical, a couple of stationary bikes and a couple of stairmasters. Each time I went to the fitness center, early in the a.m., there were always plenty of cardio machines available. They offer towels, fruit and reading material and plenty of tv's. The only drawback is that it does not open until 6:00 a.m. I would prefer a 5:00 opening so that I can get to work by 7. The hotel was quiet on each of my stays. Being just a short short block from the Copley Plaza, I could take a very short walk to be in the middle of the restaurants and activity, yet come back to the quiet of the hotel. I will certainly be staying there again when my business brings me back to the Back Bay area of Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Horrid Front Desk Staff”
Reviews.Author: BaltimoreRunner
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a trip to Boston and a two-night stay at the Colonnade. The Colonnade's website promises "large rooms," but not mine. I was right next to the elevator with a large chunk cut out of my room to make room for the elevator shaft. The room was both small and noisy. When I checked in, I asked if a room with a couch were available, and I offered to pay extra to get a large room with a couch. I was told no such rooms were available (I subsequently learned they indeed were available for the nights I was there--just not to me). I asked for a room on a high floor, away from any noise. I was put on one of the lowest floors, in an area where everyone had to walk by to get to their large rooms with couches. It was as if the young woman checking me were trying to thwart me in every way possible. The door to my bathroom was broken (no handle, no lock). Was I treated the way I was because I was a middle aged woman? I have no idea, but I am used to being treated well in hotels, so I will never return to the Colonnade and hope no one else will either. In fact, the only pleasure I had at the Colonnade (lying awake listening to the noise from the elevator) was writing this review in my head. The adjacent restaurant, though, is lovely. I recommend you stay elsewhere (anywhere else) and eat breakfast or lunch at the Colonnade's lovely French bistro. The very French manager came over to my table to talk about restaurants we had both enjoyed in Alsace. HE knew how to make a patron feel good.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: On-Behalf-Of-Guest
Reviews.Content: We always enjoy staying at the Colonnade Hotel since we feel that it is a very well managed and well cared for independent hotel. All of the staff people we have encountered - the bellmen, housekeeping, front desk people, restaurant staff are friendly, kind and helpful. They always seem to go out of their way to assure us that we will enjoy a wonderful stay and we appreciate that. That is why we always return to the Colonnade Hotel whenever we plan an overnight or two to Boston. Plus the location is wonderful for walking to Symphony Hall or the MFA. Thank you to everyone at the Colonnade Hotel and we look forward to our next stay with you!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations BY FAR!!!”
Reviews.Author: RhodeIslandmama2244
Reviews.Content: Clean, luxurious, great service, convenient location, lots of extras. I really couldn't come up with a single complaint. Will DEFINITELY stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: bgsmaine
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the colannade. The room was very comfortable and the dinner was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Another fabulous stay at the Colonnade!”
Reviews.Author: Sesame99
Reviews.Content: As always a quality stay- gracious service and terrific well-appointed rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Newly refurbished - and very nice!”
Reviews.Author: triptraveller
Reviews.Content: If you may have stayed at the Colonnade a while back (as I had), the newly refurbished property and full amenities will be a pleasant and positive surprise !
