Service at check-in is exceptionally efficient. Rooms and bath are well-equipped -- and everything is in excellent order. The on-site restaurant, Brasserie Jo, is a terrific French bistro. Excellent food - and wine list. Colonnade is a great choice for Boston !

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: Tofan53
Reviews.Content: Not knowing exactly where the Colonnade was located, we were extremely pleased to find it right across the street from Copley Plaza, and with an entrance to the subway right outside the front door. The rooms are efficiently equipped with work space and bright lights. Beds are very comfortable and the 37" flat-screenTVs are great! The staff at the hotel was very helpful, and as a Preferred Hotel member, all the amenities were provided with no problem. Workout facilities are generously equipped. The doorman was always available to call for a cab (which are lined up outside), thus, there was no wasted time. We will definitely choose The Colonnade again.

Reviews.Title: “Boston Symphony and The Colonnade - a perfect pair!”
Reviews.Author: peach30
Reviews.Content: We have recently had the priviledge of discovering Boston's gem of a hotel - The Colonnade. Having a 3-series of Boston Symphony tickets this year has inspired us to take advantage of staying in the city (we live an hour away in New Hampshire). When The Colonnade was recommended as being close to Symphony Hall, near fabulous restaurants and shops, in a beautiful part of town, with handsomely decorated rooms, and a first class restaurant on the premise (Brasserie Jo's, the only French bistro in Boston). and in-house parking - well, that sealed the deal!! We will be making our 3rd trip to The Colonnade this month - for another most enjoyable experience at the BSO and the hotel, thanks to the remarkable staff members - from curbsite to check-in to room service to concierge to housekeeping to reservations - everyone was so courteous and friendly and helpful. We give The Colonnade our highest recommendation and will spread the word up here in New Hampshire!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and environment”
Reviews.Author: Jimbo923
Reviews.Content: From the minute we walker through the door we received a warm welcome on a cold, windy night in Boston. The room was small, but the furnishings were contemporary, the beds great and the bathroom more than adequate. I would recommend staying here and I would do so again. Great weekend value too!

Reviews.Title: “Courteous staff, comfortable rooms, and great location.”
Reviews.Author: lucindaq
Reviews.Content: My husband and I first stayed here for our wedding weekend and enjoyed it so much we returned for our first anniversary. The rooms are spacious, clean, and very comfortable--ditto the bathrooms. The staff are polite, courteous, a thoughtful--we even received a fruit and cheese plate in honor of our anniversary. We also love the location--within walking distance to Back Bay and the South End--both great walking neighborhoods. And the T is right out front if you're going further afield.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Brilliant Location”
Reviews.Author: Alexis1977
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. The rooms were cleaned everyday, fresh towels left every day. The staff were so friendly and very helpful. The location is excellent, right opposite Copley, and just a 10 minute walk to Newbury street (where you'll find all designer wear etc), and Boylston Street. There is a brilliant shopping outlet, Wrentham Village Outlet, just an hours bus trip from hotel which i would definitely recommend - and you need to spend the whole day there as it's massive!!!! And right across the street is The Cheesecake Factory - excellent food!!!! And always remember to tip!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: TravellerJ31
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights and were very sad to go! The room was large and the king-size bed was very comfortable and so large you could easily get lost in it, with scatter cushions so full of feathers I could hardly lift them! The room was really clean, the staff couldn't have been more helpful and the hotel is in a really good location, close to the major shopping district of Boston. Breakfast was a little pricey ($50 for coffee, juice and pancakes with sides!) but to be fair, the pancakes were amazingly fluffy and the portions were huge so we didn't need lunch that day! The coffee is never ending, although mine did get stronger as breakfast went on because the waiter was so attentive he barely left room in the cup to add more milk! I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “So many good things to say”
Reviews.Author: siggy26
Reviews.Content: We arrived at The Colonnade on December 30th and even with two separate reservations (one booked for one night, the other for two) check-in took just a few minutes. The front desk staff was friendly, helpful and continuely asked if there was anything they could help us with. (and the lobby ... very, very spacious and quite beautiful) We had a fifth floor room with two double beds, and even though it was on the smaller side for three people, it was really clean, decorated in warm, soothing colors and with a great view of Huntingdon Ave. The water pressure in the shower was amazing and the room also had a digitial temp control (most hotels lock them, but not The Colonnade. Obviously, the comfort of their guests is important :) They also left us a welcome tray with cheese, crackers, fruit and sparkling water. Tucked between the two glasses was a welcome note from the Vice President. Great little touch that made us all smile. The Colonnade is in a great spot. It's just a few minutes walk to Fenway Park, Boston Commons, etc. We stayed for The NHL Winter Classic and didn't need to take a cab or train too many places (though the subway had a red line stop right across the street). There's also a ridiculous amount of shopping places nearby, including the Prudential Center. The day we went to check out, we arrived back at the parking garage to find our car wouldn't start. We went back to the lobby and told the concierge, who immediately stepped in to assist. He called the engineer on duty and in no time, they had jump started our car. Then, the concierge insisted he would lead us to the nearest gas station, where he proceeded to pump our gas and offer directions back to the MA Turnpike. We were floored! This gentleman went out of his way in the middle of a snowstorm not only to assist us, but to make sure we got where we needed to go. We couldn't thank him enough for the assistance, nor have we ever experienced such a personal touch at another hotel. We'd definitely go back to The Colonnade, and woould certainly recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Charleen1022
Reviews.Content: I read a bunch of reviews before booking this hotel. Let me just say, this was one of the best hotels I've stayed at. The T stop was right outside of the hotel, Prudential Center was across the street, and Newbury was a couple blocks away. The majority of hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful in planning our day. The beds were so comfortable!! The doorbell outside of the room was also a very nice additional. This will definitely be my go to hotel when I return to Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: opsmama
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Colonnade for an anniversary getaway, and it was everything we hoped it would be. The hotel has undergone a massive renovation, and everything is now brand new and beautiful. The location is superb as you are directly across the street from the Prudential Center mall and T station. You are also about two blocks away from Copley Place. We would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service and great comfort”
Reviews.Author: PhillyWanderers
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business overlaid with some leisure. Hotel staff could not have been more gracious and accommodating. Room service and food quality was excellent. Concierge very helpful. Front desk totally accommodating when I needed to split bill between my business credit card and personal credit card. Bed and pillows were luxurious. Quiet rooms enabled great night's sleep. Room clean, comfortable, sleek simple design. I like their green policy, too. Towels fluffy and very ample. Internet access was a little expensive at $14/day. Excellent location near the Amtrak station, Copley Square, restaurants, shopping, museums and symphony can't be beat. All in easy walking distance. Great value for the price. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and views, on the small side”
Reviews.Author: MelissaW1
Reviews.Content: Staff was great, as was the view, the decor and location. The room was on the small side but not uncomfortably so. The bathroom on the other hand was VERY small. Overall though a great place to stay - I would even stay with children. And you can't beat that room service includes milk and cookies with all lunches and dinners!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and average hotel”
Reviews.Author: onlycala
Reviews.Content: Location is great, across from Prudential center mall and metro station. Room is clean and decent. There is one on-site restaurant but there are many better priced choices in walkable distance. Swimming pool is outdoor so it was too cold to swim. The pool is small but there's a bar next to it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service with a Cool Room”
Reviews.Author: M3mb3r
Reviews.Content: I can't tell you how much my husband and I enjoyed our stay. It was a first class experience. I am in Boston regularly for health reasons and decided to treat myself with a stay at the Colonnade this time. Loved the room decor, great linens on the bed, showerhead/pressure was awesome, robes long and comfy. Staff was accommodating and professional at every turn. Our room 1105 felt a bit small, but for the rate we had we felt it was still an excellent value. Superb location as well. I hope we are able to stay there again. They made 24 hours feel like a long weekend and brought a cozy relaxation to a time that is often stressful (this time the hospital part of the trip was just a blip on the screen!).

Reviews.Title: “No heat or A/C??? No TV??? No thanks!”
Reviews.Author: NEUMom
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed with our 3 night stay. While the first night was fine, we noticed the room temperature rising to very uncomfortable levels during the remainder of our stay. The morning we left I awoke at 2AM feeling as if I was in a sauna. After digging out a flash light and tinkering with the thermostat, there was no improvement. After showering in the morning and sweating while dressing and packing to leave, I inquired at the front desk. The response was unexpected: They had turned off the A/C in the building in preparation for turning on the heat...a process that requires the entire heating/cooling system to be off for a two day period. AND...even though the Boston weather was unexpectedly warm during our stay, it would have taken them two days to turn the A/C system back on. They did offer to bring up a fan and suggested we open a window, which we had already done. We declined the fan and the window offered no improvement. The room was extremely uncomfortable by the time we checked out. We estimated the temperature was approaching 80 degrees. We chatted up a couple in the elevator and we were going to check-out and discovered they were experiencing the same problem. In addition, but of much less importance, the television was also unavailable for several hours on Saturday. Upon check-out, the desk clerk asked if everything was okay during our stay and upon hearing our response simply said, "I'm sorry." While the location was excellent and the room was nicely decorated, we will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Old-style luxury, but with rooms that are modern, airy, and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: sontjones
Reviews.Content: Our family loved this hotel. It had the feel of a nice big-city hotel in the lobby without too much opulence, but what a surprise when we entered our sleek yet cozy, thoroughly modern room. I don't know where the reviewers that called the rooms small have been staying, but we thought the rooms were extremely roomy for a big city hotel. The light fixtures, furniture, bathroom fixtures were beautiful and so functional. The floor to ceiling windows looked out on Huntington Avenue, great view from our 11th floor room. The subway stop is literally out the front door. Great inroom coffee, nice toiletries. The wifi is expensive, as is the parking, but we got a good special rate on the room. The staff were not overly friendly, but helpful when called upon. We thought this was a great find and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy”
Reviews.Author: dahlia8
Reviews.Content: Very quaint hotel. Central and within walking distance to many of the attractions and shops. Staff is very friendly but be very specific that you want walking directions otherwise you'll get driving directions. Our room was on the 11th floor and had a gorgeous view of the city. The room was comfortable and clean. The bathroom was a bit small. Parking is expensive. Make sure you pay for parking along with your room so you don't have to look for the machines.

Reviews.Title: “A model for other hotels, big and small.”
Reviews.Author: malthecook
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Colonnade Hotel in Boston. The hotel was beautiful as well as charming. I was amazed at the individual attention they gave to their guests. The room was spotless and very comfortable and had floor to ceiling windows. It was equiped with modern conveniences and the location was great. The food in the restaurant was amazing and we had a wonderful dining experience. We had use of the fitness room and we were surprised to learn the hotel also had a roof top pool. This hotel is truly a hidden jewel and I would recommend it to everyone, whether for business or leisure. Great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Central, refurbished and right on the underground”
Reviews.Author: glensy
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpful staff, room very large and comfortable with huge bed and mountains of pillows. Lifts take forever to arrive, but once you are downstairs it's only a short stroll to shopping mall and restaurants. Conceirge recommends taking the trolley tour but unless you are unable to walk or are elderly, I wouldn't. Take the metro - i'ts so cheap or get a map and walk. Also the Hotel does recommends taking a taxi from the airport (around $60)- this is very expensive and the metro stop is 10 metres from the front of the hotel and is amazingly frequent and very cheap (aound $2). The hotel was expensive if you are not a business traveller but as we only had two nights in Boston it was an acceptable splurge.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: oldenglishd
Reviews.Content: Contacted the hotel a couple weeks prior and requested a room at the top story with a view. Thought i would give it a try - the worst thing that could happen is that they would say they couldn't accommodate that. Arrived at the hotel and was given a room in the middle of the top story with a view of the Prudential Center! Everyone in the hotel was very helpful. The concierge was really helpful when they were there - but the front desk was amazingly helpful and courteous. The rooms were amazing. Modern fixtures, nice tv, amazing beds, and a very cool stylish bathroom. The hotel is in a great location for Red Sox games, Duck Tours, Prudential Center, and everything Boston. An unbelievable hotel and will definitely want to stay there again. There is only one thing that I could complain about and that is the thin walls - you could hear the people next door if they were even the little bit loud. Oh yeah, and they had an amazing fitness center and a rooftop pool. Make sure you sign up for the iPrefer membership - a free membership that will give you free internet!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: HBarber
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great choice for a couple visiting the city. It is in a perfect location to dining, the T stop, duck tours, and other attractions. The Concierge was incredibly helpful with all of our requests and questions. Rooms are updated and clean.

Reviews.Title: “great and not so great”
Reviews.Author: chase92852
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights. Rooms are well appointed. They get a lot of european travelers and these rooms tend to reflect that look. They are small as are most rooms in boston, NY and San Fran. It is in a good central location as you will only get 2 blocks closer to the prime areas for another 100 or more a night. The T station is within 50 feet of the front door. I say great and not so great as it really depends on the staff thats working that night. If you get Thomas (the concierge) and Mathew the bellboy you will have a great experience. Cindy the the other concierge is the muffy buffy type that acts like she is above it all. Room service was excellent and the hotel restaurant is good if not a little pricey for what you get,

Reviews.Title: “Great pool”
Reviews.Author: calired81
Reviews.Content: I head to Boston regularly for business, and I've found the Colonnade is perfect. Their rooftop pool saved me this summer - great spot to decompress after meetings. And, it makes the time away from my family feel like a little vaca.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Experience”
Reviews.Author: shy0318
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at The Colonnade Hotel to assist a VIP client that had never been to Boston before. Being originally from Boston, I have nothing but good comments to make about this hotel. However, I would like to speak on behalf of my client, who not only felt so welcome at the hotel that he extended his stay by 2 nights, but he also highly completemented the hotel's service and ammenities as well as the food at Brasserie Jo. We were both obsessed with the mussels after trying them and also the delicious and unforgettable onion soup. My client experienced the comfort he was looking for calling the hotel rooms "peaceful and very functional". Being a business hotel, The Colonnade has been known for its features in accomodating business travelers as well as regular visitors. The coffee maker, the alarm clock/ Ipod player, and the bedside reading lamps were all features that really caught my attention and that we both benefitted from. These cool gadgets really made these rooms stand out from other hotel rooms where I've stayed. I can also add to my experience the incredible attentiveness of the hotel staff and how everybody seems to remember exactly who you are- I loved that! So for those of you Boston travelers out there, I would highly recommend the Colonnade Hotel as your top options when choosing a hotel and if you get a chance to come by during the summer, you should definitely enjoy its rooftop pool and if you're lucky, you might even find some celebrities up there, just as I did!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, large friendly rooms”
Reviews.Author: arrotripadvise
Reviews.Content: All around excellent hotel, I've stayed at Marriot Copley and Long Wharf as well as Radisson Boston and Cambridge, and this is by far the best one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - OK Hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: AmbriaK
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel can't be beat. We loved being so close to the subway, shopping, grocery, restaurants, etc. The staff at the hotel were not all that attentive or friendly. The person that checked us in was the only person that was pleasant to us during our entire stay (she was great). The rooms were somewhat small but very modern and obviously recently redone. They somehow though missed a few updates in the bathroom (floor and bath tub) and it is quite small. We had a corner king room on the 7th floor with fantastic views and windows that actually open which was great. We brought a small fan with us which cancelled out any outside noise we might have heard. They really need to do an overhaul on the lobby area and in particular the badly stained carpet at the entrance to the elevators. The lobby is pretty basic but clean and the furniture looks fairly new. The elevators are also in need of some attention to the wear and tear on the paint and carpet. Our rate came with a free breakfast at Brassiere Jo's and it was GREAT. We looked forward each morning to eating our breakfast there before starting the day. We were disappointed that you can't go up to the rooftop area when the pool is closed for the season. We would have loved to just sat and talked and enjoyed the evening air. We were able to get a late checkout with no problems which was a real plus for us. This hotel seems to stay fairly booked up so early check in and out is probably not something they are able to offer on a daily basis. We wanted to extend our stay by one night but they wanted to charge us an extra 100.00 per night which far exceeded the price showing on their own website so we opted to move to Cambridge as planned. Overall after looking around at some of the other hotels in the area, I think we did OK. We got a GREAT rate on Travelzoo and had I not happend up on their 3 day special we would never have stayed here. Thanks TravelZoo and Hotel Colonnade.

Reviews.Title: “Too Hip For Its Own Good”
Reviews.Author: MalibuMike
Reviews.Content: Never been to Boston before so stayed here because it was the best 4 star hotel on Hotwire. Copley Square is an okay location if you want to shop all day at the mega-mall across the street but next time I'd like to be a little more centrally located. The hotel sees itself as a chic, modern boutique. The staff was nice but the rooms were designed to be stylish -- not practical. Took me too long to figure out the ultra-modern faucets in tub/shower and the lighting was not user-friendly. The beds are super comfortable but they are stacked up with all these oversized peoples that you have to throw on the floor before you can lie down. I thought $14 for using their Wi-Fi and $5 for five minutes on their business center computers was pretty pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Londoner's bound for Boston”
Reviews.Author: Squires560
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, the service was excellent the staff very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and professional staff, good location,clean and comfortable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Housewives
Reviews.Content: Read reviews of this hotel,only a couple of bad ones and those guests must be very unlucky or like to moan. My friend and I, are well travelled and have stayed in various hotels of various star ratings and keep an open mind. We were not disappointed with this hotel. The following named persons, made our stay more pleasurable but all credit given to the rest of the staff who were friendly and professional. Jimmy the doorman greeted us in a professional manner with a sense of humour. We cannot speak highly enough of Norman who also greets you in a professional manner. Every day he asked if our stay was okay and if we needed anything. We observed him running after guide buses for other guests and going that extra mile, a true ambassador for the hotel. Cindy the concierge who knows her job inside out and could not be more professional and helpful. She purchased tickets for a Red Sox game on the day of play, at very reasonable cost. Any hotel would be proud to have her as front of staff. Reception staff checked us in quickly. Our room was in the front on 11th floor with views to plaza and prudential building. A fairly good room size, enough space for 2 people. The beds were extremely comfortable. En suite facilities as expected standard. The onlt 2 comments, were that air extractor did not come on when using shower.The usual British thing, we could not make a cup of tea with our teabags due to no kettle but there was a machine to make hot bevarages with their supplies.None of these comments were a problem. The subway right outside front door for green line and taxis available. Did not use hotel brasserie, only for the reason that we wanted to check out other eateries. Reccommend Thorntons for cooked breakfast which is just across the street/block. This is not a restaurant but a cafe, which is very cheap and good food, people were queing to get in at breakfast. But the real gem was Quotes cafe in the Mary Baker Eddy library run by Melissa and her friendly staff. Only opened Monday to Friday 8am - 3pm daily specials, lunch menu and light breakfasts available.Everything fresh and of good quality.

Reviews.Title: “The Red Sox and The Colonnade, doesn't get any better than that!!”
Reviews.Author: golfguyigc
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at The Colonnade Hotel in the Back Bay area. We had a blast with my l4 year old son and two of his buddies. We loved the new renovations of the hotel; sharp and contemporary. The roof top swimming pool is amazing and is a very cool place to just hang out, and they have great and friendly staff and top shelf cocktails by the pool!! We will make this a monthly event and it's within walking distance of Fenway Park, a huge bonus considering the parking headaches at the park!! We enjoyed terrific room service after the game, a superior experience compared to their competitors across the street!! Treat yourself to a first class experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the pillows!!”
Reviews.Author: trustypoo
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Boston. Our main reason for going was to see Fenway Park. The hotel was in a great area of Boston. Everyone working there went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. Joe, at the front lobby, was by far the greatest help to us. He was a wealth of information. He knew the best way to get around and some of the best places to eat. The room was very clean and comfortable. The bed was amazing. We had the best sleep ever. I would highly recommend this hotel if planning a trip to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Staff are not professional”
Reviews.Author: WizardOfChemistry
Reviews.Content: Myself and 4 friends made a trip to Boston last summer. During our stay at the Colonnade, we were treated unprofessionally by all staff. We were on vacation so we were wearing just casual clothing. Everytime we returned to the hotel after enjoying the sights of Boston, we were stopped by the doorman and asked for IDs. According to him, only people on business stay at this hotel and they are always dressed in suits or blouses. We just wanted to be dressed comfortably. We wanted to go eat at the restaurant at the hotel, but were informed it was closed to guests and the general public for a wedding reception. I will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best friend and myself”
Reviews.Author: BhuddaTampa_Fl
Reviews.Content: We spent a night at the Colonnade which allowed us to catch up with our lives as we live over a 1000 miles apart. One night but two days in Boston seeing the sites and walking around. On arrival we checked into a super room on the 6th floor. All the amenities you would want and some you didn't realize you would enjoy. A fantastic room, looked like we were the first persons to use it. Loved the large screen TV's in living room and bedroom. Towels galore with bathrobes. Felt like we were dignataries. A well trained staff was always pleasant, waiters were attentive without being annoying. Food at Brasserie Joe's was excellent, I had Escargot appetizer and Profiteroles for dessert My steak was done as requested and was extremely tender. Breakfast was also superb. My friend and I had 2 days of fun, siteseeing etc. mainly in the North End. Getting a taxi was quick and easy by the staff. We even left our luggage for the second day and it was given to us quickly when we returned late afternoon. The location could not be better. Once you stay there it will be your only choice while in Boston. Saw the rooftop pool where I was told concerts and functions take place. I have travelled the world and the Colonnade rivals the best hotels in Europe and Asia as to amenities, staff, service and location.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: gobsus
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Colonnade numerous times over the past several years and All of our visits have been just delightful. The new rooms are gorgeous, with the most comfortable mattresses(in fact we tried to get one for our home), soft linens and warm duvets. Beautiful baths with great powerful showers. We are both neat and clean freaks and the Colonnade definitely lives up to our high standards in both areas. We have found the entire staff; from the doormen -to the waitstaff- to the front desk personnel- to the general manager- just incredibly kind and accomodating and professional. They all remember our names and we theirs as they make that kind of impression. They always make us feel that it is our home away from home. The location is super as you can walk to Fenway, the South End, the Prudential, Newbury St., Copley Plaza, the park, the theaters and all the great restaurants in Boston. Being in the restaurant business ourselves, we can be quite particular about where we eat. One of the greatest places in Boston is right at the Colonnade, Brasserie Jo...they have the best steak au poivre anywhere!!!!! We live on the Cape, but like to sneak away once a summer to enjoy their fabulous roof-top pool. I believe it is the only one in the city. It is just an all-round great hotel; clean and modern chic; friendliest of staff and fabulous location and food....wish they had a place like that everywhere we travel!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Colonnade....Bad Service.....They don't care”
Reviews.Author: hens500
Reviews.Content: Took the family to Boston for a 5 day get away reserving 2 rooms. 2 poor customer service issues that I think reflect poorly on the service for the hotel. 1. Checked in at 5pm. Only 1 room was ready and was told the other room would be ready by 5:30. Decided to go to dinner and get into the second room later. Came back at 7:30 and was told the 2nd room was stillnot ready but would be by 8pm. 8pm came and went and no room. Was told 8:30. Guess what, at 9pm the room was still not ready. When asking the front desk for help and information why the delay, they made me feel like I was intruding. I'm a reasonable person, but to not be able to check in until after 10pm is ridiculous, but even worse is the snooty attitude of the front desk. 2. On the Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday of my stay, every morning at 7 am, heavy equipment (almost like a concrete jack hammer) began drilling above my room. When I inquired into the cause, I was told tough luck, we have to complete our work. Now again, I am a reasonable person, but I am on vacation, paying over $200 dollars a night and too be woken up at 7am on vacation is unexcusable. Start your work after 9, alert your guests, or send them to another room that won't be disturbed. I left the Colonnade very disappointed with the service and more importantly the attitude. I spent a lot of money for this location and the hotel could not have been more rude to me as a guest.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful spacious rooms in the Back Bay with some pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: nutstarr02
Reviews.Content: Got a package deal so I wanted to try out the new Colonnade Hotel in the Back Bay. Loved the spacious rooms with luxurious beds and flat-screen TVs. The rooftop pool bar was nice, but nothing really special. I wasn't very impressed. Here's a list of pros and cons for me. PROS: - Location is prime (across the street from the Prudential center and walking distance to Newbury Street, Boston Public Garden, Boston Commons) and close to T stops - Spacious rooms - Comfortable beds (too many pillows for my taste though) - Flat-screen TVs - Mini bar refrigerator in room - Robes provided - The bellhop - wonderful gentleman who has been working at the hotel for years and was a real pleasure - If you valet your car, you can leave it parked until 2 PM (I guess other people were told 3 PM) - Roof-top pool and bar - Brasserie Jo is adjoined for food and drinks CONS: - Less than friendly staff on check-in - Walls are paper-thin (I could hear it when the person in the neighboring room was using the bathroom) - Our toilet ran intermittently all night (to the hotel's credit, we did not inform them about it during our stay) - If you want to valet park your car, don't pull up in front of the hotel, it's actually ahead to the right up in a lot - Parking is expensive - Valet does not operate 24 hours a day - When we asked for a mini-bar key, the staff told us it would be awhile because they had to "look for one" and they weren't sure they had any left (strange for an upscale hotel) - Unable to accomodate our request for late check-out In conclusion, the location and rooms are wonderful. Would stay here again especially if I was able to get a deal again.

Reviews.Title: “Whenever I visit Boston, it's the Colonnade that completes my experience!”
Reviews.Author: demiluneStateside
Reviews.Content: Right from the start, Jimmy the Bellman, greeted me with his welcoming smile and "pleasantries". Then Matt from Guest Services followed up on my entire stay, to ensure all my personal needs were being met-- not to mention his entire Polite and Competent Housekeeping Staff. Whenever we want to visit Boston's great sights and sample different tastes, we can easily get to them & then back to the Colonnade to unwind at their own terrific restaurant -- Brasserie Jo's and swim in their unique rooftop pool. For my guests and myself , no visit to Boston is complete without staying at the Colonnade. You'll hear the travel ads say, 'You have got to try the Boston Experience'. What they really mean is, "You must try the "BOSTON - COLONNADE EXPERIENCE!"

Reviews.Title: “Stylish luxury in a perfect spot”
Reviews.Author: adafitz
Reviews.Content: Can only add that the place was geared up for everything we needed.Bed and bedding were really comfy .Room was spacious and as our first stop on our month long tour in USA, it set the standard and was not beaten. Loved the experience of breakfast at Charlie`s Sandwich shop . Norman the Doorman was a brilliant help to us and if his management are reading this -he really deserves praise as he went well beyond the service normally given . Anyone who moans about this place needs to get a life .Loved Boston as did our kids and can not recommend this hotel more highly .

Reviews.Title: “Just great”
Reviews.Author: shoesandkittens
Reviews.Content: What a lovely place. The location was great, the staff were helpful and the room was clean and modern. Some may find the room, and particulary the bathroon, a little small by USA standards; we found it adequate for us (2 adults and one teenage daughter). The roof pool was great and the fact that we were allowed to us, for a few hours after we checked out - and that our valet parking was also valid up to 3pm on checkout day - was fantastic. It was a bit pricier than the hotel we stayed in the weekend before but I think worth it. A bit of advice - join the 'I Prefer' scheme before booking to get free internet access

Reviews.Title: “Terrific experience!”
Reviews.Author: jenncha
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Colonnade Hotel for one night only, but the staff at the hotel made it a very memorable stay! From the moment we checked in, every question we had was answered, and every need addressed. The roofdeck pool was easily the highlight of the stay - clean, plenty of seating, delicious drinks. Not to mention an amazing view of Boston all around us. After a run the next morning, as we walked back into the Hotel, the bellhop asked if we had just finished a run. After answering yes, we were greeted with towels and bottles of water. Fantastic and unexpected! It's those small touches that made our stay so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “A great centrally located hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: viator5
Reviews.Content: We learned about a special summer deal ($200 off the regular price including breakfast) that the Colonnade was having via the internet. As it was our anniversary, we decided to stay for one night and attended Jersey Boys at the Shubert Theater. We arrived two hours before check-in time but because I had applied for an "i-prefer" card on-line the night before we had the special privilege of checking in early and also having a late check out. It also enabled us to free internet. The couple checking in before us wanted to check in early but were not allowed to with out the card. I had requested to be away from the elevators and on a high floor and that was gladly honored by the friendly receptionist. Our room was on the 10th floor facing up towards Fenway Park and we were at first concerned about city traffic noise, but we were not bothered by it in the least. The room itself was on the small size but the furniture (king bed included) were not too big for the space. The flat screen T.V. was mounted on the wall and there was also a wet bar. The bathroom was marble-tiled and very pretty and functional. There was a full-length mirror as well as a make-up mirror in the bathroom. A nice added touch were two cozy terry cloth bathrobes in the closet. The Do Not Disturb Sign and Clean Room sign were activated by a switch that lit up outside the door. There was even a door bell! The one down side to the room (1037) was that the door did not seal properly (it was off by almost an inch at the top) and that caused hall noise to be more pronounced inside the room. However, luckily we were at the end of the hall and did not get too much traffic coming by our room. Another great thing about the hotel is the roof-top pool and bar. The staff is friendly at the pool, especially the bartender, but it tends to get crowded during the afternoon and it's hard to get a chair. It also seems as though guests stake out a chair early morning by putting a towel on it and then will go off to breakfast, etc. and leave the chair empty for hours on end to eventually come back and use it. It would be more "guest friendly" if a member of the staff monitored this and kept chairs available to people who were actually at the pool!! It would also be helpful if the staff actually checked to make sure you were a paying guest to keep the crowd at the pool down as much as possible. In the morning we had the pleasure of dining at the hotel's French restaurant, Brasserie Jo. The breakfast was excellent. The only complaint was when I asked the waiter if there was a limit on ordering the complimentary breakfast he said "no, you can order as much as you like". When we checked out, we found out that wasn't quite true and were charged $6 extra for "going over the limit". There is also a $38 charge for parking. In closing I have to say that we had a great experience at this hotel. The staff is friendly and the accommodations were comfortable and clean The extra touches make it feel like a special stay. The location is superb as it is right near the T stop and right down the street from the best shopping in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Iluvtwins
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip to Boston. The Colonnade was a great hotel to stay in with a family. We had the Family Connection Package which included connecting rooms, breakfast, and tickets for the Duck tour. We loved the rooms. They were spacious and had all the bells and whistles. The bathrooms were small but worked well. We had a view of Fenway Stadium in the distance. The breakfast each morning was great. It included Full American breakfast or anything else that equaled it in price. We did not have to pay any additional money. The food was great too! We did the Duck tour and had a great time. Boston is a beautiful city and The Colonnade was the perfect hotel to stay in. We would love to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Wrap Yourself in Modern Comfort”
Reviews.Author: AIG1
Reviews.Content: From the moment the door to your room opens, you are greeted with a clean modern design of luxury. From the thick terry robes lying invitingly on the pristine bed linens to the thick, fluffy towels in the marble bathroom, you feel pampered. The mixture of leather and chrome are married perfectly into a utilitarian work space with both visual appeal and comfortable design. This room boasts all of the amenities expected from a five star hotel while providing a bit of whimsy with the rubber ducky on the tub. The large windows offering a great view of the middle of downtown Boston would lead you to think that you may have noises in the night but the silence that falls with the closing of windows along with a bed that wraps you in it's comfort, gives you a restful night's sleep. For your waking hours, the roof top pool area offers another outlet for indulgence. The service and welcoming personnel make you feel that you have come home and will ensure you a wonderful stay. We highly recommend the Colonnade Hotel for your next visit to Bean Town whether for business or pleasure; You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: xv0nsam9x
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had an absolutely amazing stay at the Colonnade. It was a short walk away from Fenway and right across from the Prudential Center, a perfect location. Parking was a little bit pricey, but what can you expect staying in the middle of Boston. The room was gorgeous and clean, and the bedding was so comfortable. I didn't make it up to the rooftop pool, but I will be sure to next time. I would defnitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very lovely with awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: amplexusomnium
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel we had a smooth check-in. We were celebrating our anniversary, we had a cake and champagne with us and the staff brought up plates and glasses literally after we dropped our bags in the room. The rooms were beautiful and contemporary with lots of texture. The bathroom was smaller than other 4 stars we've stayed at, but it did the job and the rubber ducky was a plus! Bistro Jo's downstairs has a great selection, but is a little pricey, but convenient. The only part of the hotel that I didn't like was the roof top pool. Both times we tried to go up there, there was a private function or the pool was closed. The one time we snuck in just to see and I feel that the pool area lacked compared to the luxury the rest of the hotel presents. Tips: Hotel charges $40 a night to park. There is parking that is a 2 minute walk at Patriot parking down the block for $10 a day...much cheaper for a long stay. -Metro right outside the hotel as well as lots of close restaurants and things to explore!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - good location”
Reviews.Author: RitaFinland
Reviews.Content: We spent one week with one teenager at this hotel (double luxe room) and really enjoyd our stay at this hotel. The room was rather big with two double beds and the coffeemaker was a pleasant surprise. I also enjoyed the bathtube and I can highly recommend this hotel for anyone. The gym was superb and really nice with fresh fruit and water! Our boy also enjoyed the pool on the roof and itÂ´s lovely that these facilities are free for hotel guests. An extra plus. I noticed that there were staff from different air companies using this cotel, that is usually a good sign. We didnÂ´t have breakfast at this hotel but we could have bought a breakfast package in advantage if someone had replied on my request wich I sent by email to the staff twice. How ewer, we had a pleasant week and if we return to Boston some day, this will be our accomodation again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, location and value in a 4 star property”
Reviews.Author: JamesOttawa_Canada
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Colonnade for 3 nights and would highly recommend this hotel. We made use of the family connections package which includes 2 connecting rooms, full American breakfast and tickets to Duck Boat Tour or New England Aquarium. We also signed up with the I-Prefer program (see Colonnade website) which doesn't really end up giving significant room upgrades if you are already on the connecting room package but does give you possibility of late checkout and no charge for wireless internet which saved us $40. It also gives early check-in but basically that is not likely if you come in on a weekend. The rooms were clean, well appointed and spacious. We asked for rooms overlooking Huntington Avenue on the front of the hotel but were assigned rooms on the back side of the hotel which overlooks a more residential brownstone area which would be quieter - I still think the front side is the preferred view for most. Some reviews had mentioned hall noise which I think arises partially because there is a bit of a gap between the bottom of the door and the floor - that can be mostly fixed by laying a towel along that gap to muffle any sound in the hallway. It would also be an easy problem for the hotel to fix by putting soundproofing along the bottom of the doors. There is a pool on the top of the building but don't go there if you are looking for a quiet drink and sunshine, there tended to be a lot of kids there which made it somewhat busy and noisy. The breakfast at the hotel was very good and service in the restaurant and at the bar was also very good. We found the staff to be extremely helpful whether it be the front desk, concierge, luggage service or restaurant staff. In terms of location the hotel is a short walk to the shops and restaurants on Boylston and Newbury or if you want to go to the old downtown area the subway stop is right outside the hotel. It is also about a 20-25 minute walk to Fenway Park. We would definitely return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great room - Worn out Corridors!”
Reviews.Author: ekofoed
Reviews.Content: The corridors at the Colonnade is worn out and should be refurnished. The rooms, however are ok and the bed is fantastic with superb pillows! If you want a great price go to www.gtahotels.com (!) We paid $150 / night. Tip: Go to Brasserie Jo's at the ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “Another perfect stay at The Colonnade”
Reviews.Author: ljr2219
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recentely attended a wedding in Wellesley Hills and a reception in Boston. I wanted to spend the night in the city and chose the Colonnade as we have always enjoyed the roof top pool and Brossierie Joe's food and espresso martinis. The room was spectacular and you could tell it was recently remodeled with all the of the latest technology, (Ipod player, flat screen TV, modern furniture and fixtures). I checked into the hotel before going to Wellesley Hills and was told the parking garage had valet parking in order to accomidate two weddings that were taking place. From the valet, to check in, and back out to my car to go to the wedding, my experience could not have gone any smoother or more pleasant. I couldn't believe when I checked in there were directions waiting at the fron desk to the church I had to go to. I had previously called the consierge Thomas to get an idea of the travel time from the hotel to my destination during that time of day, and he took it upon himself to have directions waiting for me. It has been my experience in prior stays at the Colonnade that the staff always seem to go above and beyond what you would expect in a normal hotel stay, this time was no exception. I would recomend this hotel, they truly know how to develop repeat customers, I will continue to be one. Robert Reynolds

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel with great location.”
Reviews.Author: Sabsters
Reviews.Content: We missed a connecting flight from Boston and checked into this hotel. What a pleasant surprise! The beds are huge and comfy and the decor is sleek and classy. It was going to be our wedding anniversary the next day, so we ordered room service that late night and the food was good. Very very big portions. The best part about this hotel is that its in a great location, just across the street from Prudential Building. You can buy from the hop on/ hop off bus ticket from the concierge. Just wait outside the hotel with the ticket in hand and the bus will stop to pick you up. They have a non-written agreement with the hotel due to long standing relations. Its very convenient. Cheesecake Factory was directly across the street and Copley Square was around the corner. There is a 7-eleven around the corner as well. We would go back there if we should visit Boston again.

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly Luxury”
Reviews.Author: rlslacker
Reviews.Content: My husband had to travel to Boston on business, so the kids and I decided to tag along so we could visit some family. I will tell you that being a family of 6 is tricky and/or very expensive when it comes to finding hotels. Most rooms max out at 4 and since our kids are still small, we need to have them in the same room or an adjoining room. I did a lot of searching and found the Colonnade boasted being family friendly, and they weren't kidding. I booked a family package that included adjoining king and double double rooms, breakfast for four, and four tickets to the Duck Tour or Science Museum and fanny packs for the kids for $399. I think this was a pretty good value, considering Duck Tour tickets are $30/adult $20/kids, so $100 there and breakfast (bacon, eggs, potatoes, toast, juice, coffee) was $17.00 if purchased from the hotel. Parking is typical city expensinve ($38 with in/out priveleges), but it's easily accessible and not so small you feel like your going to hit your minivan on the ceiling. The lobby is beautiful and the hotel staff is very friendly. The concierge was especially nice and helpful. They knew us all by name strictly from our reservation and were happy to provide any info we needed. The rooms were very nice, decent sized and we had a fabulous view from the 9th floor. The kids were thrilled with their very own plasma tv in their room and I loved the plush bed and the nice bathroom. The door between the rooms was in a convenient place and allowed good flow between the two rooms. There was very little noise between the rooms/hall, though I might not have heard anything over the typical din of my four kids. I had breakfast sent to our rooms as I didn't want to deal with the four kids in restaurant. There was a mix up with our order, I ordered four, received two, but they fixed it immediately without question. I wasn't overly thrilled with the food, the eggs were a bit to wet for my taste and the bacon chewy, but it was a hearty big breakfast they serve. The rooftop pool was a big hit with the kids, the deck was packed with 20-somethings and the pool is SMALL, but they had fun splashing around anyway. I would highly recommend this hotel for a family visiting Boston if you can swing it. It's great for kids and adults alike, I felt very spoiled here, but it never felt too upscale for the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have made a better choice!”
Reviews.Author: Lalynn21
Reviews.Content: Great location...we could walk most everywhere. Stayed for 8 days, and only took a cab twice. Subway stop right outside the door...trolley stop right across the street. The Prudential Center mall was across the street, and the Copley Square mall was at the corner. My only complaint was the down pillows...too soft! And the noise from the hall was a problem...the doors don't seem to screen out any hallway noises, and it worked both ways! We heard interesting things as we walked down to the elevators. Very interesting. We loved the fact that our windows opened to let in some nice cool, spring air. The staff was excellent, and the concierge was a jewel! Also, Norman the doorman was The Man!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Deal, Average Experience”
Reviews.Author: sbalch
Reviews.Content: Wife and I traveled with our 11 and 15 year old. Got connecting rooms as part of the "Family connection" package which included tickets to the Duck tour (worth it) and the Children Museum. Stayed two nights. Front desk and bell staff were very friendly. Rooms were nice and plenty big, but had issues you wouldn't expect, such as: loose plumbing fixture in the shower and water pressure that would take your skin off, I-Pod player didn't work and we called to have it fixed and it never happened and a toilet that wouldn't stop running. Overall, very well equipped rooms and for the price, worth it. My biggest complaint, however, is the noise. Lots of hallway noise and outside noise not very well masked. Roof top pool is small but quite usable and very well maintained; a nice touch. Fitness room is small but very well equipped and maintained. Location is excellent and close to everything. No need to take a cab anywhere within the city really. Overall, a positive experience

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Colonnade”
Reviews.Author: Katmitch28
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at The Colonnade for one night during the 4th of July weekend. Everything about this hotel is wonderful. We arrived slightly before noon, and our room was ready. I believe check-in is 2 or 3pm but they made no comment about us arriving early. At check-in I requested a room with a view of The Prudential. They accomadated my request and we were given a room on the 10th floor with an unbeliavable view of The Prudential. The room was incredible! HUGE window with an incredible view. Windows opened slightly to let in a wonderful breeze. The room itself was perfect. Huge bed, a table with two chairs where you can sit and relax with a glass of wine, huge TV. The bathroom was superb. Lots of space, nice lighting, clean tub where I took a VERY relaxing bath. But I would have to say the best thing about the Colnnade is their roof-top pool which I visited three times in my one night stay. The view is incredible, the pool was small but very clean, they have plenty of tables and chairs to relax, and they serve drinks and food. Such a wonderful way to relax! The staff at The Colonnade were all very friendly and helpful. Check-in and check-out were fast and easy. The Colonnade is located directly across from the Prudential Center, it's a couple of minutes walk to Newbury St and about ten minutes to the Public Gardens. It's a great location. I have stayed at many hotels in Boston and the Colonnade was by far the best hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Bad sound proofing, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: aura74
Reviews.Content: The renovated rooms are much brighter than before, they did a good job. Bed is comfortable, everything works. Some setbacks thou: the phone is ancient, I've never seem similar before and simply did not know how to use it. The shower pressure is excellent, but the logic is unknown to an european (=very difficult to operate), and it's very difficult to get water to be warm enough. The room door is not tight enough, so if there is any noice in the hallway, like someone opening and closing their door, you wake up. The location is superb with subway and prudential center at your door step, and there are two excellent supermarkets nearby, ShawÂ´s and Wholefoods. The rooms are equipped with coffee/teamakers. The hotel restaurant offers rather pricey breakfasts, and the service is very french- slow and grumpy.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort, location, and value (if you happen to get a great rate)”
Reviews.Author: gdreu48343
Reviews.Content: 2 night business trip. The hotel is not necessarily a standout from the exterior, but has a great renovation job on the interior. Very nice decor, modernistic. I didn't even notice the reading lights on the headboard till night #2, as the way they were arranged was so artful! My room faced the brownstones, and was very quiet. Loved having windows that actually open. Loved bedside lights that actually dim at graduated levels. Nice amenities, comfy bed/bedding, fluffy towels, clean, clean, clean. The little details in the room really made it all come together - great lighting options, flat screen tv, keurig coffeemaker. Location was great - next to two malls and a supermarket, and right next to a subway station. I didn't go to the Brasserie (saw mediocre reviews elsewhere). Walked up just to see the rooftop pool, but it was locked and no one was there (that seemed a bit odd). The "business center" is a fairly small windowless room, not staffed. Wish I had more time to explore Boston, what a wonderful city! It was a last minute trip, and I was fortunate in snagging a very good discounted rate via the hotel's website. For what I/my business paid, it was an excellent value. Suggestion to the hotel: iPrefer members are supposed to receive complimentary upgrades when available -- it would be nice if the staff would indicate (at check in) if such an upgrade was not available - you shouldn't make the hotel guest ask/wonder.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...great location...friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: eguzza
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in the heart of the Back Bay. It's within walking distance to a ton of great restaurants and shopping. The hotel staff was very friendly and gave great recommendations for food and sight-seeing tours. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel.......”
Reviews.Author: Logfin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a weekend and had a very nice experience. The staff was polite and helpful. The rooms were very clean and you couldn't ask for more to make you comfortable. We loved the reading lights on the bed and I was in heaven with the make-up mirror in the bathroom and the great lighting. The room was super clean and the bed a dream. We checked out and did some sight seeing in the rain, got very wet and had a 6 hour ride home. We went back to the hotel and asked if there was a place to change. They were very happy to let us change in the rest room, a very large and beautiful rest room used for weddings and affairs. It made our trip home much more comfortable. Thank you very much. I would stay here again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Second trip even better than the first”
Reviews.Author: tessajane
Reviews.Content: Originally stayed at this hotel with two girlfriends last year. We enjoyed our stay and found the location excellent. When returning to Boston with my husband, thought this would be out of price range - however, saw on TripAdvisor Boston Forum that easyclicktravel.com were offering a very good rate, and that the Colonnade had a price match policy. So, I contacted the hotel who graciously matched the excellent price offered. I also mentioned a couple of very small issues I had on my last trip, relating to membership of the I-Prefer programme. Jason, the front office manager, got back to me and when we arrived there was a letter awaiting me, with complimentary breakfast vouchers in for our stay. In addition to these there were chocolate covered strawberries and evian water in our room for us. We were also given airmiles and complimentary wi-fi. As before the hotel room was fabulous, with floor to ceiling windows, and a wondefully comfortable bed. The concierge was very helpful and all of the staff were attentive and charming. We had a really great time and would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Boston - and if you can get a reduced rate, then so much the better!

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal, Great location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaineMom5171
Reviews.Content: My family often travels to Boston for short weekend stays and we're always looking for the perfect hotel. I have stayed in many of the hotels in the Back Bay and this one by far was the best. We got a deal where we had two connecting rooms. We only paid $399 total and that rate came with the two connecting rooms, parking, free breakfast each day, and tickets for our family to one of the local children's venues (aquarium, museum, duck tours, etc). My mother was in town visiting and she stayed in one room and the kids and I stayed in the other room. We split the cost so really, it was only $200 a night for each family. And for Boston with all of these add-on's, it was a great deal. The positives was most definitely the location. We're always trying to find a location that is good for kids. The T subway train is literally right outside the door. The mall is across the street with all of my favorite restaurants...PF Changs, Cheesecake Factory and California Pizza Kitchen. There was even a Shaw's grocery store across the street where we stocked up on waters, sodas and snacks. The door men were extremely helpful and gracious. The only negative was the rooms were a bit small but when you're in a city, most rooms are not really spacious. The breakfast was also not anything to rave about. If I would have had to pay for the breakfast, I would have thought it was very expensive. I was also a little confused how they calculated the "free" breakfast and was worried that they would add the extra's onto my bill but when we checked out, there were NO charges anywhere for any breakfast. They also gave the kids cute fanny packs filled with stuff. They loved them. But if you're room did not come with breakfast, you can walk across the street and get a Starbucks, Dunkin Donuts or eat less expensively somewhere else. Overall, this hotel was great and we'd definitely stay here again. Great for families!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: IsmaelGuaynabo_PR
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in Boston City cernter. In front of Metro Station, Prudential Center great for shopping and eating.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Boston”
Reviews.Author: CindyKBoston
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay here. Once again this hotel was one of the nicest we have ever stayed in. This hotel offers more customer service than I have ever had at a hotel. From maid to management this hotel has the best customer service ever. We even called the hotel from a ball game to see if we could get reservations at one of the busiest steak restaurants in the city. Within 10 minutes we were called back with confirmed reservations at the perfect time. Thank you Thomas. We closed the bar Friday night talking to other couples. Never once were we rushed. And the drinks were great too! We talked to a couple in the North End who are responsible for making reservations for out of town clients. Told them how we had never found a better hotel anywhere and they said they will now be looking at the Colonnade with our recommendation. I don't hesitate for a second recommending. Hopefully we can go back in Sept. for hubbys birthday :).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: richjack
Reviews.Content: Pluses: great location for Red Sox games - we walked. Great, very large bathroom. Everything clean...staff was great. Rooms were beautiful, so was the lobby. The bellman, the doorman, the check in staff, the cleaning staff - everyone was great. Two minor minuses: the room is rather crowed and the air conditioner just couldn't do the job. It was putting out cold air but where the vents are located made it hard to cool the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel, Awesome Bathroom, but Cramped Room”
Reviews.Author: Sibonile
Reviews.Content: When I first rolled up to the hotel I though, UhOh. It's not pretty at all on the outside, the awkward layout of the lobby was a little better, but the room definitely made up for all my concerns. The bathroom was super spacious, but that was because they took the space away from the room making the sleeping area really cramped. PROS: The bed was comfortable, tv/coffee nice, trendy decor, Pru Center and Hynes Convention Center right across the street, subway stop right outside the door, the bell boys were super helpful, and the water pressure was amazing. CONS: The view sucked, the room service trays were left in the hallways for hours, the concierge's knowledge was lacking, and I couldn't get points for the stay. (All kind of minor, considering what it could have been.)

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Leiya
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed for one night while we were visiting a college. We check in and had to wait a few minutes. The guests that were checking in ahead of us were staying for two weeks and the two staff member working with them were really fussing over them and telling them they wanted to check on their room to make sure everything was perfect for their stay, When it was our turn to check in the staff was friendly but just didn't come across with the enthusiam for our short stay. The room was very nice, clean, the beds were comfortable although I had some holes in my sheets, the view from the room was OK. It was quite. The hotel provides valet parking for $38. You can drive in and out as many times as you wish, But after 3 the charges start applying again and it could become a very expensive venture. When we checked out we were never asked if everything was OK like the couple next to us. Maybe this staff just doesn't see a Mother and son the same as they do other types of couples. All in All we had a nice time. We would go back again. Maybe ask for a better view. The T stop was right outside the front door which was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yeti249
Reviews.Content: We bought this hotel off of Hotwire for $170. At that price this hotel is a steal. I cannot find one flaw with this hotel. Great rooms, friendly staff, nice resturant and the subway right outside. The rooftop swimming pool is a nice extra. My wife was inquiring about the business center becuase we didn't want to pay for the in-room internet, the front desk clerk told us to sign up for their rewards program and we could get unlimited free in-room broadband. It sure helps to ask!

Reviews.Title: “The Staff Make This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fmjmemphis
Reviews.Content: I was in Boston on business and this was a convention hotel choice. I was treated wonderfully from the time I stepped out of the taxi until the time I left during my five day stay. The front of house staff is in THE FRONT OF THE HOUSE for a reason! However, there are drawbacks, the housekeeping staff was subpar, my minibar was restocked only once in five days, the business center computers did not work. If you are looking for a large room this is not it. Perhaps we all have gotten used to gluttony because the size of the room stopped bothering me after one night. All in all the location was stellar and I would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Female Traveling Almost Alone - Perfect Weekend/Perfect Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ally973
Reviews.Content: I LOVED THIS HOTEL!!!! First off, this review may be slanted as I'm typically a Best Western value type chick who doesn't enjoy spending $5 for a Vitamin water in the mini bar, though I love having access to one knowing it's there if I need it. Anyway, the reason I selected this upscale boutique hotel is ... my husband was off to Boston with one purpose - Extreme Beer Fest. He was to be involved with his buddies and festival the ENTIRE weekend leaving me to explore alone, etc. I selected this hotel as it was closest to the Cyclarama (sp?) and right outside a t-stop and seemed very safe, upscale without being a stuffy Marriott, youthful and COMFY . Safe/Secure & Helpful! The staff will bend over backwards for you. I locked myself out of the room and waited an entire 60 seconds for someone to help me get back in - they even checked my ID to make sure I wasn't breaking into a room - though I was in my socks and PJs. The concierge is busy, but makes time for you and acknowledges you even when theyâ€™re on a call or with another customer making you feel important. With a few moments notice, they gave my husband a ride to his walk-able destination (it was bitter cold that weekend!) in their new Smart cars â€“ super cute cars by the way! I believe they will drive one person within 1 mile of the hotel. Smart cars only have room for one person along with the driver, so couples, this wonâ€™t help you, in my case it worked out fine. Every night when my husband returned late in the evening, they checked his ID and room key to make sure he was really staying at the hotel. This was very comforting to me as a woman spending most of my time alone at the hotel. Also, ladies, the doors have THREE locks on them. Room Service Though slightly overpriced with a $4 service charge and automatic 18% gratuity added, the food was great (I ordered a chicken salad on roll with fries â€“ mmm!) The food arrived quickly and prepared perfectly and correctly. Perks & Package Deals Please make sure you sign up for the iPrefer card which allows you use of the Internet for free and late/early check ins/outs. The person who took my reservation was shockingly helpful having the consumerâ€™s best interest in mind â€“ he suggested it, knowing times are tough Iâ€™m sure. They have great packages, the one we took advantage of was based on the temperature outside. We paid $30 for Friday nightâ€™s stay and $295 for Saturday. Our package also included free hot cocoa and parking and a 2-hour tour of Boston via a TROLLEY ride! I loved it! My biggest regret was not doing the haunted/ghost tour the evening before! I loved the room, decorated so much in my style, my husband kept teasing me. Very hip, modern â€“ though make sure everything works â€“ three of our four reading lights were burnt out but I didnâ€™t bother to report it. The upscale bathroom toiletries are amazing and if youâ€™re there more than one night, they will restock them! Location Perfectly situated by the Prudential Center, Barnes & Noble, PF Changâ€™s, Daily Grill, Cheesecake Factory, an oversized Shawâ€™s supermarket (get your bottled water, snacks there, $1 DVDs for the kids and save $ on the overpriced mini bar and in-room movies). Also a few blocks from Newbury Street â€“ great shopping and galleries! Restaurant The French restaurant was great for breakfast, they give you a 15% off coupon â€“ you may want to try walking a few feet to Thorntonâ€™s, we were feeling lazy and anxious to head home so we hit the brasserie for breakfast on Sunday morning on our way out. Parking Car is safe, only people for the hotel park there. We even saw an attendant keeping an eye on things â€“ very reassuring! Parking was paid for by the hotel, thanks to our package!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful weekend”
Reviews.Author: ReadHere
Reviews.Content: We did the Romantic Weekend Getaway for the weekend before Valentines Day. Beautiful huge room, great view, 'Parisian' Breakfast via room service, special turntown service, all for $151 per night! Front desk was friendly. I wish the doorman on arrival would have been more helpful, though. We had to carry our own bags in while the doorman stopped to kiss up to someone else arriving. The bar and Brasserie Jo were excellent. All in all, we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “New Hampshire Ice Storm”
Reviews.Author: Stratham
Reviews.Content: My son and daughter-in -law brought myself and my dog to the Colonnade on Sat 13 Dec due to the massive ice storm in the northeast on 11 Dec. Staff couldn't have been nicer and more accommodating, it was a pleasant respite from living in a 40 degree house waiting for the power to come on which still hasn't as of 18 Dec. I will stay at the Colonnade again for the weekend as a mini vacation. Thanks to the staff!! Valerie Robertson Stratham, NH [--]

Reviews.Title: “loved the colonnade”
Reviews.Author: paulaandscott
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend in Boston. We loved the Colonnade and are looking forward to staying there again. Very impressed with updates and all the details. We had a 5th floor room, facing Pru Center. Upon cking in, we were asked if we'd like a higher room, but we stuck with 5th floor. Next time, we'll go to a higher floor. They allowed us to check in early....they had no idea that it made our stay in Boston much more enjoyable. Looking forward to staying there on our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Location,Location,Location!”
Reviews.Author: Hillier86
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a place to stay in Boston for a long weekend (11/8-11/10) and stumbled upon a great deal listed on travelzoo.com. The special rate included parking ($38 a day)! We travel with our laptops so I'm always checking out the internet connection rates as well. The rate is normally $13.95 for connection, however, as another member pointed out, it's included with the their member program-"i prefer" which is free. We've traveled to Boston many times over the years and have walked by The Colonnade but have never stayed. Definately our mistake! The location is fantastic! The "T-green line" is literally outside the front door. Prudential Center stop. Across from the hotel is the Prudential Center and the large mall is attached to it. You can actually walk for blocks through the glass walkways. The hotel went through a recent renovation and it's fantastic! The rooms are tastefully done with crisp linens and modern lines. I'm a fan of the king bed but when the kids are with us we have to settle for 2 doubles. The beds were comfy and pillows soft. The room boast large windows and can even open a little to let the fresh air or just get a feel for the temperture outside. We had a wonderful room on the 11th floor and was more of a cube set up rather than the typical long room. Each room has a flat screen t.v and a nifty ipod docking clock. My favorite extra was the extendable reading lights attached to the headboards! The bathrooms are a little on the smaller side but modern and clean which is all I'm concerned with. We never got to the restaraunt or to the fitness area. The pool is closed for the season but I understand it's quite nice and a happening spot. The best part about this hotel is their staff. They were genuinely friendly and helpful. Everyone person you met had a smile and a hello for you. Never once did it feel forced or insincere. I would definately recommend this hotel for your next stay in Boston! We'll be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great Boston location”
Reviews.Author: sachem
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked directly but using a code from a Hotwire ticker special of $219 per night ( plus tax). This hotel was a good deal as the room was good size with two queen beds, many downtown older hotels are small and offer only one bed.I did feel they should include free internet, especially since many people paid an even higher room rate. The location was great across from the Prudential Center with a T stop right outside the door. The room and beds were very comfortable and had plenty of space for the two of us. We had minor problems each day with housekeeping as they forgot to leave items every day we were there ( glasses, hand towels, shampoo). Jimmy, Bell Captain, was always friendly and helpful. Thornton's Restaurant, only a short block away, was a very reasonable place for a quick breakfast. Shaw's is a large grocery store located very close which is a great place to pick up snacks, unfortunately I didn't realize it was there until the day before we left. This hotel is a great place to stay if you can get a reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: lumbab
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a wonderful one night stay at the Colonnade with my daughter and adult step daugther. Expedia had a great deal ($169/night for a 2 double beds) which I grabbed after reading the reviews here. The room was modern, very clean and fairly spacious for Boston and New York standards. Fluffy pillows were piled high on top of the white down comforter. There was a large flat screen tv with a dvd player (perfect for my six yr old), a small table with two chairs and an ottomon. The bathroom had marble tops and the bath was topped off with a cute yellow rubber ducky with the hotel's name on it! And did I say it was clean? We were on the top (12) floor which was a smoking floor but our room was non smoking. Occassionally there was a hint of old smoke but not enough to bother us (and I have asthma). Our large SUV did not fit in the parking structure, but we were directed to an outside lot one block away across from the Sheraton ($30/day). Location was perfect - across from the Prudential on Huntington Ave. PF Changs, Cheesecake Factory, Daily Grill and Barnes and Nobel are also across the street. Green line was in front of the hotel. Staff was friendly all around. From the room I called about internet access and was told that it was $13/day but if I signed up for the I Prefer benefit program (free) for Summit Hotels, then I could get access for free!

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: lucksgirl
Reviews.Content: Got a good rate on hotels.com Kind of hard to find the parking entrance. Safe, secure parking garage. Easy check-in. They were still renovating the other end of the floor I was on. The hallway was a bit too dark in my opinion. My room was newly renovated and nice. Clean and good size. Comfortable stay. Centrally located by Prudential Center and other areas of interest. I would recommend and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pet Friendly”
Reviews.Author: truck_trippers
Reviews.Content: The Colonnade has been renovated recently and is magnificient. We spent three days in Boston. The staff was very friendly and efficient. Our bar fridge wasn't working when we got to our room so we called the front desk and within 1 hour our new fridge was delivered and set up. As we were travelling with our pet, we were on the 5th floor (all travellers with pets are on the 5th floor). Our room was large and we had a great view of the city. The exercise room is also on the 5th floor and is well equipped. There are a few treadmills, stairclimbers and elipticals as well as a full gym of weight machines, free weights, etc. A good place for an early morning workout. The Colonnade is right across from the Prudential Centre, and the "T". Great, central location. We parked our car and walked and took the "hop-on, hop-off" tour to see the city and it was a fantastic, easy way to do it. You never had to wait more than 15 minutes for a bus, and you could spend as little or as much time as you wanted at any of the historic sites. We had a great seafood dinner in an informal setting at the Summer Shack. Lots of great restaurants on Newberry Street.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a business trip”
Reviews.Author: Thierry007
Reviews.Content: If you are in Boston for a conference at the Hynes center, the Colonnade might be a good choice. Good value for money and close to convenient subways station (especially Coppey). My room (King luxe) matched the description on the web site. It was quite large, well equipped (round table, coffee maker, iron and iron table) and lighting was excellent contrary to what is said in a review. There was also a wide flat screen TV. I liked the contemporary design, although it is not breathtaking. The bathroom is somewhat under-dimensioned compared to the room, but nice and furnished with the usual amenities and two bathrobes. I got a room on the last floor (11th) as requested when booking through Expaedia. With floor-to-ceiling windows, the view (on Prudential center) was Ok, especially if you like the beauty of huge buildings. Windows open but this makes the room quite noisy. Elevators were quick and available most of the time. Downsides: - Could not understand how the shower tap was working and had to action it for a while before getting the right water temperature. - Had to pay 13,95 US $ a day for the internet connection (quite good).
