In a modern, four stars hotel, this should be included in the room rate. - Apparently, all rooms are non smoking. This is not clearly indicated on the web site. - Besides the proximity of the Hynes center, the neighborhood is not exciting and lacks charming restaurants and nice shops.

Reviews.Title: “A MUST!”
Reviews.Author: JerryYouKnow
Reviews.Content: I had never been to Boston. I cannot begin to tell what a home run this place is. From the moment I checked in, I was practically knocked over with niceness. Holli, the girl that took care of me at the front desk was super pleasant and accomodating. The room was UNBELIEVABLE. The bed was comfortable, the shower was strong and the mini bar was fully stocked and had plenty of options. There was a great flat screen TV and a DVD player, along with a radio that had a hookup for my iPod. Denton, the Conceirge, was knowledgeable and made reservations for us. Even the doormen were all smiles. The best part is their rooftop pool. What a GREAT setup there. Wait staff brought food and drinks. The pool was clean and the towels fluffy. Top notch all the way. The location was perfect with a T stop right outside the door and walking distance to everything. The only Cons: they make you pay for wireless internet access and it gave 2 bars strength. For the pricetag, I thought they should comp it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Redsoxfan4ever
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with this hotel. The rooms were very clean and beds comfortable. The room was nicely decorated. There were some unnecessary big pillows on the bed but we just took them off. The staff was friendly and professional. The food at Brasserie Joe in the hotel was excellent as were the servers. The parking was pricey and I thought there should have been free internet for what we were paying for the room. We had an awesome view from our room and our children enjoyed the roof top pool. I enjoyed the view of Fenway Park!! The entire hotel was classy and clean. Only complaint was high cost of parking and no free internet.

Reviews.Title: “As expected”
Reviews.Author: Kitbit
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights. Room as expected from photos on website, but bathroom smaller than it looks in the pictures. Comfortable bed with plenty of pointless cushions on top (but no more than a lot of other hotels - don't really understand the point of it, but then I'm not an interior designer) Only one bathrobe in room but another sent up when requested (actually another 2 sent up?!) , our NYC hotel only had one robe as well, another thing I don't understand when the room is for two guests. Room well equipped with everything you require, fridge with minibar (extortionate as usual) that we emptied and filled with our own stuff, luckily not one of those that charges you as soon as you remove something. Rooftop pool OK - quite small. Location OK - T station right at front door and right across from Prudential centre if shopping is your thing. Decent value for Boston for price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Not Thrilled”
Reviews.Author: dpcta
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Colonnade because of it's close proximity to Northeastern University. It is also within walking distance to Fenway and the T stop is right outside the front doors. The rooms were small, but nice and modern. The beds were very comfortable. The bathrooms are tiny and lacking counter space. There were no mirrors in the room other than the bathroom, making it very difficult for our family to get ready in the morning. Lighting is poor also. The hallways are so dark that we had a hard time reading room numbers. Towels were never left when the room was cleaned and our room keys didn't work twice in our short 2 day stay. Parking was outrageous- $78 for 2 days. Unless I got some great deal, I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: elemalia84
Reviews.Content: The rooms are nice and comfortable. Maybe a little small but not too bad. Make sure that you press the button that tells the cleaning service do not disturb because I got awakened around 0800. It is a nice hotel if you don't mind spending money otherwise it isn't the best bang for your buck because it is not amazing. The service is ok. Make sure you are a member of I prefer or whatever that service is because even with the room being overpriced internet is not free, it is about $14. The parking price is terrible too $38 a night. The pool left much to be desired I thought it would be more amazing but the only great part is "rooftop" not the pool itself which was just ehhhhh

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous for travel with your pooch!”
Reviews.Author: CandaceSmithtown_NY
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Colonnade for two nights with our tiny poodle and enjoyed it immensely! We were concerned because although we have a dog, we are allergic to fur. We were assigned a room on the 5th floor which is the "pet" floor and the rooms were so clean that we had no problems with our allergies at all. I loved the decor of this hotel and I would love to know how they keep those white comforters so spotless! The staff was just exceptional from the front desk and concierge, to the doormen. From one picky lady, trust me, you just can't go wrong with the Colonnade!

Reviews.Title: “Over priced”
Reviews.Author: Lpaw
Reviews.Content: It was one of the hotels recommended by the conference organizers. The location is great, close to almost anything you would need during your stay: CVS, restaurants(fast food and sit down), grocery store(across the street), shopping center(across the street), on Old Town Trolley route and Prudential subway station is right at the front entrance of the hotel making it really convenient to commute via subway. The service is good overall. We had a problem with the bathroom door that came off from the track and they fixed it while we were out during the day. The bathroom decor was acceptable, plenty of light. toiletry provided is a plus. What I find unfavorable are the amount of pillows on the bed. There were probably 8 of them big and small including actually sleep pillows. We had to take them down when we went to bed. If you love having a lot of pillows, this should be a plus. The clock on the bedside table was really bright blue light that it was difficult to go to sleep with it being on. So I faced it toward the wall. There was no microwave in the room, there was a bar in the small fridge mostly packed with beverage. This one is a standard, you pay for what you eat. If you want to use an internet, you need to pay $10/24 hours. You also have to pay for parking. We parked our car there for 3 days and a half and it costs us about $140 as I recall.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek and beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Tesicka
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Colonnade hotel with a group on business. As I understand, the hotel underwent a recent renovation and I thought it was beautifully done. The rooms are spacious, very comfortable and the bathroom was just fantastic. Modern, but not too many gadgets or weird touches. I was staying in a room closest to the elevator, but it was absolutely pin-drop quiet, and I am a very light sleeper. Location is great as well; it's close to several great restaurants but, in my opinion, the best one is its own restaurant, Brasserie Jo. A wonderful restaurant, I think. I arrived at the hotel very sick, and getting some roast chicken from Brasserie Jo brought me back to life. There is also a Brasserie Jo in Chicago, but I thought this one was even better. Service was quite wonderful as well - when I asked for several extra hangers, a bellman was at my door with half a dozen within minutes. Since my group had a meeting there, the refreshments, lunch & snacks were provided by the hotel, and they were very tasty, with lots of healthy and interesting choices. The best meeting food I have had yet. I would recommend it to anyone wholeheartedly.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay at the Colonnade”
Reviews.Author: illinitravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Colonnade for a week over the Fourth of July. The room was nice and felt very clean, but it was on the small side for two adults and two teens. The bathroom was also small. The location was pretty good, it was especially easy to walk back from the fireworks on July 4 and we liked the proximity to the Prudential Center, Starbucks and Barnes and Noble. Little details keep this from being a first-rate hotel, though. Our in-room safe never worked even though maintenance came up to fix it; they put a $500 charge through on a credit card ($100 per night) to cover incidentals) even though we never used them; random staff member came into the room one afternoon to deliver a Gatorade to the mini-bar and seemed to be shocked when he found us sitting in the room; we were charged twice for the wireless card even though we were I-Prefer members and should have gotten it for free. Nothing major, but little things that added up to make it a less than perfect stay. The rooftop pool was nice and it was nice to have it as an option for a mid-afternoon break from the city. Would we stay here again? If the rate was good. Otherwise, there are many other choices that seem like they may have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: BalSingh
Reviews.Content: One of the few hotels that I have given 5 stars. Stayed for 2 nights and really enjoyed the experience. The hotel has recently been renovated and it really shows. the rooms are excellent in every way. All mod cons, comfort, nice views. The bathroom was small but very modern and functional. A crib was provded for my baby and I have to say it was better than any crib other hotels have provided. The hotel has a restaurant and we were offered 15% off our 1st visit there. The location is good and is in close proximkity to the Prudential and Copley shopping centres. Theres some great restaurants nearby too. Bear in mind that the hotel is a half hour walk from the main boston downtown area and the location is more suited to shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: andiegav123
Reviews.Content: I recently had my wedding at the Colonnade Hotel and stayed for two nights in their suite. Let me first comment on the wedding. It was absolutely fabulous! Every single details was seen to, taken care of, and executed just as discussed and agreed upon. Having dealt with many vendors and many events, they were top-notch in that department. Truly delicious food, wonderful presentation, just perfect. I cannot sing their praises enough. Courtney (the sales manager) did a wonderful job setting up and overseeing everything. All of the waiters and bar tenders were so polite and gracious.... really excellent service. The service extends to other parts of the hotel. Peter at the concierge was absolutely wonderful. From setting up hair appointments for our out of town guests to reserving seats for a duck tour for a group of 20, not task was too difficult for him to handle. He was an absolute pleasure! Every single bell check and doorman was also helpful, courteous, and efficient. As for the room, we stayed in the Suite which was fabulous. Wonderful modern decor throughout, it was quite breathtaking when we walked in. Huge living room with flat screen tv, bathroom with 2 rooms (1 for the shower and 1 sink, and another for the toilet and another sink), dining table, and seperate bedroom with king size bed and desk with chairs, flat screen tv (number 2) and chaise. It was truly beautiful and spacious, one of the best bridal suites in the city! (I had toured all the hotels and their suites... it's an important feature to consider!). The beds were extremely comfortable!! My only complaint was this: the next morning we noticed that our toilet was not flushing properly. We called maintenance, who came to check it out. He said he had to snake it (im not sure what that means), but we were on our way out. We cam back at 1am, assuming that the toilet had been fixed, and when we used it and flushed, it of course wasn't working properly. My husband called maintenance again (it's 1:30am, I went to bed!) and they 'fixed' it. The next morning, the toilet still did not work. Now, I understand that this is an old building, and they have made many expensive renovations to the building, and I was hoping that essentials like plumbing would have been one of them. While this didnt completely ruin our stay, it is something to consider. There service had been 100% perfect up until that moment, so unfortunately I cannot give this hotel an Excellent rating. They did apologize down at the front desk and give us some compensation for our trouble. As always, they were helpful, gracious and service-oriented. Overall, this is an excellent hotel. The decor is beautiful and modern in the rooms. I saw some normal guestrooms (as many guests from the wedding stayed overnight) and the rooms were about average size, with an average size bathroom as well. Very comfortable, but I'm not sure worht the price for this time of year. The service throughout the hotel however is top-notch. I would definitely recommend having an event here; food, ambiance, decor and service were all EXCELLENT. The guestrooms are also beautifully renovated.

Reviews.Title: “Location great but hotel has shortcomings”
Reviews.Author: Joyous_Traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location -- directly across from the Prudential Center and walking distance to many attractions. The staff was very nice (bellhops extremely efficient). The lighting in the hallways and elevators was dark. The rooms; however, had some problems. One chair in the room was broken so that one almost went backwards -- not good when it was sitting in front of the window that can open. Bathrooms were nice for a single traveler. However, they are small. The single sink is in the bathroom; therefore, making it inconvenient for a couple to get ready. The bathtub has a non-stick coating on the bottom which made taking a bath uncomfortable (like sitting on ground rocks). Beds have goose down pillows and feather beds. When I called down for a non-feather pillow, I was told that these had been tested on a staff member and that she had no problems with her allergies from them. Room service forgot to provide a fork. Ice machine on my floor was on the complete opposite end of hallway. We paid $384 ($342 room charge and $42.58 taxes) for Thursday and Friday nights and $526.27 ($468 room charge and $58.27 taxes) for a Saturday night. For the price, I'd recommend elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated but not fabulous....”
Reviews.Author: lagunatravel
Reviews.Content: The hotel did have a major remodel, but the elevators are still dark, and some areas of the hotel did not appear updated. The rooms look exactly as depicted in the picture. The design is modern and very comfortable. There is sufficient work area and wireless connection. The lighting is adequate, but not very bright. The bed was very comfortable, but there were decorative pillows that were stained. (better to have left them off the bed). Also, there were some crumpled pieces of paper in a corner. Other than that, the room was very clean and well maintained. The bathroom was well appointed, but could have used more shelf /counter space. The very best feature was the operable windows which are so hard to find in city hotels. Also, the front desk and concierge were very helpful and friendly. The location is great with a shopping center across the street and lots of restaurants within walking distance. Fortunately, we got a good rate online that made up for some of the shortcomings.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay - what a steal!”
Reviews.Author: k8cdi
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on this hotel --$100/night for a one night stay over Memorial Day weekend. It was a quick stay but everyone we interacted with was great. Check in was slow...there were three people in front of us, two clerks, and we waited perhaps 10 minutes. The room was wonderful, excellent bed, excellent products in the bathroom (which was a little small), and a great rennovation all around. We ate breakfast in Brasseie Jo. There was a slight misunderstanding. Hotel guests get 15% off, but I had misheard and thought the front desk clerk said 50%. I even repeated it "50%?!" and she confirmed...perhaps they may want to considering changing the discount a bit because I bet I wasn't the first person who made that mistake. Breakfast was fine, but you probably could have gotten just as good for less elsewhere. Location was very close to lots of shopping and the subway. Glad we got the discount, we got our money's worth!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: sporttraveler
Reviews.Content: Just a quick note to say how happy we were with our stay at the Colonnade - all the reviews are true - We are picky travelers and the rooms were beautiful and new, the bathrooms were spa-like and everyone at the hotel was very nice and helpful - we really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: FFWA
Reviews.Content: I travel for business quite often and I usually stay at 4* hotels. I used Priceline to find the Colonnade for $137 / night. What a steal! This hotel is amazing. The rooms are extremely well appointed for the business traveler. It all begins even outside the actual room. They've installed a door bell that announces anyone at your door and also alerts the staff to "Do Not Disturb" or "Make up Room" requests. The room is equipped with a 32" LG LCD TV and HD DVD Player. Very nice! The bed is an extremely comfortable pillow top mattress with 7 pillows. There are also "his/her" reading lamps attached to the headboard. The clock radio also has a universal MP3 docking station. Both nightstand lamps have additional power outlets on the base for whatever piece of electronics that you are recharging (cell-phone, I-Pod, etc). One of my favorite parts of the room is the table by the window. What a great work space! Two very comfortable chairs and a nice foot stool. I counted 4 power outlets within an arms reach. There is also a retractable ethernet cord on the table (note: If you are an "I Prefer" member, you can check out a free Wireless card at check-in"). The windows next to the desk are floor to ceiling and also open up to let in fresh air. I almost forgot the bathroom! Very well appointed with a nice sink/mirror and very nicely lit. The hotel also offers Gilchrist & Soames bath products. Very nice touch! All in all, I thought this was a great hotel and whenever I visit Boston, this will definitely be my first choice. Check it out!

Reviews.Title: “excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: tpf43
Reviews.Content: As a Third Party Meeting Planner we have a very select clientele of major corporations and associations from throughout the US. Therefore we must be very picky when it comes to recommending potential sites to our clients. It had been a few years since my last visit to the Colonnade and I was very much looking forward to my stay as I had recently heard the property being touted as "The New Colonnade" due to recent major renovations to the sleeping rooms , meeting space and public areas. I was not disappointed. From the moment I arrived I was warmly greeted by the valet and bellman who ushered me into the newly renovated and decorated lobby and front desk area which had beautiful new marble floors and lobby furniture. I was then greeted by the Concierge who informed me about the new renovations and the amenities the hotel had to offer. He also made reservations right then for my party at their exquisite French restaurant, Brasserie Jo. The bellman escorted me to my room which was fabulously redecorated since my last visit - a very warm feel with a combination of black, white,beige and oak. The new furniture, decorations, beds, bedding , plasma tv and radio with a wide variety of listening choices was very impressive. We went to the bar at Brasserie Jo before dinner and enjoyed a martini from their extensive martini menu - the best I have ever had. We went on to enjoy a truly wonderful dining experience in Brasserie Jo. The food and service were outstanding. Overall we were treated like VIP's , the entire hotel staff was extremely attentative and made us feel right at home. I look forward to highly recommending the "New Colonnade" to my clients, business associates and friends who will be visiting Boston in the future.

Reviews.Title: “THESE GUYS GET IT - "The Attention to Detail was Amazing"”
Reviews.Author: Marco5
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently on both business and pleasure and often stay at some of the top rated hotels and resorts including many Ritz Carltons and the Four Seasons along with great independent hotels such as the Breakers and the Broadmoor. Recently my travels took me to Boston and a friend told me about a hotel that I really should visit. He said that not only was it in the perfect location, the food was incredible, the service friendly and attentive and their attention to detail were stupendous, oh and by the way the value was outstanding as well. I really trust this friend and so I proceeded to book my stay at the Colonnade in Boston. So many hotels "talk the talk" but very few "walk the walk" but I have to say that the team at the Colonnade does exactly that. My stay was flawless and I'm tough on a hotel. I tend to use all the services and I did so during my recent stay in Boston. My room is also my office and the detail and commitment that has gone in to their newly renovated guest rooms (I heard 20 million) were amazing. Obviously somebody spent a lot of time talking to guests and really thinking things out before detailing their rooms. Everything was where it needed to be and it was intuitive at every step. The design was beautiful and I kept thinking what a great value I was getting with every imaginable amenity in place without overpaying. At almost every hotel I've stayed at, you feel like something was forgotten and you are subject to mistakes from after thoughts - Not at the Colonnade! The room had it all - convenient lighting, wonderful drawer space - DVD player with flat screen HDTV - Wireless Hi speed (really hi speed) internet access - an i-pod docking station - electrical outlets everywhere you need them - stylish reading lamps from his and her on the bed - plush linen with impressively high thread counts - a modern and beautiful bathroom - great views of the city - Oh and by the way, have you seen these cool one cup coffee makers (I never saw them before) but they have that too and it was an awesome cup of coffee. Ok, so the rooms are amazing but what about the service? It was even better. They asked me what my arrival time would be upon my reservation and they were certainly ready for me - I was greeted by name - asked about all of my needs for my visit - they introduced me to their excellent concierge whom I used for many things with great success. All of their staff was friendly, caring and competent. I felt like I was at my second home as they routinely said hello to me as I came and went. One time, I was waiting for a friend in the lobby and I was checked on three different times offering me a drink, directions or simply saying good evening. So, far two for two - what about the food and beverage? I would have to say it far exceeded my expectations. They have an amazing restaurant that is a local hot spot called Brasserie Jo and it was terrific. I enjoyed dinner with business colleagues and they were all impressed and one night I had dinner at the bar and it was equally good. I also had breakfast there daily aside from room service one day and it was awesome. The chef is a major talent and the restaurants ambiance is hip, fun and they must give preference to the hotel guests being recognized each time I dined. I enjoyed the sautÃ©ed sea scallops one night and then splurged with the steak and frittes the other and they were both awesome but save room for dessert -You won't believe it - trust me on this one! Sorry for all the words but obviously I was very excited to find this gem in Boston - I highly recommend it and I'm confident you will too. The Colonnade is a refreshing departure from so many hotels that think they get it - The Colonnade really does! Marco Grande, L.O., Florida

Reviews.Title: “Ooh la la!!!”
Reviews.Author: JrsyGrl73
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Colonnade Hotel many times over the years and have always had a great experience. The staff is always friendly and helpful and Brasserie Jo is a gem of a restaurant. The rooms were ok but needed a little updating. We stayed at the Colonnade a few weeks ago and were blown away. The lobby was beautifully and simply renovated......and the rooms were just lovely. Lots of light, beautiful contemporay furnishings, carpet and the most comfortable bed i have ever slept in. Kudos to all involved!! Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “amazing renovations!”
Reviews.Author: musicseeker123
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel before and the room was "ok" this time I stayed in a renovated "Luxe" room and it was like a different place. The renovations are amazing, big windows, lots of light, very comfortable beds, NICE bathroom. In addition the staff-doormen, concierge and front desk all very pleasant. I would say give this place another look

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: vailskibunny
Reviews.Content: My husband & I, both in our mid-30s, stayed here for a weekend trip to see the Red Sox. We stayed in a newly renovated "Luxe" room, and we were very pleased with the hotel. The hotel staff, from the bellman to the front desk to the concierge were very friendly and eager to help. The hotel's location can't be beat - short walk to Fenway, Newbury St, across from the Pru center. The room was very comfortable - great bed, nice sheets, functional table with two chairs, plenty of space to put clothes away, nice bathroom with awesome water pressure, nice amenities. The rubber ducky is a cute touch, and housekeeping gave us an extra one so we could bring one home for each of our 2 dogs! The room size is small (typical of a city hotel) but comforable. We were on the 5th floor with no view to speak of, but the room was quiet. The flat panel tv and ipod player were also nice touches. Overall a great experience. Although we didn't eat at Brasserie Jo on this trip, we have previously eaten there & really enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Fine; Some lack of attention to details”
Reviews.Author: lo_angle
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night on a special rate "weekend in the city" getaway deal, which included breakfast at the hotel restaurant. On (early) check in, I was offered an upgrade to a refurbished room, but declined and had to wait for our older-era room. The room we got (in the old-carpet, old-door section of the hallway) was your basic upscale late-80's hotel room, with substantial dust noticeable on the carpet/molding at the edges of the furniture, burned out light bulbs in bathroom, older TV, etc. Nothing terrible, but annoying. The room was comfortable, with a generic eastward view, and the bathroom was huge--I think it was an accessible room as the shower head was on the long wall opposite the shower opening, and not on one of the end walls. The rooftop pool was packed when we visited, but we got chairs quickly and then chaises after a short wait. The music they were playing was far too loud and flat out awful, and the CD kept skipping. My impression had been that the pool did not admit non-hotel guests on weekends, but it was clear that most of the people up there were 'regulars' from the area. The vibe of the pool area is sort of like a Cape Cod country club, and could easily be revamped to something much cooler. Breakfast was stellar, the restaurant is great, but there are multiple restaurants as good or better within easy walking distance (or very short cab ride). Boston is literally right out the door here--the T is adjacent to the hotel entry.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, but very dreary hotel rooms”
Reviews.Author: JJackson77
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 weeks. I wasn't very impressed with the rooms in the hotel. Very old and in need of a revamp. Staff were very friendly but that was the only thing I could recommend. That and maybe the location. Definitly would not stay here again. Pool was closed even though the weather was still warm enough to swim. They seem to just close it on the same day every year, regardless of temperature.

Reviews.Title: “This rubber ducky is SUCKY”
Reviews.Author: keryninbali
Reviews.Content: Although our group of 8 arrived at the same time, some of our party received "renovated rooms", while the other half got stuck on the outdated, musty, woefully inadequate green carpeted side. No better than a 1-star motel, for $500/nite I was tortured to 70's stank carpet, hard bed, lumpy pillows, thin bedding, noisy street, grey towels....and SOMEONE ELSE's HAIR on my sink. I asked to be moved 3 times, and never was satisfied with the condition of the rooms. Although my colleagues slumbered in renovated loftiness, all I can say is that I hate this hotel. Who doesn't have coffee makers in the rooms anymore???

Reviews.Title: “Hard to Recommend The Colonnade”
Reviews.Author: dever
Reviews.Content: It seems as if The Colonnade is trying rest on the fact that it is a good location. If I had booked a room at the Ramada or some other mid-scale hotel, I probably wouldn't have been too dissappointed. But when a hotel advertises itself as upscale and luxury, my expectations grow a little. The positive -location, as every other reviewer wrote. Real convenient to just about anywhere you need to get to. But at some point you have to return to the room you paid a nice little sum for. This hotel is going through a renovation. Good thing. When I called to confirm my reservation, the man said renovations would begin again in the spring, which means half the hotel is renovated. I also requested a renovated room(after reading other reviews), since my wife and were getting away for an anniversary trip weekend. The gentleman said it shouldn't be a problem, and made note of it. I was excited. Until check-in, when the girl at the front desk(who could use a little more enthusiasm when talking with guests) told me it would be an extra 60.00 a night for the newer rooms. This would be a handy piece of information to have when confirming the reservation. I opted not to upgrade, and in hind-sight, I'm happy I didn't. One of the maids showed us the upgraded room. Same size, just flat screen TV, new linens and carpet. Nothing special. The age and neglect of this hotel hits you the minute you get off the elevator. You know that musty smell of an old beach house? Yep. The room? Same smell. Very 70's-ish with worn out bed spreads and a 25 inch TV. I pulled an end table away from the wall to look for an outlet and found old crumbs lining the baseboard. I don't need real fancy, just give me clean and well maintained. It's a real shame that nobody seems to notice the small things anymore. Again, If I booked a lower-scale property for less money, I probably would have expected what I got and moved on. Go to the Colonnade's web-site and you'd expect more. I cannot recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good all round choice”
Reviews.Author: sold
Reviews.Content: More tourist than luxury, the Colonnade occupies a prominent and useful location in the heart of "Back Bay", bordering both commercial and residential areas. The favoured room view looks out on the modern Prudential Center, while some may prefer the rear view which reveals a more eclectic and residential mix. The proximity of the Prudential Center provides a vast choice of shops and restaurants, while many other Boston attractions are within walking distance. I chose this hotel for the rooftop pool, which is popular among guests and Bostonians alike. Access is by elevator to the top floor and then one flight of the emergency stairs, which is exactly what they look like. Please note that the pool closes immediately after Labour Day, which is not clear from the hotel's web site. Free internet access is available to those who join the hotel's free loyalty club "I Prefer". An all round good choice for those looking for an open air pool and/or a comfortable and well located property.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: cinncitraveler
Reviews.Content: This place was okay - spacious room looking right at the Tower, cool, well furnished bathroom (a bit small, kind of a European feel). The room was well appointed, with a very comfortable bed and pillows. It was quiet at night - got a great night sleep. Shopping, Sox, and Convention Center all in easy walking distance. On the downside, the restaurant waiters were snobs, no coffee in the room, and the TV was from the 70s.

Reviews.Title: “More like Days Inn than 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: Formula1Champ
Reviews.Content: This is one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed. The bed spread had holes, rooms were stinky and bathroom was falling apart. Stay away unless they are charging $90/night as location under $100 is worth it. I would never stay or recommend.

Reviews.Title: “a hotel in transition”
Reviews.Author: davidbruce
Reviews.Content: The Colonnade is clearly a hotel in a period of transition and renovation. I stayed at the hotel in July for a conference, and right away I noticed that there was a lot of change going on, as the check-in was set up on some folding tables by the entrance, because half of the lobby was tarped over. I was pleased with my room, which appeared to have been recently renovated - and nicely. The room had stylish new furniture and furnishings, a big flat screen TV, a comfortable bed, wonderful new linens, and lots of quiet. However, several of my colleagues had one of the pre-renovation rooms, and they were furious when they saw my room. Their furnishings looked like something out of a 1960s-era motel, with a tiny little old TV, worn-out linens, etc. They didn't even get the same high-end towels and toiletries that I got. So if you're staying at the hotel during this transition period, be sure to request one of the renovated rooms. Otherwise, you'll end up paying a four-star price for a one-star room and will be as upset as my colleagues were. Other notes: The hotel gym was smallish bt adequate. It too seemed to be recently renovated, with brand new equipment, flat screen TVs, etc. But I'd suggest avoiding the hotel restaurant and bar. The food was so-so, the waitstaff was rude, and the bar area is tiny, rundownd and in desperate need of its own renovation. I should also add that the Colonnade is in a great central location, within walking distance of many Boston attractions, shopping, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SCadventurer
Reviews.Content: I only stayed for a night, but it was a very nice and clean hotel. The beds were very comfortable and the guest services were very helpful. The only issue was the AC did not cool very much, but we were lucky that the days and night were pleasant. Overall this was a perfect place to stay and I would highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: winniemartin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at one of the suites here, and really enjoyed our stay. The staff was truly wonderful, from the people at the desk to the staff at the rooftop pool, and of course the concierge. They were very friendly and really went out of their way to give us more than we asked of them. The rooms we had were large and immaculately clean. The bed was super comfortable. The location, too, is excellent. There's shopping and restaurants right there, and the T is close. Also, we found free overnight parking just a block and a half away.

Reviews.Title: “2 star hotel at 4 star price”
Reviews.Author: Noreen2007
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I cannot understand how anyone could give this hotel a good rating. The decor is horribly outdated, everything is old and the musty smell meets you at the front door. We stayed one night. The air conditioning gave off a terrible musty smell, and we could not turn it off. Luckily we could open the windows (which was very dangerous for kids as the windows are only 2 feet from the floor). We gladly exchanged the noise from the traffic for some fresh air. Our room had moldy plaster over the bed. The bathroom fixtures were probably nice in 1971. The TV was very small. This is not a 4 star hotel. On the positive side, it is near the T station, and the towels are new. Some of the rooms appear to be updated, but I don't see how you can avoid the smell from the air conditioning. I was going to give it 2 stars, but that means "okay but some problems" and it was not ok. Not at all!

Reviews.Title: “Solid stay at the Colonnade Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cdlc
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by the Colonnade Hotel. Yes the rooms are small, and the hallways are dark, but the current renovations of the rooms have resulted in modern-style, boutique-type amenities. (I believe they are still renovating- we stayed on the 10th floor.) The beds were comfortable, the sheets soft, and the furniture new. The staff are completely friendly and helpful, and the location is hard to beat- right in front of the T line and adjacent to the Prudential Center and Newberry Street shopping. The room service (breakfast) came quickly, the coffee hot, and the pastries delicious. Brasserie Jo, the restaurant in the lobby is also great for lunch. We paid a steep price (about $330 per night) since we were there during gradution season-- it's definitely worth it if you can find a hotwire deal (as mentioned in other reviews). Four stars because of the small rooms and bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Get your money's worth somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: aeb88
Reviews.Content: Stay down the street at the Marriott or the Westin, at least if you're visiting Boston in April. The Colonnade is too cheap to turn on your AC. My husband, 9-month-old son, and I stayed at this hotel for a weekend in April to attend a wedding. We were pleased with everything until we got into the room and requested that the air conditioning be turned on. The hotel management said they would not turn on the A/C to the entire building. Instead, they suggested we open the windows. This was a completely unacceptable solution because my son, who is crawling, would have fallen out of the non-child-proofed windows that went down to about 2 feet above the floor. The outside temperature was 65-70 degrees. We sweltered anytime we were in the room, and the management was entirely unhelpful. When I stay in a nice hotel -- in an urban area especially -- I want A/C and a barrier from the street noise and air pollution.

Reviews.Title: “Marble bathroom plus rubber ducky”
Reviews.Author: Lost_in_Pittsburgh
Reviews.Content: Spent 1 night at the Colonnade. $300 (but it was the day of the Boston Marathon so I was lucky to get anything in the ciity for less than $500) Queen bed. Good sized room. Fluffy towels (as expected for that kind of money). Marble bathroom complete with rubber ducky and lots of hot water!! Not the biggest bathroom, but had a mirrored wall, so it felt bigger than it really was. VERY helpful front desk and bellhops. The price was steep, but for that part of town and the events, reasonable. If it were in the $200 range that I have seen some folks quote, I'd consider it a great deal. Great location. Brasserie Jo had mediocre service but great food. I would return, especially if I were able to book via the internet to get a better rate.

Reviews.Title: “Lowered Expectations”
Reviews.Author: TruthTalker
Reviews.Content: If you most highly credit an involved and friendly staff, this hotel provides the goods. Previous comments are on target: ancient hall lighting, some deteriorated bathrooms (peeling ceilings, dirty grout, etc.), dated wallpaper in halls and rooms, limited room storage for clothing, etc. All in, a place aspiring to better things but sadly in need of refurbishment. However, it has a great Back Bay location, adjacency to a T stop, across the street from the Prudential Mall and just 2 blocks from the very upscale Copley Mall, and a solid restaurant in the lobby. The parking charges are dispiriting, at $36 per day, but fully in line with the other indoor facilities nearby. The doorman and concierges were among the most friendly and eager I've yet encountered and the rooms were kept clean. We found the room to be smallish, but very quiet at night (8th floor). A decent choice when discounted rates are offered but not a buy at rack rates over $300 (I paid $135).

Reviews.Title: “A Confident Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tribesman_76
Reviews.Content: The Colonnade does not look like much on the outside but inside it is spotless and swish. There is a great air of confidence with the staff. There is no shoulder shrugging here. They know exactly what's' going on and therefore have time to focus on guests. The bar/ rest. is Brasserie Joe's with a hint of a French theme. Again the staff were excellent. Bar had a great range of drinks. It had a good atmosphere at night- lively but with perfect conditions to chat. The burgers there are fantastic, by the way. Room was spotless and hallways inviting. In summer there is an excellent rooftop pool with dashing view of the cityscape close-up. Pool is small but the set-up is very relaxing with again great staff and a nice little bar. I'll sign off on the staff again. Concierge was fantastic. Loved his job. Apparently the best in the city. Downside, it was hard to leave the hotel to go out!

Reviews.Title: “Nice business hotel”
Reviews.Author: candice826
Reviews.Content: I stay here often on business since our office is in the area. The employees are very nice and always willing to assist in any way they can. Room Service is good and Brasserie Jo is always a good meal. Some of the rooms can be older but they are just starting a HUGE renovation which will go into next year. One half of the hotel will be closed soon and remodeled and then the other half in mid next year. Be sure to ask for a room already remodeled when you arrive. I've had a few older rooms but they have always been clean. It's a nice mellow hotel in a good area. Close to the great shopping of Copley and close to the T.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: kirkjshurey
Reviews.Content: Just returned from three nights stay at The Colonnade Hotel, Boston. Received a very warm welcome and was allocated a room on the 9th floor of this excellently located hotel. The room was lacking in tea/coffee making facilities and the shower was a continuous stream rather than a spray, but these are my only complaints, otherwise, it was extremely comfortable and quiet with the standard American hotel room amenities. We managed to secure a late check-out which made a huge difference and the staff were pleasant and very helpful. I obtained a favourable rate for the room and would highly recommend anyone to stay at this hotel. Boston is a wonderful city and worthy of a few days of anyone's time. Restaurants and bars too numerous to mention and excellent shopping opportunities, especially as there is no sales tax on clothing. It's an ideal place if you enjoy walking as the city has great neighbourhoods with beautiful houses and streets. We found some of the people to be rude and the service in some of the shops/bars was not great, but rudeness seems to be almost a local custom in some places! Don't let this dissuade you from going as it's one of America's greatest cities, full of history and culture.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: casalinda
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at The Colonnade in Sept. 2006. We both enjoyed staying there very much. The rooms were spacious, cool and clean. Room service was fast and, while not cheap, was not too expensive. The hotel is in a wonderful location-across from two shopping malls, near public gardens, right on the main subway lines and the stopping point for several trolley tours. However, the main drawing point was the service by the hotel staff. It was excellent. The front desk was extremely accommodating to all our requests. They immediately changed my room when I didn't like the colour of the room. All the staff were very couteous and helpful. We were especially happy with the service we received from the concierge, Peter. He went out of his way to secure tickets to different events for us and he helped to make our stay more enjoyable.If I went to Boston again, I would definitely stay at the Colonnade and I would recommend it to anyone who is visiting in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: Lammi
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean and adequate. It is older and lacking ceiling fans and a modern bathroom. The cable TV had limited channels. No coffee pot in the room. No news stand/snack stand in the lobby. No way to regulate air conditioning/heat in the room. On the plus side: VERY HELPFUL staff (concierge, front desk and bellmen all went above and beyond). Rooftop pool was awesome. The window in our room was the Whole Length of the Wall from floor to ceiling, breathtaking! Location is convenient to stores and subway.

Reviews.Title: “Cleanest Hotel/Rooftop Pool”
Reviews.Author: tauntonian
Reviews.Content: We went to see the Rooftop Pool and Boston's great fireworks on July 4th. The hotel does not have a great view of the city, but our room was the cleanest I've ever seen in a hotel. The Rooftop Pool was fun, with great service for drinks and snacks. Located near good shopping, too! We would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Eveningpiper
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really well located for a family trip to Boston. The T-station which takes you to all the museums and attractions is right in front of the hotel. The rooftop pool isn't glamorous but it is a lovely place to cool off after pounding the pavement all day. The Prudential Center shops are right across the street - this is a good place to get breakfast from the foodcourt and the shops (including a huge Barnes and Nobles bookstore ) are open until 9pm. Newbury street is a short walk from the hotel and it has lovely restaurants and shops. The web site makes the hotel look more glamourous than it was in reality and the price is steep but we found the room fine, the staff helpful, and the location perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: GlenEllynMom
Reviews.Content: The front desk, bell and concierge were all extremely friendly and my husband and I were equally impressed with their desire to go above and beyond what you might expect from this position. Kids loved the rooftop pool, especially as a break from all the history we were trying to get through to them.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all what I expected”
Reviews.Author: CLB27
Reviews.Content: I booked a room in this hotel for my friends bachelorette party. Upon check-in, we were told that they "sold out" of rooms with 2 beds. After expressing my frustration, explaining that this was my friend's bachelorette party, and insisting that our "bride" and "maid of honor" t-shirts were for real, the concierge finally "found" another room with 2 beds. The beds were awful - very hard and tiny. Our view looked out into a sketchy alley, which caused us to keep the drapes closed. The roof-top pool is not at all as glamorous as implied online. We were unable to find seats at the pool and forced to sit directly in front of the ladder. There were a ton of kids in the pool splashing around, which was also obnoxious. The bathroom was very small, the fixtures were all loose, the water pressure in the shower hurt it was so hard, and there was no fan. It certainly was just an average hotel. I was expecting a lot more, from the hotel website. It would have been an issue if we stayed longer then one night. Other then that - the maid staff was very friendly - showing us where the ice machine was and offered a lot of plastic bags for ice and warned us that the ice buckets were not always clean. They also offered extra towels. The other kicker is the $36/day parking - as if the $230 for a crummy hotel wasn't enough!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience at the Colonnade!”
Reviews.Author: TrailfinderIE
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here over Labor Day Weekend and had a great time. The staff were all incredibly helpful and the location was fantastic. The pool was a great place to relax after a busy day of sightseeing. We will definitely return to this hotel next time we're in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great City”
Reviews.Author: CT-Travler
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at the Colonnade and was once again extremly impressed. I stayed at the hotel the Saturday night of Memorial Day Weekend. The hotel is in a great location. The hotel is located right near The Shops at the Prudential Center, Neiman Marcus, Lord & Taylor, Shaw's Supermarket, the Hynes Convention Center, Newbury Street, Boylston Street and the Boston Public Gardens. A lot of the city's largest and/or most expensive hotels such as the Marriott Copley Square, Westin, Sheraton, Hilton, Copley Square Hotel, The Lenox, etc.) are located within steps of the Colonnade which go to prove the hotel is in a great area. In back of the hotel is the Back Bay and South End neighborhoods of Boston so by simply walking around back you are in the midst of all these beautiful historic brownstones and apartment buildings. The hotel is 10 stories and features the lobby and hotel restaurant (Brassiere Joe) on the first floor, parking is built in nicely to the 2nd and third floors and the hotel rooms are on the remaining floors with a rooftop pool which is the best in the city and one of the best in country on top. The rooms are nicely sized with nice bathrooms and big windows...my only complaint was that the TV was a little small but there was cable with HBO. Parking does cost $36.00 for 24 hours...but this is the city and that is what other hotels with parking right at the hotel charge and parking includes the opportunity to go in and out as much as you want. Some rooms have views of the Prudential Center/Sheraton/Hilton/Convention Center complex area and others have views of the Back Bay which is nice to see all the historic apartment buildings and brownstones. I came into the city via the MassPike from west of the city and so the hotel was literally right out of the tunnel in downtown. I would definitly stay at this hotel again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Dump !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What else can I say...this is the worst hotel I have ever stayed at! The place looks okay from the outside and the breakfast they serve isn't too bad. However, the room quality is the worst I have ever seen. Of the hundreds of hotels I have stayed at in my time, nothing else comes close. No Red Roof Inn, no Motel 6, no Econolodge I have been to had rooms in such disrepair. At night , no one at the desk to talk to...I stayed at the front desk for about 10 mts. until a manager from the dinning room came and called someone from the back ! Electrical outlets were falling out of the wall, the ceiling looked like it suffered severe water damage, the TV coax cable was ripped out of the wall, the furniture was stained and broken down, the door had big chunks of wood missing from it, the carpet was stained and torn, and the bathroom fixtures were the cheapest plastic junk available on the market. On the plus side, the bed was comfortable. The closet, though, was so small I couldn't even fit my luggage on the floor inside. Anyway, this place needs to shut down for a year or so while the entire place is renovated on the inside. This felt like a 1 star motel and I wouldn't return even if no other acomodation were available in the entire Boston area.

Reviews.Title: “are you kidding me ?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: You walk in and it smells of fish from the dinning room !l.....there really is no lobby to speak of. The smoking rooms were absolutely disgusting. No ventilation, horrible smell, bathrooms outdated, ice not on every floor and the furniture worn and shredding. The room service breakfast was served cold on a broken table.... pool was closed ! the desk could not cash my personal check, it took them for ever, they need to be trained. We had other family members staying in non-smoking rooms and in the same hotel, the rooms were just as stuffy, no windows to open due to constructions, and were outdated. Another family member tried to make a reservation and they were told it was sold out. Well the next morning in the lobby I heard the front desk clerk asking the Manager if he wanted to stay over that night, and which room did he want. We are Marriott members and stayed here because family made the reservations.....never again. Book elsewhere!!!

Reviews.Title: “Dont Visit Unitil May 2006 - Construction in April”
Reviews.Author: richardweile2
Reviews.Content: Staff was good. Room was fine. Location was the best feature. No need to rent a car - had the train outside and in the middle of everything. Recommend AFTER CONSTRUCTION - see below: Like a previous post says - hotel is under construction. Noise starts at 8:30AM and lasts 2 hours straight! Just cannot believe they start that early! Desk agent says they are replacing windows in whole hotel and will soundproof. Too bad they couldnt soundproof NOW!!! Woke me up first thing. Apparently the noise happens in the AM when they are removing the old windows. They tried to tell me how great the new windows are - floor to ceiling and they open! Thats great but the noise wasnt. I

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable Hotel, UNDER CONSTRUCTION”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: ******Hotel does not have working air!!****** ALSO UNDER CONSTRUCTION.... I have to be honest and believe me I will, when I first walked in I thought this place would be great. Simply, because the staff was so helpful and courteous to my wife and I. The second we walked into the out-dated hotel room I realized it would be anything but great. The room was somewhere in the high 80's and this was on a chilly March afternoon. The heat was not on, for some reason it is always that hot, so we decided to turn on the air. It didn't work so I called the front desk they replied "it hadn't been working recently" after reading this site I found out that was a blatant lie and that the air hasn't worked for a very long time. Research and you will see. Their solution: they sent a janitor up to my room with a small circulating fan - this was actually humorous. This remained a problem throughout my entire stay. I was on this trip for pleasure, I wake up early everyday. I didn't plan on it this particular week, again I was in for a big surprise. *********** EVERY MORNING AT 8:00AM THERE WAS WINDOW/BUILDING CONSTRUCTION - HAMMERS AND POWER DRILLS THROUGHOUT THE BUILDING. LOUD, VERY LOUD. ************** Just picture yourself sleeping, well itâ€™s more like profusely sweating tossing and turning due to heat and then the hammers and drills begin - it's not pretty. The safe in our room did not work. I must admit the concierge service was top-notch! Thomas especially, I think it was his first week, he should leave ASAP. I would not return...

Reviews.Title: “4 stars my eye”
Reviews.Author: meatslinger
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on a "4-star" hotel through Priceline, which placed me at the Colonnade, an absolutely perfect location for a recent conference event. But if this is a 4-star hotel than my Grandma Flo is a contender for the heavyweight boxing crown. It was a perfectly fine hotel, just not what I would consider 4 stars. The room was small, the bathroom tiny, and the walls tissue paper thin (obnoxious neighborts). But the bed was great and the window actually opened (a little), not always the case in city hotels. It was right next to a T station and across the street from the Prudential Center and a supermarket, so that was another plus. I didn't park but the lot seemed convenient and was under $20 a day. In all, a fine establishment, but not 4-stars. I would hesitate paying anything near the rack rate unless there are deluxe rooms hiding somewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel; conveninent location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because I had a conference across the street at the Hynes Convention Center. Booked through the hotel's own website for $159 per night. The staff were courteous and helpful. Quick, polite check-in and check-out process. After checking out, I stored my luggage for a day with them, which was a nice service to have. I was also grateful to have the doormen to hail me cabs in the cold Boston winter weather. I had a delicious breakfast (fresh-squeezed orange juice, omelette, toast) on the attached first floor restaurant. Over-priced, but normal by hotel standards. The extras made all the difference: Boston Globe newspapers at your door each morning, good toiletries and in-room hairdryer and iron/ironing board, wireless internet, CD-clock radio, nice comfy arm chair and desk in room, and even a rubber duckie by the bathtub! It's a lovely hotel, and I would gladly stay at the Colonnade again.

Reviews.Title: “Not good.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Really didn't enjoy my stay here. My room was old fashioned, badly decorated and had a constant smell of cooking - even though it was on the 8th floor! Got woken up each morning by maids outside my room crashing and banging about. Staff were unfriendly. One night I got told that I had a parcel to collect from reception but no-one could find it! Still don't know what happened to it.... The rooftop pool was crowded and not particularly attractive. Felt very uncomfortable there. Only saving grace was the nice restaurant within the hotel. All in all, pretty rubbish, I'm just glad my company were paying!

Reviews.Title: “Get a "Premium" room”
Reviews.Author: Dave/Kim
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cononnade Hotel for 3 nights in the middle of January. Checked in to the "regular" room that looked like it hadn't been cleaned thoroughly (hair on the bathroom floor, etc). Very tired so went right to sleep. The next day, I suggested that we change hotels since the room wasn't clean and very expensive. When we requested to check out, they asked what the problem was and we told them. We were then moved to "premium" room that had a very nice view, a very clean and larger bathroom and was a much larger room at the same rate. I don't know how much more it would be regularly, but I highly recommend it. Nice hotel with a very nice fitness room. Helpful staff! Would stay there again in a "premium" room.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: sentry4500
Reviews.Content: Being in a nice location and having a courteous staff doesn't excuse them from being inept and uncaring. Stayed for 6 nights and for the most part had no complaints. Used the business center which is causing me nightmares. Swiped my credit card to use the internet, got rejected for some reason and had to use a separate credit card. Then got charged over $2500 on my rejected card when I returned!! Had to call multiple times, talked to numerous people, explain the situation every time. Got a lot of excuses 'well the business center is outsourced and not operated by us' kind of deal. After over week of faxes and calls, got the money credited back, but after 3 weeks, still is being processed by my credit company. Their attitude is on the lines of 'we're sorry for the mistake, but we did what we could do, so it's no longer in our hands and no longer our problem', while I've been debilitated due to the charges taking up most of my credit. Had to get a new credit card issued, contact all the companies that automatically bill me on the credit card, and had (and still am) to go through hours of calls to straighten all the finances out. If the hotel has services that cannot be trusted, and will cause you great amounts of pain, I say stay clear of the hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing hotel”
Reviews.Author: EastCoastNewbie50
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Colonnade Hotel over Thanksgiving weekend. The hotel has good amenities, like the gym and restaurant but the room was small and very "worn". When we checked in, we had to have an engineer come up and rehang the closet doors, as they were off the track and we couldn't open them. We asked to be moved to a different room, but were told "no". The wallpaper in the bathroom was peeling, the carpets were tattered and the TV was very small for a room with 2 double beds. The lobby and entry were much nicer than the rooms. The doorman was very nice and friendly. For the same price next time, we will stay at the Boston Park Plaza. We have been to Boston many times in the past and decided to try the Colonnade as we had read it was such a nice hotel. However, we will return to the Boston Park Plaza Hotel, our usual hotel choice. The Colonnade is definitely not a 3 star plus hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and overall very pleased with hotel”
Reviews.Author: TeamMP
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location - directly across from the Prudential Centre shopping mall, with bars, restaurants and a supermarket all within a five minute walk. The hotel room was a good size and immaculately clean. The bathroom could do with being a bit bigger, although it served its purpose. The TV was surprisingly small but it was adequate and you don't go on holiday to sit in your room and watch the TV all day anyway! The room was very bright and airy and the air-conditiong worked fantastically and cooled the room down immediately when too warm (unseasonably warm temparatures at start of October). Because of the choice of restaurants available in the area we only dined in the hotel restaurant once for breakfast. The portions were a good size and the service was also good. The hotel was an excellent choice and we would certainly considering staying here again if we return to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff, bad room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a wedding. While the wedding party was treated well, I was often treated poorly and spoken to as if I were trespassing on the property. The room was average and the shower was VERY bad. The water pressure was painful and I felt that the shower head was going to fall off. The TV was the smallest hotel TV I have ever seen. Upon checkout, the front desk left me on hold for a long time to answer a simple question. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Average service, rude staff. Small room.”
Reviews.Author: Chriswith2kidsandawife
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Boston with no hotel booked and drove around, looking for a 4* plus hotel with a swimming pool that looked child friendly. Although the room was "ok", I am used to slightly better facilities and bigger rooms for this class of hotel. The swimming pool - our principal reason for staying here - was only open for an hour during our stay. The hotel unilaterally kept it closed at all other times as it was "too cold". It was warm enough for us to be wearing shorts and t-shirts, but the hotel staff basically couldn't be bothered to put a coat on whilst sitting next to the roof top pool to watch over any swimming guests. When we asked about this, we were told in a very patronising tone that it was "common knowledge" that the pool would be closed during "cold spells". I can only presume that the hotel manager is from warmer climes - as it was around 65 degrees when it became "too cold" to open the pool! Aside from patronising and occasionally rude staff, small rooms and limited pool availability, we had a reasonably pleasant stay. I would not stay again, however, and my family agree!

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jrfalso
Reviews.Content: The rooms in the hotel are in major need of renovation, it felt like it was 1980 decor. The bathrooms were gross, they smelled like a public urinal. In the A.M., I pleasantly found my bath tub filled with dirty water and sand due to a back up. I must say, management responded by putting us in a new room and took off one nights parking ($32). Parking is a rip off! Other than that, we attended a wedding at the hotel that was nice. Had cocktail hour on the roof top, nice view. When I return to Bean town, I will pass on the Collannade, because I would like to have a room with clean carpets and a clean bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Whoops! Think Twice!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you want mediocrity with an attitude then the Colonnade is for you...oh and lets not forget Brasserie Jo too...seems as if they are made for each other! Our room was one of the newer ones but the hairs from the previous guest were a bit much and the general management seems to feel that it is your priveledge to stay with them. Check in is at 3:00...however that doesn't mean your room will be ready...it just seems to mean that you can do their paperwork and on paper, check in...but not to your room. Now to the Brasserie Jo...didn't realize the French were noted for instant iced tea or cold "pommes frites" or undercooked potatoes or cold eggs or 1 server for far too many tables or dirty dishes or dirty table cloths...or mediocre food! All in all, an "Ok" experinece if you are buying your room at a discount on hotels or priceline...$125 max for a "premiere room" and maybe $99 for a "deluxe roon"...but for your own sake, don't pay retail for a sub-standard hotel, restaurant and lodging experience. Great deals on Marriott and Sheraton whose locations are just as good...and you can get bonus points too!

Reviews.Title: “Two stars at Best”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Four star prices with a two star value. In town for college registration with my daughter - we were quite dissapointed in the room. TINY bathroom with black & green mold stained grout, 1/2 roll of TP, dated furnishings, carpet that verges on being indoor/outdoor and an odor that fluctuates between wet basement and care facility. The housekeepers appear to be adults but the results of 30min per room could easily be improved upon by any 12 year old with the ability to turn on a vaccum. Keep in mind, this hotel allows pets so that may explain a few things.... Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Not quite a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: jay-9
Reviews.Content: Booked our stay on Priceline and paid aboout $100, which is great value for this hotel. However, I would have been most annoyed if I had paid the full price. This is NOT a 4 star hotel. I agree, location is great and it really has potential. However, the bathrooms are extremely small. In additon, the internet line had to be replaced (it was just a wire hanging out of the wall). However, the service was great and all of our concerns were immediately addressed by the staff. Concierge was also very helpful and nice. Would stay here again if I got the same price on Priceline, otherwise I'd choose somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Service and location was great, hotel so-so”
Reviews.Author: Lemster
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5-night stay at the Colonnade Hotel. My husband and I and high school age daughter were looking at colleges in the area. The Colonnade's location is excellent. It is across the street from the Prudential Center where you can find shopping and restaurants (Legal Seafoods, the Cheesecake Factory, a Food Court, coffee/pastry shops). If that's not enough shopping and eating you can easily walk one block to the Copley Plaza shops and restaurants or you can go the the grocery store also within a block. The 'T' stop on the Green line is literally in front of the hotel and an Enterprise Car Rental office in the basement of the Prudential Center was very convenient for us. Our corner room was spacious enough to have a roll-away and not feel cramped. And I can't say enough about the excellent service from the concierge staff, particularly Peter. The room service pizza was very good. On the downside, we found the room to be rather worn and dated, especially the bathroom. Although they advertise 'marble' bathrooms the tub/shower enclosure is tiled with ceramic. The sink counter top is marble, however. The use of tile or marble is not the issue, but rather their claims made it appear more luxurious than it really is. The grout in the shower is stained and even with care, water leaked badly through the shower curtain when taking a shower. After ordering room service our tray remained outside our door for 2 days, despite a call to have it removed. The second room service tray was picked up in a timely manner. I doubt that we would stay here again, although it was a good value for our 5 night stay. Most of the other hotels in the Back Bay area are also conveniently located (Boston is very compact) but were considerably more.

Reviews.Title: “Four *? You've got to be kidding!”
Reviews.Author: JustKat
Reviews.Content: Wow, I would like to know where the good rooms are that people are writing about. My daughter lives in Boston so I'm a frequent visitor...once a month at least...and have tried pretty much all the Back Bay hotels. This was my first visit to the Colonnade and will definitely be the last. Room small and dingy, burned out light bulbs, the air conditioner didn't work and maintenance just shrugged and said that was as good as it gets. Front desk was adamant there were no rooms to switch to...they finally found one my last night there. The bathroom was so tiny you could barely turn around in it, much less keep the door open while you were at the sink...it would open right into you. The roof-top pool would be lovely if it hadn't been crammed full with partying college-aged kids all the time. Apparently they have a pool membership package that is very popular with the local kids...at the expense of excluding the paying customers. None of this would have been acceptable even if I had gotten this hotel on Priceline, which I hadn't. The only thing going for this place is the location and I've paid much less for much better properties ie: Westin, Hilton, Lenox,Sheraton, (Awesome pool), all with locations just as good and much more to offer with better service.

Reviews.Title: “Would highly recommen”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends (7 in total) and I had a wonderful trip to Boston this past weekend (3/20/05) and stayed at the Colonnade. We were very impressed with the friendliness of the staff and the hotel rooms were very spacious. You cannot beat the value ($116/night) and the location. The T stop is literally right outside the hotel (very easy ride to Quincy Market/Fanueil Hall) and it is around a block away from Newbury and Boylston street (where there are tons of shopping, restaurants and pubs). We will definitely stay there again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Has potential”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveller. 3 - 4 Hotel stays per week. Familiar with surrounding Copley Sq. hotel alternatives. The Colonnade does not stack up well to either Marriott or Hilton. Hotel is a bit dated with rooms requireing a refreshing. Lobby not condusive to lingering. Exercise room comfortable, well equipped and modern. Restaurant a make believe french bistro. Parking at $32 per day is fair. Staff accomodating. Bar drinks were also fairly priced. 2.5 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was there on 2-5-2005. I got a good deal from Priceline. Even though this is not your 4 star hotel rooms are nice and clean. Lobby area is nice and staff is very friendly and even though we arrived early, they gave us a room right away. This hotel is so close to Mariott and Fairmont Copley.(2 minutes walking distance). Perfect location!! You can walk to goergous Newburry Street and Beacon Hill also Copley Mall and restaurants. Old Town Trolley Bus stops front of the hotel and it takes you everywhere in one day and you can hop in and out in every 20 minutes. You do not need to rent a car here, everything is pretty close to the hotel. Don't pay no more than $90.00 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Colonnade twice within the past month. The first time I was on my own visiting a child at BU and the second time I was there with many family members, meeting there from all over. There were some interesting observations: Both times I was there, our alarm clocks went off in the middle of the night or pre-dawn hours. The first was at 4 am, the second at midnight. Very odd- this has never happened to me anywhere else I have stayed. I guess the housekeeping staff does not turned off the previous guests' settings on the clocks. In addition, a hotel alarm went off late at night during the second visit; the front desk reported it as a "communication failure." I'll say. Made for a lot of disturbed sleep. On the morning of our checkout, the maid could not wait to get her hands on the room and started a massive cleanup before we had checked out. We felt very rushed as a result and had no time for a shower. My brother and his family had it even worse; the maid woke them at 7:45 to clean their room, even though they were not even up yet and by no means had they checked out. When my sister made a small complaint at the hotel restaurant, the maitre de chastized her. A waiter later apologized. Let's hope the waiter finds a nicer man to work for. The bathroom doors in some of the hotel rooms allow for little privacy AND do not lock. (There is a one inch gap in between the two swinging doors.) Good thing I am comfortable with my family and am not too modest. Aside from the man at the restaurant (breakfast), the staff was wonderful, particularly the bellmen. The location is great and we got our rooms for a super price. Parking is stiff......and my blanket both times looked like a thrift store reject. I was afraid to look too closely. The first time I went, I got my room through Priceline for $100 and I would do that again- just give me a better, cleaner blanket and let me SLEEP!

Reviews.Title: “Fantabulous Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from our first trip to Boston. Despite mixed reviews we decided to stay at the Colonnade, mainly because of the high clean rating and the excellent location. I was pleasantly surprised when we arrived, the hotel was more then great. Our room was very spacious and the bathrooms, although small were immaculate everyday. The Concierge Peter was very helpful on choosing a birthday dinner spot, I only wished I spoke to him sooner on our visit. I would gladly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Boston and look forward to our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Will not return”
Reviews.Author: ginao
Reviews.Content: Terrible. My husband and I travel to Boston often, and like to try different hotels. Besides the very nice doorman, bellman, and location, this hotel was awful. No Valet?! $245/night and no valet. We were told to self park - $32/day. Well my husband missed the lot, and parked at another lot, just as close for $40.00 for the weekend. We also booked several months in advance and requested a king bed. When we checked in we were informed a king bed was not available. Desk staff very snooty, Heat did not work, could not adjust the thermostat. Room very small - bathroom tiny, Television VERY TINY. Housekeeping woke us up every morning talking in the hallways. No coffee pot in room. Mini bar was not restocked. $245/night and comparable to an old run down Holiday Inn. Next trip, I will go back to the Lenox!

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis”
Reviews.Author: jrleonardfl
Reviews.Content: I frequently travel on business and chose the Colonnade Hotel for its proximity to the Convention Center. This hotel exceeded my expectations in every way. I arrived much earlier than expected and intended only to leave my luggage with the bell captain and return later in the afternoon for check-in. I was told instead that a room could be made available to me in only an hour and suggested a late breakfast in Brasserie Jo's, their property restaurant! I not only received a great room with a chance to unpack and shower prior to meetings but the breakfast was to die for. (Dinner that evening was fantastic too). I would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Below expectations”
Reviews.Author: bordeaux8
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Collonade because of the recommendation in Frommer's guide book. It did not meet my expectations. My room looked out over a busy street and was very noisy. The walls/windows must not be well insulated because I was repeatedly awakened by honks and beeps at all hours of the night, despite being on the 11th floor. Brasserie Jo was also a disappointment. My "coq au vin" was a morass of soupy grey and dessert was bread pudding a la concrete.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the Colonnade”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay at the Colonnade over Memorial Day weekend in May 2004. We got a good deal through Priceline and had a clean, comfortable, quiet room on the 8th floor. The hotel is very convenient for sight-seeing in Boston. The Prudential T stop (subway) on the green line is directly in front of the hotel. It's also a short walk (5 minutes) to all the restaurants and shops on Boylston Street and Newbury Street in the Back Bay. In nice weather, it's a leisurely 20 minute walk to the Public Garden, Boston Common, and other tourist destinations. The hotel is also in the ideal location if you have business at the convention center across the street. We didn't really take advantage of the hotel facilities, so I can't comment much on that. However, the doorman was very helpful when we asked for restaurant recommendations in the neighborhood. Overall, it was a good deal for a high-quality hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “small, but nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Colonnade Hotel and had a good experience. After booking on priceline, I was nervous, but the Colonnade website is pretty accurate. Although, they do not show pictures of the standard rooms, which we stayed in. Overall, the hotel is in a good location and is very clean. The service is very good and the people are nice. Standard rooms are not bad if you get the right price. The bathrooms are small (in a standard room), but everything else is nice. The location is very convienant with the T and Prudential Center nearby. F.Y.I., the hotel allows pets. Fenway is within walking distance and everything else is accessible via the T, which is located right outside the hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Colonnade Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 120 Huntington Avenue, Boston, MA 02116
